Aeolaeka.name: Aeolaeka

Earthglide.name: Earthglide
Earthglide.description: An aeolaeka can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, the aeolaeka moves at their full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of their passing.

Liberate the Earth.name: Liberate the Earth
Liberate the Earth.description:
The aeolaeka conjures churning stones, creating a @Template[line|distance:60]{60-foot-long line} of rolling boulders that deals @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|traits:damaging-effect|dc:32] save, after which the area becomes difficult terrain for 24 hours before the leftover stone crumbles to dust. The aeolaeka can't Liberate the Earth for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Liberate the Earth]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the rubble (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 32).

Sacred Hammer.name: Sacred Hammer
Sacred Hammer.description: Any bludgeoning weapon becomes a holy striking weapon while the aeolaeka wields it.

Statue.name: Statue
Statue.description: Until the next time they act, the aeolaeka appears to be a statue. They have an automatic result of 45 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue.

Aeolaeka.publicNotes: Aeolaekas, also known as stone azatas, embody the slow but inevitable chaos of rock itself. Stone is often thought to be steadfast and unchanging, but, when viewed on a grander scale over vast periods of time, stone can transform into things as diverse as intricate crystals and fine powder. To the aeolaeka, anything that could become either sand or diamond is the very incarnation of the chaos of reality-just on a slower scale. As a result of their stone affinity, aeolaekas are less capricious than other azatas, and some have willingly forged lasting accords or agreements with mortals. Stone-skinned aeolaekas are sometimes mistaken for statues and use this fact to hide in plain sight when they don't want their presence known.

Afziaka Brute.name: Afziaka Brute

Grave-Bound Guts.name: Grave-Bound Guts
Grave-Bound Guts.description: While within 100 feet of its vrykolakas's burial ground, an afziaka appears in the natural shape it had when it was a regular animal and can eat normally. When farther away, it doesn't gain sustenance from eating food and eventually starves to death.

Hunger Pangs.name: Hunger Pangs
Hunger Pangs.description: A creature damaged by the afziaka's fangs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute. The creature can remove this condition earlier by consuming at least a handful of raw meat.

Afziaka Brute.publicNotes:
An afziaka brute arises from a horse, bull, or other large animal.

Vrykolakas vampires use animals as tools to carry their spirits when they would otherwise be slain. The animal usually dies as the vampire is reborn, but some live on in painful starvation.

Afziaka Stalker.name: Afziaka Stalker

Grave-Bound Guts.name: Grave-Bound Guts
Grave-Bound Guts.description: While within 100 feet of its vrykolakas's burial ground, an afziaka appears in the natural shape it had when it was a regular animal and can eat normally. When farther away, it doesn't gain sustenance from eating food and eventually starves to death.

Hunger Pangs.name: Hunger Pangs
Hunger Pangs.description: A creature damaged by the afziaka's fangs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour. The creature can remove this condition earlier by consuming at least a handful of raw meat.

Slip Between.name: Slip Between
Slip Between.description: The stalker teleports into an occupied space it can see within 50 feet and makes a melee Strike.

Afziaka Stalker.publicNotes:
Big predatory animals like dire wolves or hyaenodons might survive as an afziaka stalker, magically able to stalk their quarry.

Vrykolakas vampires use animals as tools to carry their spirits when they would otherwise be slain. The animal usually dies as the vampire is reborn, but some live on in painful starvation.

Agorron Guard.name: Agorron Guard

Dooming Touch.name: Dooming Touch
Dooming Touch.description: The Agorron guard's claws carry the accursed power of their foul gods. A creature hit by the guard's claw Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d10[void]] damage energy in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Wicked Blow.name: Wicked Blow
Wicked Blow.description: The Agorron guard makes a Strike with their scythe. A creature damaged by this attack takes @Damage[3d6[bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Agorron Guard.publicNotes:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

Ancient Skaveling.name: Ancient Skaveling

Echolocation 60 feet.name: Echolocation 60 feet
Echolocation 60 feet.description: The ancient skaveling can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range

Bone-Shattering Screech.name: Bone-Shattering Screech
Bone-Shattering Screech.description:
The skaveling unleashes a devastating screech that not only chills the bones but shatters them. The screech can be heard throughout the region and alerts all creatures in the Hanging Castle. Creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] take @Damage[12d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage must also attempt a @Check[will|dc:36|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save.

The skaveling can't use Bone-Shattering Screech again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Bone-Shattering Screech for 24 hours.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description:
Any creature hit by the skaveling's Strikes must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each save.

Ancient Skaveling.publicNotes:
Hideous necromantic rituals give rise to skavelings, or ghoul bats, monstrosities that are not true ghouls but instead are specifically crafted undead creatures. Their creators are the bloodsucking urdefhans of the Darklands, who create skavelings from giant bats specially raised on diets of toxic fungus and the flesh of ghouls-especially brains harvested from these undead. Upon reaching maturity, these giant bats are ritually slain via the use of cytillesh oil. While this poison simply rots away the flesh of most creatures, one of these specially prepared bats will immediately rise from death as a skaveling after succumbing to its effects.

Despite its tattered wings and sagging skin, a skaveling is more than capable of flight, even when carrying a creature mounted on its back-urdefhans often use skavelings as mounts in this way. Their intelligence is more advanced than that of the typical giant bat, and in combat they function more as allies than as mere mounts, capable of making their own tactical decisions. Yet even though they can reason and think, skavelings remain loyal to the urdefhans who created them, and they never take actions in a fight that would knowingly put their masters in harm's way.

Anguished Sarenite.name: Anguished Sarenite
Anguished Sarenite.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:28] to bring the spirit to its senses, or @Check[religion|dc:24] (expert) to banish it
Anguished Sarenite.hazarddescription: The gold religious symbol of a former priest of Sarenrae is haunted by the priest's tormented soul.

Solar Wrath.name: Solar Wrath
Solar Wrath.description:
Trigger A non-good creature approaches within 10 feet of the religious symbol

Effect The Sarenite summons a burst of spiritual flame in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30-foot radius}. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d8[spirit]] damage (@Check[will|dc:26|basic]). Creatures who fail this save are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and creatures who critically fail are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Animated Fireplace.name: Animated Fireplace
Animated Fireplace.publicNotes: Many animated objects have useful functions but become dangers when uncontrolled.

Construct Armor (Hardness 7).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 7)
Construct Armor (Hardness 7).description: Like normal objects, the animated fireplace has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the fireplace takes by 7. Once the animated fireplace is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 20.

Bellow Soot.name: Bellow Soot
Bellow Soot.description: The animated fireplace coughs out a cloud of soot, filling a @Template[emanation|distance:20]; creatures within the soot are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and creatures outside the cloud are concealed to creatures within it. Creatures that begin their turn within the cloud must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure); creatures immune to inhaled effects automatically succeed at this save. The fireplace can't Bellow Soot again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Bellow Soot]]{1d4轮}.

Fan the Flames.name: Fan the Flames
Fan the Flames.description: The animated fireplace releases a gout of flame in a @Template[cone|distance:30] that deals @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic]).

Construct Armor (Hardness 8).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 8)
Construct Armor (Hardness 8).description: Like normal objects, an animated tea cart has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the tea cart takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated tea cart is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 24.

Scald.name: Scald
Scald.description:
Frequency once per round

效果 The tea cart ejects piping-hot tea in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]).

Aquatic Ooze.name: Aquatic Ooze
Aquatic Ooze.publicNotes: These dangerous oozes are the bane of any who travel through swamps, marshes, or damp caves. Easily masquerading as pools of clear water or patches of wet stone, gray oozes lie in wait for unwary victims to reach down for a drink or step into what appears to be a puddle, then lash out with whiplike pseudopods to ensnare and consume their hapless prey.

Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
Motion Sense.description: A gray ooze can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

Puddled Ambush.name: Puddled Ambush
Puddled Ambush.description:
触发 A creature enters a space occupied by a gray ooze

需求 Initiative has not yet been rolled

效果 The gray ooze automatically notices the creature, then makes a pseudopod Strike against one creature adjacent to itself before rolling initiative.

Gray Ooze Acid.name: Gray Ooze Acid
Gray Ooze Acid.description: A gray ooze's acid damages only metal and organic materials, not stone.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: A creature hit by the ooze's pseudopod is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. A victim can attempt a new save to recover at the end of each of its turns.

Arboreal Snag.name: Arboreal Snag

Axe Vulnerability.name: Axe Vulnerability
Axe Vulnerability.description: An arboreal snag takes 5 additional damage from axes.

Putrid Sap.name: Putrid Sap
Putrid Sap.description: If the arboreal snag takes damage from a piercing attack, nauseating green pus spurts from the wound. Creatures within 10 feet of the snag must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure). Creatures that attempt this save are then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Arboreal Snag.publicNotes:
Arboreals can be victims of undeath like any other living creature, but without bones or flesh, their undead take a different form. When an arboreal shivers to life as undead, it often animates as a snag-a leafless, skeletal dead tree that haunts its forest, attacking any living creature it can catch. An arboreal snag is mindless and difficult to control, but some necromancers use them as forest guardians.

While many arboreals are comfortable remaining still for prolonged periods of time, arboreal snags tend to be restless, meandering in a region they consider their domain. This territory is sometimes evident from battered forest animals or trampled undergrowth that litters the ground, but forest creatures soon learn to avoid the area entirely. It doesn't take long for regions haunted by arboreal snags to grow desolate and unhealthy, and locals often dub such regions as haunted or cursed.

Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood).name: Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood)
Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood).hp: 虚能治疗, 汲血生根

Blood Roots.name: Blood Roots
Blood Roots.description: The snag's roots go deep into corpses buried beneath and around it. It has regeneration 5 (deactivated by vitality) as long as it remains in an area where corpses are buried.

Axe Vulnerability.name: Axe Vulnerability
Axe Vulnerability.description: An arboreal snag takes 5 additional damage from axes.

Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood).publicNotes:
Arboreals can be victims of undeath like any other living creature, but without bones or flesh, their undead take a different form. When an arboreal shivers to life as undead, it often animates as a snag-a leafless, skeletal dead tree that haunts its forest, attacking any living creature it can catch. An arboreal snag is mindless and difficult to control, but some necromancers use them as forest guardians.

While many arboreals are comfortable remaining still for prolonged periods of time, arboreal snags tend to be restless, meandering in a region they consider their domain. This territory is sometimes evident from battered forest animals or trampled undergrowth that litters the ground, but forest creatures soon learn to avoid the area entirely. It doesn't take long for regions haunted by arboreal snags to grow desolate and unhealthy, and locals often dub such regions as haunted or cursed.

Arghun the Annihilator.name: 歼灭者阿鲁浑 Arghun the Annihilator

Grip Throat.name: 锁喉 Grip Throat
Grip Throat.description: 中型或更小体型的生物被伏行之手@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}时很难说话，进行带有语言特征的动作时需要额外花费一个动作。

Mark Quarry.name: 标记猎物 Mark Quarry
Mark Quarry.description: 在伏行之手上涂上一滴指定目标的血液可以让伏行之手追踪指定猎物。若伏行之手当前没有猎物，那么下个被他伤害的生物会自动成为他的猎物。伏行之手在@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{搜索 Seek}猎物时的察觉检定，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{追踪 Tracks}猎物时的生存检定、打击猎物时的伤害检定上获得+1环境加值。

Arghun the Annihilator.publicNotes:
一般来说，当被切断的手被邪恶的亡灵能力赋予了模糊的感知能力，并被转化成成不知疲倦的杀手时，伏行之手就诞生了。当然，当一个生物在一个充满亡灵能力或虚能的地方失去了自己的手时，它的手也有可能自发转化成伏行之手。

伏行之手是来自中型生物的手掌，它们快速而灵巧，在阴影中快速移动，然后突袭猎物。

Ashes of Despair.name: Ashes of Despair
Ashes of Despair.hazarddescription: Swirling ashes fill the room and form into the semblance of a massive predatory bird that swoops upon those in the chamber, draining their life force away.
Ashes of Despair.reset: The haunt resets immediately when there are no creatures in area F9. Any previous successes from attempts to Disable the haunt persist when it's later triggered. After three successes, the haunt doesn't reset.

Shriek of Despair.name: Shriek of Despair
Shriek of Despair.description:
触发 Two or more creatures enter area F9

效果 A terrifying shriek of pain and suffering deals @Damage[(3d12+40)[mental]] damage to each creature within area F9, and each creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

大成功 The creature takes no damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}.

成功 The creature takes half damage and is frightened 1.

失败 The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}.

大失败 The creature takes double damage, is frightened 2, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Ashes of Despair.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:44] (master) to disrupt and counteract the shadow magic animating the ashes, or @Check[religion|dc:42] (master) to exorcise the animating spirit. Disabling the trap requires three successful checks, in any combination of Occultism and Religion checks.
Ashes of Despair.routine:
(1 动作) The shadowy shape sends streams of scouring ash toward the mouth, eyes, and nose of each creature in the room, dealing @Damage[(3d12+20)[slashing]] damage and requiring a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save. Creatures that don't need breathe can't be sickened by the haunt and creatures that don't see can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{目盲 Blinded} by it.

大成功 The creature takes no damage and is blinded for 1 round.

成功 The creature takes half damage, is blinded for 1 round, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}.

失败 The creature takes full damage, is blinded for 1 minute, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}.

大失败 The creature takes full damage, is blinded for 1 minute, is sickened 2, and is unable to use any spells or abilities with the verbal trait while it is sickened.

Azmakian Effigy.name: Azmakian Effigy

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: The Azmakian effigy exhales rusting gas in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. The gas deals @Damage[2d6|options:area-damage] damage to the highest-level metal item carried by every creature in the area, ignoring these items' Hardness (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect]); unattended metal items in the area take this damage automatically. The Azmakian effigy can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Powerful Charge.name: Powerful Charge
Powerful Charge.description: The Azmakian effigy Strides twice and then makes a horn Strike. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the Strike's damage is increased to @Damage[(3d10+10)[piercing]] damage.

Azmakian Effigy.publicNotes:
Xar-Azmak, the demonic Lord of Rust, was destroyed long ago by Dispater. Some weapons of his infernal legions remain and among the most infamous are Azmakian effigies: fearsome infernal constructs shaped in his image.

Although made of iron, an Azmakian effigy's exterior is thick with rust that flakes off as the construct moves and fights. Effigies charge into battle on massive hooves, impaling enemies on long, curving horns. The effigy's most well-known attack-and the ability that makes even the bravest warrior tremble-is their terrible rusting breath, which can reduce even legendary magical weapons to useless scrap. Wise adventurers attempt to fight an effigy at a distance, but these constructs are surprisingly swift and able to outrun many foes.

The secret to creating Azmakian effigies is thought to be lost, but infernal libraries might still contain the necessary rituals and list of ingredients. Xar-Azmak once commanded ranks of effigies that numbered in the thousands, but most of those who survived his destruction were trapped in Hell, where they were pursued by Dispater's forces and eventually destroyed. Those few who offered their services to Xar-Azmak's devoted worshippers on Golarion survived this purge. With the death of Xar-Azmak, much of the lore to repair the effigies was lost. When one of these constructs is found, they're often suffering some form of long-term damage.

Benefactor's End.name: Benefactor's End
Benefactor's End.disable: @Check[religion|dc:28] (expert) to drain away the haunt's void energy
Benefactor's End.hazarddescription: A spectral assailant drives a stake into a dying vampire's heart; the vampire collapses and releases a surge of void energy.
Benefactor's End.reset: Unless disabled, the haunt materializes again on the next moonrise.

Death Throes.name: Death Throes
Death Throes.description:
Trigger A creature touches the vampire's corpse

Effect A surge of void energy fills the room as the corpse lurches as though staked. The haunt deals @Damage[10d8[void]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of the corpse; this damage heals undead creatures for the same amount. Living creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. This drained condition is reduced by 1 after 10 minutes.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes drained 1.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Blaanlool.name: Blaanlool

Hook Shake.name: Hook Shake
Hook Shake.description:
需求 A creature adjacent to the marsh giant is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in water at least 1 foot deep

效果 The marsh giant uses its gaff to shake the creature back and forth and hold it underwater. The giant attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the target's Fortitude DC.

大成功 The target takes @Damage[(6d6+14)[piercing]] damage and loses 5 rounds' worth of air if they were holding their breath.

成功 The target takes @Damage[(3d6+14)[piercing]] damage and loses 3 rounds' worth of air if they were holding their breath.

失败 The target is unaffected.

大失败 As failure, but the giant drops its gaff as well.

Twist the Hook.name: Twist the Hook
Twist the Hook.description: The marsh giant makes a melee Strike with its gaff. If it hits, it twists and yanks the gaff to create an awful wound, dealing 3d6 persistent bleed damage to the creature.

Blaanlool.publicNotes:
Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants are hideous in appearance indeed, with fishlike mouths, slimy gray-green skin, and dark, beady eyes. They prefer to eat the flesh of those they slay in battle, but many are also cannibals. It is perhaps this vicious behavior that keeps the creatures in check, for if a fellow marsh giant becomes too dangerous and powerful, it runs the risk of being ambushed and consumed by its clan.

Marsh giants are insular and mysterious, dedicating much of their lives to zealous worship of sea-dwelling deities or stranger entities. While there is no central religion followed by all marsh giants, many are known to venerate the demon lord Dagon, while others worship even more powerful monstrosities from the Elder Mythos, such as distant, dreaming Cthulhu.

Only rarely do more than a dozen marsh giants settle together in a location, but when they do it is often for a religious purpose. Whatever call from the deep draws them together also tugs at nearby creatures such as boggards or skum, who look upon marsh giants in fear and reverence. The grim, terrifying chants and screams coming from such an encampment are a sure sign of terror to come for any other residents of the area.

Barely topping 11 feet tall and 1,000 pounds, marsh giants are small for giants but make up for their relatively diminutive stature with their zealotry.

Bloodshroud.name: Bloodshroud
Bloodshroud.publicNotes: During the war between Geb and Nex, necromancers conducted dangerous magical experiments to gain every possible advantage over their enemies. One such endeavor attempted to distill the essence of vampiric mists to create a protective shroud for an army of undead maguses.

Bloodshift.name: Bloodshift
Bloodshift.description:
触发 A creature within 30 feet of the bloodshroud takes damage

效果 The bloodshroud transports itself and any items it's carrying to any unoccupied space adjacent to the triggering creature.

Sanguine Shroud.name: Sanguine Shroud
Sanguine Shroud.description:
The bloodshroud is enveloped by a shroud of flowing blood. If a creature deals damage to a bloodshroud with a melee Strike or touches the bloodshroud, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save. Any temporary Hit Points the bloodshroud gains from Sanguine Shroud fade after 1 hour.

大成功 As success, but the creature becomes temporarily immune to Sanguine Shroud for 24 hours.

成功 The creature is unaffected.

失败 The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and takes @Damage[2d6[bleed]] damage. The bloodshroud gains 15 temporary Hit Points.

大失败 As failure, but the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, and the bloodshroud gains 25 temporary Hit Points.

Spellstrike.name: Spellstrike
Spellstrike.description:
Frequency until recharged

效果 The bloodshroud channels a spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll into a claw or greatsword Strike. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into the bloodshroud's attack instead. The bloodshroud makes a melee Strike with a weapon or claw. The spell is coupled with the bloodshroud's attack, using the attack roll result to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of determining the bloodshroud's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty is not applied until after the Spellstrike. Using Bloodshift automatically recharges the bloodshroud's Spellstrike.

Bone Shard Tough.name: 骨片帮暴徒 Bone Shard Tough

Puncture.name: 穿刺 Puncture
Puncture.description:
需求 暴徒手上拿着两根骨片

效果 暴徒尝试用其中一根骨片将另一根锤进一个生物的体内。暴徒进行一次@Check[athletics|defense:reflex]检定对抗目标的反射DC。若命中，目标受到上面列出的骨片伤害和@Damage[1d4[bleed]]伤害。

Bulette.name: Bulette
Bulette.publicNotes:
Bulettes are fearsome predators that roam just beneath the surface of desolate wilderness areas. When they burrow through the ground, only the fin of their thickly armored backs protrudes above-at least until they are ready to leap out and strike their prey. Their appearance, appetite, and iconic dorsal fin have earned the nickname "landshark."

A typical bulette claims a territory of approximately 500 square miles. When it finds an area rich in food, such as a farming village, it adds that area to its regular patrol route. Over the course of a few months, it can wipe entire settlements off the map. Bulettes are fiercely competitive creatures that battle relentlessly with other predators in their territory. They actively avoid contact or conflict with other members of their kind unless seeking a mate. Bulette pairs share territory and mate for life-a mated pair of bulettes being the only known exception to the creature's penchant for solitude. They rear their young for a short period of time. The mated pair instruct the young bulette how to hunt, teaching their spawn which creatures are easiest to kill and which creatures to avoid. The mated pair drive off their young after its first successful hunt.

The first bulettes were magically created guardians, intended to serve as frightening pets for a power-hungry and sadistic wizard. The technique for their creation, as well as their original purpose, has since been lost to history, and multiple conflicting accounts of ancient texts exist with dozens of wizards claiming to have been the first inventor of the notorious beast. Some sages postulate that the original inventor may have been an elf-a theory born out of little more than the curious fact that bulettes, for all their ravenous nature, seem to find elf flesh unpalatable. Unfortunately for elves who stumble into a bulette's path, bulettes are no less likely to kill them than any other intruder, simply leaving the bodies unconsumed where they fall.

Corpse Eater.name: Corpse Eater
Corpse Eater.description: These bulettes prefer the taste of necrotic flesh and bone; their favorite prey is undead.

Favored Prey.name: Favored Prey
Favored Prey.description: A bulette gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls with its jaws against a specific type of creature designated as its favorite food. Unless otherwise stated, a bulette's favored prey is halflings. Elves are never a favored prey for bulettes.

Leaping Charge.name: Leaping Charge
Leaping Charge.description: The bulette attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. If it's adjacent to an enemy at the apex of its High Jump or at the end of its Long Jump, it can make a claw Strike against the enemy at that moment. If the bulette jumps at least 5 feet vertically or at least 20 feet horizontally, it can attempt two claw Strikes instead of one. The bulette's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until it has made all the claw Strikes that are part of its Leaping Charge.

Powerful Jumper.name: Powerful Jumper
Powerful Jumper.description: A bulette jumps 10 feet up on a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}, or 20 feet up on a critical success.

Bursting Bone Vault.name: 崩塌的白骨金库 Bursting Bone Vault
Bursting Bone Vault.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20] (受训) 或 @Check[stealth|dc:20] (受训) 来小心地打开大门而不扰动骨堆。
Bursting Bone Vault.hazarddescription: 在大门滑开的那一刻，这间塞满骨头的金库将它的内容物喷涌而出。

Collapse.description:
触发 一个生物打开通往金库的门

效果 骨堆从金库中洒出，涌入临近的走廊，对距离门10尺内的所有生物造成@Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic]豁免）。该区域变为困难地形。
Collapse.name: 崩塌 Collapse

Charghar.name: 受烹恶鬼 Charghar

Malevolent Mishaps.name: 恶性事故 Malevolent Mishaps
Malevolent Mishaps.description:
10尺。受烹恶鬼会让它附近的人变得笨拙且犹疑。所有在灵光内开始回合的生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:21]豁免。

成功 该生物临时免疫本灵光1 分钟；

失败 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，直至他的下一回合开始。若该生物还是活物，则受烹恶鬼对其使用灌输恐惧能力；

大失败 如同失败，但是获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}。

Create Spawn.name: 创造衍体 Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description: 任何被受烹恶鬼杀死且被弃尸锅炉、烤箱、坩埚或类似物品附近的类人生物将在第二天天亮时重生为拥有自由意志的受烹恶鬼。

Impart Fears.name: 灌输恐惧 Impart Fears
Impart Fears.description:
被受烹恶鬼的幽灵厨具打击命中的活物，或在对抗恶性事故灵光的豁免中失败的生物，必须进行@Check[will|dc:21]豁免。被本能力影响的生物，每日可以尝试一次新的豁免来结束本能力的效果。

成功 该生物临时免疫本能力24小时；

失败 该生物在摄入任何物品或准备食物或饮料时都会获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}

大失败 如同失败，但是获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}，且该生物无法将惊惧值降到1 以下。

Charghar.publicNotes:
在盖布，常有都市传说警告人们小心那些被活活烹煮而死之人的复仇魂魄，它们统一被称为受烹恶鬼。虽然很多盖布人食人时不加烹饪，但也有一些不死生物在过了数个世纪后厌倦了一成不变的食谱（并因此尝试烹煮活人）。这个国家中也有一些生者选择同类相食：要么是迫不得已而烹食邻居与血亲的落魄之人，要么是出于时髦而大啖此等菜肴的社会精英。不论因为何种原因烹饪活人，这些行为都会创造出这类复仇心切的不死生物，它们潜伏于准备食物的地方，诱使厨师犯下粗心或致命的错误。

受烹恶鬼有着幽灵般的类人外形，而实际样貌则与它们被煮熟后的样子差不多——烧焦的遗骸、血淋淋的尸体周边飘着屠宰好的没有实体的肉块、或是煮熟骨头的松散结合体。

Chattering Jaws.name: 叨念颚骨 Chattering Jaws

Incessant Chattering.name: 喋喋不休 Incessant Chattering
Incessant Chattering.description: 颚骨总是在一个预定的时间开始叨叨，比如某日特定的时间，或是响应触发条件，如注意到30尺内有生物时。在这些时候，60尺内的所有生物都能自动听到叨念颚骨。

Gnashing Rage.name: 切齿狂暴 Gnashing Rage
Gnashing Rage.description: 当叨念颚骨被摧毁时，30尺内所有能看到或听到叨念颚骨的其他活化骨骼都会获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened}状态1分钟。活化骨骼可以使用这个额外动作来行走或打击。

Chattering Jaws.publicNotes:
通常，叨念颚骨除了通过咔嚓咔嚓地咬牙让人不安外毫无用途。有些叨念颚骨只在固定的时间间隔上叨叨，以帮助计时。

常常被误认为不死生物，活化骨骼是一种与死灵术毫无关系的无心智构装体。以下几种是典型的活化骨骼样例。

Cleansing Fire.name: Cleansing Fire
Cleansing Fire.hazarddescription: Sheets of fire and vitality energy blast through the room in waves that obliterate the undead and scorch the living.
Cleansing Fire.reset: The sacred fire disappears 1 minute after no creatures are in the room, and the trap immediately resets

Holy Flame Burst.name: Holy Flame Burst
Holy Flame Burst.description:
Trigger A creature tries to open the door to area C6

Effect Magical fire and vitality energy flood the room with a harmonious roar. All creatures in the room take @Damage[3d12[fire],3d12[vitality]]{3d12 fire damage and 3d12 vitality damage} and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:39] save with the results below. The trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and @Damage[1d12[persistent,fire]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, @Damage[1d12[persistent,fire]] damage, and @Damage[1d12[persistent,vitality]] damage.

Cleansing Fire.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:41] (master) to bleed away the trap's energy, or @Check[religion|dc:39] (expert) to recite the appropriate prayers to Urgathoa to stop the trap (Pesabnet knows these prayers and automatically succeeds at checks to recite them). Disabling the trap requires three successful checks, in any combination of Thievery and Religion checks.
Cleansing Fire.routine:
(1 action) A wall of sacred fire washes back and forth throughout the room, bathing every inch of the space in holy power and dealing @Damage[3d12[fire],3d12[vitality]]{3d12 fire damage 3d12 vitality damage}. Each creature in the trap's area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:39] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes double damage.

Critical Failure If the creature has void healing, it is instantly destroyed. Otherwise, it takes double damage and @Damage[1d12[persistent,fire]] damage.

Clockwork Rifler.name: Clockwork Rifler

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
24 hours, [[/act disable-device dc=22]]{DC 22 Thievery}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.

Bayonet Charge.name: Bayonet Charge
Bayonet Charge.description: The clockwork rifler Strides twice and Strikes with its bayonet.

Clockwork Rifler.publicNotes:
These diligent machines guard their assigned posts tirelessly. A typical clockwork soldier stands 6 feet tall and consists of 500 pounds of metal and magic.

Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner.

Cobblebone Swarm.name: 骨砾群 Cobblebone Swarm

Hatred for Secret Doors.name: 憎恨暗门 Hatred for Secret Doors
Hatred for Secret Doors.description: 骨砾群对于暗门、隐藏抽屉或任何掩盖隐蔽空间的东西充满恨意，因为这些东西让它们想起了自己被困于石头内的数年乃至数十年。它们在@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{破拆 Force Open}暗门的运动检定上获得+5环境加值。

Jutting Bones.name: 凹凸骨 Jutting Bones
Jutting Bones.description: 骨砾群占据的空间为困难地形。

Phantasmal Pummeling.name: 魅影敲击 Phantasmal Pummeling
Phantasmal Pummeling.description: 位于骨砾群占据空间内的每个敌人都会受到@Damage[1d6[bludgeoning],1d6[void]]{1d6钝击伤害和1d6虚能伤害}（@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]豁免）。

Settlement Bound.name: 缚于定居点 Settlement Bound
Settlement Bound.description: 一个典型的骨砾群必须留在它的发源的定居点，并且只能在离定居点不超过1英里的地方移动而不至于散成碎片，如果它的碎片被送回这个区域，它就会复活。偶尔，骨砾群会被束缚在一个特定的建筑、道路或行政区，而不是一个定居点。

Cobblebone Swarm.publicNotes:
灰悼城（Graydirge）的死灵师兼建筑师曾使用一种可怕的撕裂工艺来将血肉与灵魂从大部分建筑用骨骼上剥离，但现今的建造者们没有此类骇人且高效的魔法。当作祟的骨骼与普通材料一起被嵌入建筑物中时，附近的砖块和鹅卵石就会被注入死灵能量。如果没人驱除萦绕在骸骨上的魂魄，它们就会受困并陷入迷茫，其身份与记忆混杂于一起。几年后，它们就会形成骨砾群，由砖石和骨骼组成的恶毒作祟混合体。这些一心复仇的生物发出鬼魅般的声音，引诱受害者走进狭窄的小巷或进入黑暗的石质地下室，在那里将受害者们敲打致死，并将他们的遗体复盖在成堆的骨头和砖块之下。

有些人会把骨砾群误认为石螨群，但是灰悼城的居民们知道要寻找附近的幻象，或在你看向别处时偷偷移动的铆钉骨。这些都是骨砾群存在的确凿证据，也在指示人们应该选条不同的路线前往目的地。

骨砾群看上去像是一堆简易的砖块与卵石，其上嵌着弯曲的骨头，形态通常为一张粗糙的脸庞。当它们滚动或在空中缓慢漂浮时，会在身后留下一个幽灵般的残影。

Collapsing Bridge.name: Collapsing Bridge
Collapsing Bridge.hazarddescription: An iron bridge's connectors give way to drop into the lake below.

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
触发 A Small or larger creature moves more than 20 feet onto the bridge

效果 The bridge chains detach from their connectors, dropping itself and anything on it into the lake 150 feet below. A creature that's adjacent to the ledges to the north or south can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:33] save to Grab the Edge, but creatures who can't reach the edge fall with the bridge into the toxic water below (unless one side of the bridge remains attached, in which case a creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} by clinging to the dangling bridge-requiring a successful @Check[athletics|dc:20|traits:action:climb] check to climb the hanging bridge to safety).

Collapsing Bridge.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:Disable Quick Release Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable one side of the bridge's quick release mechanisms

Creeping Crone.name: Creeping Crone

Walking Stick.name: Walking Stick
Walking Stick.description: A creeping crone can spend 1 day enchanting her walking stick with the powers of a +2 striking greater staff of necromancy. A crone replaces any material component of an occult spell she casts by using the walking stick as a focus component instead. The walking stick's magic functions only for the crone who created it; for anyone else, it's a mundane stick. If the crone enchants a new walking stick, the previous stick loses all its powers.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The creeping crone can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman, changing her walking stick to suit her new appearance. This doesn't change her Speed or Strikes, but it might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Stick Support.name: Stick Support
Stick Support.description: If a creeping crone is deprived of her walking stick, her Speed is reduced to 5 feet (though she can use some other Speed she gains, such as from her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly} spell) until she recovers her walking stick or fashions another.

Discipline the Righteous.name: Discipline the Righteous
Discipline the Righteous.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The creeping crone critically hits a good creature with her walking stick Strike

Effect The target takes @Damage[2d8[bleed]] damage.

Creeping Crone.publicNotes: Hags are neither immortal nor unageing; if not slain by an enemy, a hag eventually succumbs to old age. A hag who dies in agony or rage can rise again as a witchfire, while those who die of old age might rise again as an undead creature known as a creeping crone. A creeping crone has lost far more than her life; they can't form or join covens, denying them one of a living hag's most distinguishing abilities. This inability, more than their rotting bodies or hunger for flesh, makes creeping crones exiled among their former kin.

Crooked Coffin Brewer.name: 歪盖棺材酿酒师 Crooked Coffin Brewer

Chug.name: 一口闷 Chug
Chug.description:
需求 酿酒师正拿着一壶麦芽酒

效果 酿酒师通过交互动作来快速喝下壶里的酒。在1分钟内，酿酒师在运动技能检定、伤害骰和对抗恐惧的豁免骰上获得+2物品加值，但同时也会获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zBbmuudbWY8FaOwZ]{效果：一口闷}

Hasty Impediment.name: 仓促阻隔 Hasty Impediment
Hasty Impediment.description:
需求 酿酒师邻接一个木桶、板条箱、椅子、桌子或类似的木制物品

效果 酿酒师将物品扔出至多15尺远，该物体破碎并爆散成范围@Template[burst|distance:5]的碎片。碎片覆盖区域的所有生物受到@Damage[2d6[piercing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic]豁免），且该区域变为困难地形。

Crystallized Agony.name: Crystallized Agony
Crystallized Agony.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) or @Check[survival|dc:35] (master) to know where to Strike a specific crystal perfectly on a facet to cause it to shatter harmlessly
Crystallized Agony.hazarddescription: A violet crystal containing the body of a dead creature, grown from its dying agony, pulses as it exudes motes of flickering energy.

Emit Agony.name: Emit Agony
Emit Agony.description:
Trigger The crystallized agony is struck hard enough to take damage

Effect A shimmering mote of violet light flashes from the point of origin from the triggering action, unerringly striking the triggering creature. This bolt of agony deals @Damage[10d10[mental]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic]).

Crystallized Agony.reset: A crystallized agony resets automatically and can be triggered again the next round.

Decrosia.name: Decrosia
Decrosia.publicNotes:
Rust hags have a knack for technology. They make their homes in hollowed-out factories, abandoned tenements, and other sites of urban decay.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
Decrosia.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: A rust hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0fYE64odlKqISzft]{Rusting Grasp}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct} to her coven's spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The rust hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Hagshot.name: Hagshot
Hagshot.description: Any firearm wielded by a rust hag gains the benefits of +1 striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} runes, and it functions properly no matter how rusty it gets. In addition, when a rust hag critically hits a target with a firearm, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}.

Rusting Touch.name: Rusting Touch
Rusting Touch.description: A rust hag's touch causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If the hag succeeds at a Strike with her claw, she deals [[/r 2d6 #Rusting Touch Damage]] damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the hag hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against the hag's claw attack, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item is rusted on that attack. Objects made of skymetal, such as adamantine and orichalcum, are immune to rusting touch.

Demilich Skull.name: Demilich Skull
Demilich Skull.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:26], @Check[occultism|dc:26], @Check[nature|dc:26], or @Check[religion|dc:26] to counteract the skull's Broken Gems
Demilich Skull.hazarddescription: The skull of a defeated demilich is haunted by souls of the demilich's victims.

Broken Gems.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches within 10 feet of the skull

Effect The spirits haunting the skull activate one of the skull's ruined gemstones, casting one of the following four spells determined randomly:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OdqM06M0wDUqZWiR]{Cast into Time}, @Check[fortitude|dc:26|traits:divination]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TDNlDWbYb58Y55Da]{Chain Lightning}, @Check[reflex|dc:26|traits:electricity,evocation|basic] (@Damage[8d12[electricity]] damage)
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} (6th), @Check[reflex|dc:26|traits:fire,evocation|basic] (@Damage[12d6[fire]] damage)
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack}, @Check[will|dc:26|traits:abjuration,curse,force] (@Damage[2d12[persistent,force]] or @Damage[(2*2d12)[persistent,force]] damage)

The saving throw DC for any spell is 26.

Dirge Piper.name: 悼歌吹奏者 Dirge Piper

Slow.name: 缓慢 Slow
Slow.description: 丧尸永久陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}且无法使用反应动作。

Piping Dirge.name: 吹奏悼歌 Piping Dirge
Piping Dirge.description: 30尺。进入灵光或在灵光范围内开始回合的活物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，且身处灵光范围内时无法将惊惧值降至1以下。

Putrid Blast.name: 腐臭鸣爆 Putrid Blast
Putrid Blast.description: 悼歌吹奏者从它裸露的内脏中释出由空气和胆汁。@Template[emanation|distance:30]范围内的所有非丧尸生物受到@Damage[4d6[sonic]]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还额外获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（大失败获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}）。悼歌吹奏者在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Putrid Blast]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用本能力。

Shambler's Lament.name: 蹒跚者的哀叹 Shambler's Lament
Shambler's Lament.description: 悼歌吹奏者通过它腐烂的口器发出一声阴森的哀嚎，促使附近的丧尸更加卖力地进食。距离悼歌吹奏者10尺范围内的其他丧尸会获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened}状态1轮，并可以使用额外的行动作来擒获、行走或打击。

Dirge Piper.publicNotes:
在罕见情况下，试图将一个技艺精湛的音乐家或演员复活成无心智的丧尸会受到遗留的异能魔法的阻碍，其将该生物的一小片艺术灵魂锚定于它蹒跚的尸体上。由此产生的悼歌吹奏者零散地保留了此人生前的智力和个性，但协调性和敏锐度的缺乏让它们再也无法创造出真正的音乐。相反，它们迫使空气通过其腐烂身躯的空腔和器官，产生令人不安的笛声、静噪声和小号声。

大多数悼歌吹奏者执着于生前的时尚感，经常纠结于他们的衣服状况。它们充分理解到自己的身体正在不断恶化，以至于身体上不断进行的腐烂将它们推入更深的绝望。对悼歌吹奏者来说，唯一比它们的遗骸更令人不安的是它们自己创造的音乐。尽管它们讨厌自己发出的声音，但它们不能自已地从自己的嘴里和伤口处持续地发出噪音。

尽管许多死灵师认为嘈杂的悼歌吹奏者是个错误，但它们作为其他丧尸群的领导者时相当有用，因为它们的吹奏会振奋行尸同伴。甚至，它们腐臭的号声爆鸣也会以不伤害其他丧尸的方式共鸣。

Drusilla.name: Drusilla

Axan Walk.name: Axan Walk
Axan Walk.description: Drusilla ignores non-magical difficult and greater difficult terrain within Axan Wood.

Befuddling Lash.name: Befuddling Lash
Befuddling Lash.description: When Drusilla damages a creature with her tail, a wave of befuddlement clouds the target's thoughts. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

Manipulate Luck.name: Manipulate Luck
Manipulate Luck.description:
Drusilla touches another creature to manipulate the creature's luck. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. On a failure, Drusilla chooses good luck or bad luck. If she chooses good luck, the affected creature can roll twice on one d20 roll within the next day and use the higher result; this is a fortune effect. If Drusilla chooses bad luck, the creature must roll twice and use the lower result on its next d20 roll; this is a misfortune effect. Once Drusilla has affected a target with Manipulate Luck, that target is temporarily immune to Manipulate Luck from any huldra for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WKQNGK6hd5O7uLC1]{Effect: Manipulate Luck - Drusilla (Good)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zzdOof9hHUf9s13H]{Effect: Manipulate Luck (Bad)}

Drusilla.publicNotes:
At first glance, a huldra seems a simple creature-a human in plain robes or peasant dress, sporting long, unbound hair. These tresses and full skirts in fact disguise the huldra's supernatural features: a hollow wooden back, a long bovine tail, and incredible strength.

Folk legends from the lands of the north describe huldras as the creations of troll witches, intended to lure potential meals to the slaughter. Indeed, a huldra's regeneration is so similar to a troll's that a link between the two creatures seems entirely possible, but huldras despise trolls and resent tales suggesting any connection between them. Rather, huldras are wardens of the woodlands they occupy. Grown from saplings by powerful forest-dwelling fey as a response to humanoid encroachment, huldras protect and parley for the forest itself. Woodland creatures adore huldras, and sometimes approach humans or elves thinking they're huldras. This illusion is shattered if the animal sees the humanoid's back is made of flesh or that they're lacking a tail, at which point the animal recoils and runs away.

Huldras respond well to travelers who show respect and deference for the forest, bestowing those they favor with supernatural luck and fortune. Those who scorn or attack a huldra, or those who mock their distinctive, bovine tails, find themselves plagued by poor decisions and even worse luck. Huldras commonly carry a bad reputation as sirens of the deep forest-cunning monsters who seek to lure woodcutters and unwary adventurers to uncertain ends. These stories largely come from miscreants foolish enough to have treated a huldra rudely and later complain about how they were unjustly persecuted. Even woodcutters and hunters can stay in the good graces of huldras provided they plant few trees to replace what they've taken and don't kill any creatures they don't eat.

Though huldras choose to appear unassuming, the attention they put into disguising the supernatural parts of their bodies is sometimes lacking when it comes to their strength. They often perform feats of strength, like bending horseshoes straight or lifting heavy objects, without realizing they're breaking their carefully crafted facade.

Facetbound Cascader.name: Facetbound Cascader
Facetbound Cascader.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Implanted Stone.name: Implanted Stone
Implanted Stone.description: A cascader's aeon stone can't be Disarmed or removed until the cascader is destroyed.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Energy Ward.name: Energy Ward
Energy Ward.description:
Trigger The facetbound cascader would take acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage

Effect The cascader gains resistance 15 to the triggering damage, replacing any other resistance gained from this ability. Most facetbound cascaders begin combat with resistance 15 to cold.

Energy Charge.name: Energy Charge
Energy Charge.description: The cascader's melee Strikes deal an additional 4d10 damage of the type resisted by its Energy Ward.

Energy Shift.name: Energy Shift
Energy Shift.description: The cascader can alter its spell damage. If the next action it uses is to Cast a Spell that deals acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage, the cascader can change the damage type to match its Energy Ward instead of the spell's normal damage type (replacing the spell's corresponding trait).

Facetbound Cascader.publicNotes:
Facetbound cascaders must have been arcane spellcasters in life; in undeath, they draw upon the power of embedded orange prism aeon stones to defend themselves from magical damage and redirect that energy toward their opponents. Despite their incredible intelligence, facetbound cascaders have few memories of their former lives and typically serve the whims of their creator.

Inspired by the work of the Azlanti and their obsessions with aeon stones, certain necromancers strive to tap into those curious magical items to create undead with powerful abilities. A facetbound is created from a living being with an aeon stone surgically attached to their skull who is killed in a specific, secret ritual. Each facetbound must bear a single aeon stone, and this stone determines the powers the facetbound wields (in place of the normal powers of the implanted stone)

Facetbound Nullifier.name: Facetbound Nullifier

Implanted Stone.name: Implanted Stone
Implanted Stone.description: A nullifier's aeon stone can't be Disarmed or removed until the nullifier is destroyed.

Always Ready.name: Always Ready

Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

The nullifier can also make attacks of opportunity against concentrate actions to Cast a Spell, and it disrupts that action on any hit, not just a critical hit.

Defensive Dispel.name: Defensive Dispel
Defensive Dispel.description:
Trigger The nullifier is the target of a spell

Effect The nullifier attempts to counteract the triggering spell, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 #Counteract]]{+27}. This can be used only on spells that target the nullifier, not area spells that don't have targets. If it succeeds, it counteracts the spell for all targets, if other creatures were targeted in addition to the nullifier.

Field of Force.name: Field of Force
Field of Force.description: A nullifier's melee Strikes deal an additional 2d10 force damage (already included in the Strikes above).

Sever Spell.name: Sever Spell
Sever Spell.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The nullifier makes a melee Strike against a target. If the attack hits, the nullifier attempts to counteract a spell or magical effect on the target (of the nullifier's choice), with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27]]{+27}. The target is temporarily immune to Sever Spell for 24 hours.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

The nullifier can also make attacks of opportunity against concentrate actions to Cast a Spell, and it disrupts that action on any hit, not just a critical hit.

Facetbound Nullifier.publicNotes:
Designed to serve as devastatingly powerful foot soldiers against enemies with plentiful magic, facetbound nullifiers shear through magical effects as easily as they slice through flesh and bone. The pale lavender ellipsoid aeon stones they bear are sunk deep into their heads and surrounded by an ugly bruise.

Inspired by the work of the Azlanti and their obsessions with aeon stones, certain necromancers strive to tap into those curious magical items to create undead with powerful abilities. A facetbound is created from a living being with an aeon stone surgically attached to their skull who is killed in a specific, secret ritual. Each facetbound must bear a single aeon stone, and this stone determines the powers the facetbound wields (in place of the normal powers of the implanted stone)

Ghostly Mob.name: Ghostly Mob
Ghostly Mob.publicNotes: When a horrific tragedy results in mass death, the restless spirits of the numerous dead might arise as a ghostly mob. Like other ghosts, ghostly mobs are often unaware they're dead. The spirits trapped within the mob may try to carry out a semblance of their former lives, even though their memories are fragmentary and their forms are insubstantial. When forced to confront their true state, the spirits lash out in pain and violence.

Site Bound.name: Site Bound
Site Bound.description: A ghostly mob can stray only a moderate distance from where its members were killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 240 feet.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a ghostly mob is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2d4 days}, fully healed. A ghostly mob can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the troop from resting.

Clutching Hands.name: Clutching Hands
Clutching Hands.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The troop attacks enemies within 5 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]), with damage depending on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+3)[void]] damage

2 @Damage[(3d6+6)[void]] damage

3 @Damage[(4d6+9)[void]] damage

Frightful Chorus.name: Frightful Chorus
Frightful Chorus.description: The ghostly mob howls in anguish, forcing each living creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] to attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). Regardless of the save result, the creature is then temporarily immune to the troop's Frightful Chorus for 1 minute.

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: Whenever the ghostly mob Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), and then moves. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any of the ghostly mob's squares enter difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole group.

In addition, the antipaladin deals 4 extra damage of the chosen type with their Strikes against the triggering creature until the end of the antipaladin's turn. An enemy damaged from the ghoul antipaladin's Destructive Vengeance also takes @Damage[4[persistent,spirit]] damage; this applies only to the damage the reaction itself deals to the triggering creature, not the damage the antipaladin deals with subsequent Strikes.

阶段6 dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living non-elf creature hit by a ghoul crocodile's tail must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul gnawer is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghoul gnawer devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[5d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Drain Corpse.name: Drain Corpse
Drain Corpse.description:
Frequency once per day

触发 The ghoul gnawer uses Consume Flesh

效果 In addition to gaining Hit Points, using Consume Flesh refreshes one spell slot the cultist has already expended.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

阶段1 carrier with no effect（1天）

阶段2 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and regains half as many hit Points from all healing（1天）

阶段3 as stage 2（1天）

阶段4 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing（1天）

阶段5 as stage 4（1天）

阶段6 dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul gnawer's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Ghoul Razorclaw.name: 食尸鬼剃爪 Ghoul Razorclaw

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:31] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The ghoul razorclaw deals an extra 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attacker.name: Surprise Attacker
Surprise Attacker.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the ghoul razorclaw.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The ghoul razorclaw jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Deny Advantage.name: 否认优势 Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: The razorclaw isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 13th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[7d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Adamantine Edges.name: 精金刃锋 Adamantine Edges
Adamantine Edges.description: The ghoul's claws have been dipped in adamantine. The razorclaw treats any object they hit with a claw Strike as if it had half as much Hardness and any creature they hit as if they had half as much physical resistance.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:31]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Ghoul Razorclaw.publicNotes: Ghoul assassins who survive dipping their claws in molten adamantine transform into razorclaws.

Glyph of Warding (B8).name: Glyph of Warding (B8)
Glyph of Warding (B8).hazarddescription: A magical glyph flashes before triggering a spell.

Discharge Glyph.name: Discharge Glyph
Discharge Glyph.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door between area B8 and B7

Effect A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]{Noise Blast}, heightened to 6th level (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|traits:damaging-effect,spell,sonic,evocation], @Damage[6d10[sonic]] damage), is centered on the creature opening the door. The sound alerts all creatures in the tower.

Glyph of Warding (B8).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] (trained) to disable the glyph, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank, counteract DC 33) to counteract the glyph

Glyph of Warding (D5).name: Glyph of Warding (D5)
Glyph of Warding (D5).hazarddescription: A magical glyph flashes before triggering a spell.

Discharge Glyph.name: Discharge Glyph
Discharge Glyph.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door to area D6

Effect The creature is targeted by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} spell (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic|traits:force,necromancy,spell], @Damage[16d6[force]] damage).

Glyph of Warding (D5).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:34] (trained) to disable the glyph, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank, counteract DC 34) to counteract the glyph

Devastator.name: Devastator
Devastator.description: Grace's Strikes ignore 10 points of a creature's resistance to physical damage.

Celestial Rage.name: Celestial Rage
Celestial Rage.description:
Requirements Grace isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect Grace unleashes her inner fury. She gains 20 temporary Hit Points that last until her Celestial Rage ends and she casts one divine innate spell or focus spell she knows. While raging, she gains weakness to unholy 10, gains a +10-foot status bonus to her Speed, and takes a -1 penalty to AC. She can't use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. This Celestial Rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies Grace can perceive, or until she falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first. When the Celestial Rage ends, Grace can't use Celestial Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Celestial Rage}

Great Cleave.name: Great Cleave
Great Cleave.description: When Grace's melee Strike reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, she can make a melee Strike against another foe adjacent to that creature. If that Strike also reduces the creature to 0 Hit Points, she can continue making melee Strikes until she makes a Strike that doesn't reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points, or until there are no creatures adjacent to the most recent creature she attacked while cleaving, whichever comes first.

Rhino Charge.name: Rhino Charge
Rhino Charge.description: Grace Strides twice; if she ends her movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, she can make a melee Strike against that enemy. Grace can Fly instead of Stride if she has a fly speed (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kRsmUlSWhi6PJvZ7]{Angelic Wings}).

Graelar the Whisper.name: Graelar the Whisper

Dooming Touch.name: Dooming Touch
Dooming Touch.description: The tomb giant's claws carry the accursed power of their foul gods. A creature hit by the tomb giant's claw Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d12[void]] damage in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic]); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Slippery Fighter.name: Slippery Fighter
Slippery Fighter.description: Graelar moves up to his Speed, attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} a creature within his reach, then makes a melee Strike against that creature.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Graelar's Strikes deal an extra 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Graelar the Whisper.publicNotes:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

Granite Vulture.name: 花岗岩兀鹫 Granite Vulture
Granite Vulture.allSaves: 对抗善良时全豁免+1状态加值

Anchored Soul.name: 锚定灵魂 Anchored Soul
Anchored Soul.description: 花岗岩兀鹫被神秘地绑定在一个兀鹫形态的石质容器中。它必须保持在距其60尺范围内。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Good.name: 对抗善良时全豁免+1状态加值

Bonded Vessel.name: 绑定容器 Bonded Vessel
Bonded Vessel.description: 花岗岩兀鹫主要容器的状态决定了其最大HP值。未受损时，容器是一件具有28HP（BT14）的物体。当兀鹫处于魂魄形态时，伤害它不会伤害到容器，但伤害容器会对兀鹫造成等量伤害。当兀鹫栖身在容器中时，他们是单个目标，伤害会同时减少兀鹫和容器的HP。如果容器破损，兀鹫仍然可以栖身在其中正常战斗，没有负面影响，但如果容器被摧毁，那兀鹫会立即被纳入它的第二容器。

Reconstitution.name: 重构 Reconstitution
Reconstitution.description: 当兀鹫HP为0时，它的魂魄就会消散。如果其绑定的容器完好无损，兀鹫会在[[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2d4天}后于此容器中重塑，被完全治愈。如果容器破损，盛器会在[[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2d4天}后重塑容器，而后兀鹫会再花2d4天在这个容器内重塑。在此期间，兀鹫的意识保存在魂魄盛器中。若容器和盛器都被摧毁，兀鹫会被立刻摧毁并无法重构。

Spirit Receptacle.name: 魂魄盛器 Spirit Receptacle
Spirit Receptacle.description: 若花岗岩兀鹫的绑定容器被毁，他们的魂魄就会居住在一个未被活化的头骨状盛器里。在此状态下，他们被石化，除了用心灵感应交谈外，不能进行任何动作，直至被重构。魂魄容器有56HP（BT14，硬度7）。

Inhabit Vessel.name: 栖身容器 Inhabit Vessel
Inhabit Vessel.description: 兀鹫接触并融入其绑定容器中，使得雕像活过来。它可以使用一个具有专注特征的单动作来结束栖身容器。当栖身容器时，它获得免疫治疗，非致命；抗力物理3（钝击除外）以及如下打击（译注：原文并未在下方列出打击）。

Spirit Body.name: 魂魄躯体 Spirit Body
Spirit Body.description: 当没有栖身容器或盛器时，兀鹫为虚体，处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，获得对全伤害的3抗力（力场伤害和幽冥性能符文造成的伤害除外；对非魔法伤害抗力加倍）。

Grave Hag.name: Grave Hag
Grave Hag.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: A grave hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gsYEuWv04XTDxe91]{Call Spirit} ritual to her coven's spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Sacrifice Ally.name: Sacrifice Ally
Sacrifice Ally.description:
触发 The grave hag is adjacent to an ally when the hag is targeted by an attack or an effect that requires a Reflex saving throw

效果 The triggering effect is redirected to target the ally.

Curse of the Grave.name: Curse of the Grave
Curse of the Grave.description:
The grave hag names a single creature within 30 feet; that creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or be afflicted with a grave curse equal to the hag's level. The curse lasts until the hag chooses to end it or is slain, rather than by returning items. Regardless of the save result, the target is then temporarily immune to the hag's grave curse for 24 hours.

效果 You are hounded by undead creatures of the same level as the curse. Every night, you must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. On a failure, an incorporeal undead manifests to hassle and harry you throughout the night, retreating before it can take much damage and often preventing you from gaining a full night's rest. Whenever you enter a graveyard or other area where bodies are buried, you must succeed at the same flat check or a body animates as a corporeal undead (typically a skeleton or zombie) to attack you.

These undead are temporary and exist only to harry you; if you take control of the undead, move on, or otherwise avoid their attacks, incorporeal undead discorporate and corporeal undead collapse into ordinary corpses. The curse can be removed by returning the stolen items to their resting place.

Grave Impressions.name: Grave Impressions
Grave Impressions.description:
The hag targets a living creature within 30 feet and overwhelms it with feelings of entombment. The target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save and is then temporarily immune to the hag's Grave Impressions for 24 hours.

大成功 The target is unaffected.

成功 The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed} for 1 round.

失败 The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}.

大失败 The target is unconscious and can't awaken for 1 hour.

Grave's Grip.name: Grave's Grip
Grave's Grip.description: Creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained} by the grave hag take a -1 circumstance penalty to saving throws against the grave hag's spells and abilities.

Undead Mien.name: Undead Mien
Undead Mien.description: A grave hag appears as an undead creature to magical effects.

Grave Hag.publicNotes:
Rot-skinned grave hags usually lair in cemeteries, mausoleums, and other burial sites; unlike most hags, they can't alter their appearance into a comely shape, so they hide from most observers. Grave hags consider such a predatory life hiding out in graveyards to be pitiful and squalid-they prefer to dwell in lands where necromancy is common and undeath isn't unusual. These grave hags become adept at necromantic magic and love posing as scholars. Schemers and plotters, they surround themselves with minions whom they send on missions to collect corpses for ghastly rituals.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.

Guloval.name: Guloval
Guloval.allSaves: +1 status bonus to all saves vs. magic

Interposition.name: Interposition
Interposition.description:
触发 A ward within the guloval's reach would take damage from a Strike, and the guloval is within the attacker's reach

效果 The guloval blocks the attack with their own body, taking the triggering attack's damage. The ward takes no damage.

Righteous Wound.name: Righteous Wound
Righteous Wound.description: When a guloval critically hits an evil creature with any melee Strike, the evil creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}. If that evil creature has damaged one of the guloval's wards within the last round, it's instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}.

Shield Ward.name: Shield Ward
Shield Ward.description: The guloval enhances the magical link with their ward, granting that creature a +1 status bonus to its Armor Class and saving throws until the start of the guloval's next turn.

Wolverine's Protection.name: Wolverine's Protection
Wolverine's Protection.description: The guloval selects a single willing ally within 30 feet as their ward; that ally can't already be the ward of another guloval. Once an ally becomes a ward, a magical link forms between the guloval and the ward, and as long as they are on the same plane and both are alive, the guloval knows the ward's direction from them, distance from them, and any conditions affecting them. A guloval can maintain this link with up to 4 wards-if they select a fifth, one of the previous wards (chosen by the guloval) loses the link and is no longer a ward.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Guloval.publicNotes:
Agathions are born from petitioners who achieved enlightenment in life or after death and received Nirvana's blessing. A guloval is small in stature but fierce, appearing as an anthropomorphic wolverine with gray and black fur, a white strip down the snout, and fearsome digging claws that can be easily used as weapons.

A guloval's core value is aggressive protection, and as such, they are one of the most militant of the normally peaceful agathions.
