A guloval attacks with a frightening ferocity to protect others, and they particularly seek out roles as guardians of children or the elderly. Despite this compulsion to protect those who may not be able to defend themselves, gulovals are also known for grumpy temperaments and impatience with social niceties. Most prefer to live as hermits when they're not assisting someone in need.

Hall of Mirrors.name: Hall of Mirrors
Hall of Mirrors.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:24] (expert) to realign a mirror so a trapped soul can't hurt the reflections, @Check[religion|dc:28] (expert) to banish a trapped soul, or @Check[thievery|dc:28] (expert) to cover a mirror quickly enough to keep the trapped soul inside it; each successful attempt to disable the haunt reduces its number of actions by 1

Ghostly Images.name: Ghostly Images
Ghostly Images.description:
触发 Two or more creatures enter the room

效果 Three trapped souls appear in mirrors throughout the room, menacing the reflections of the triggering creatures. The triggering creatures must each succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3} on a critical failure). The haunt then rolls initiative.

Soul Shred.name: Soul Shred
Soul Shred.description: A creature damaged by the haunt's reflective ripple Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until 1 minute after it leaves the room. This enfeebled condition is cumulative, up to enfeebled 4. If the creature dies from reflective rip, its soul is contained within the mirror until the mirror is broken and a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.HNEUSYnInffvGPHK]{Specter} emerges.

Hall of Mirrors.hazarddescription: Among the many mirrored reflections lurk three trapped souls. By attacking reflections, these spirits cause wounds to appear on the bodies of those reflected in the mirror. If a trapped soul kills its victim, the soul escapes the mirror, replaced by its victim's soul.
Hall of Mirrors.routine: (3 actions) Each trapped soul makes a reflective rip Strike against the reflection of a creature in the room; each trapped soul must attack a different target.

Harmony In Agony.name: Harmony In Agony
Harmony In Agony.hp: 寝于棺木, 快速治疗 10, 虚能治疗

Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

Distracting Bitterness.name: Distracting Bitterness
Distracting Bitterness.description:
A character can attempt to incite Harmony's bitterness by mentioning how Hyrune treats her like a servant rather than a companion by attempting a @Check[deception|dc:32] or @Check[intimidation|dc:32] check.

Critical Success Harmony shrieks in anger and abandons the fight at once, screaming "I'll teach him a lesson he won't soon forget!" as she Turns to Mist and leaves to seek out Hyrune.

Success Harmony shrieks in anger, then becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as her fury distracts her on the following round.

Failure The attempt fails, and Harmony is temporarily immune to further attempts to distract her in this way from that character for 24 hours

Critical Failure The attempt backfires, instead enraging Harmony. She is temporarily immune to further attempts to distract her in this way from anyone for 24 hours, and gains a +2 status bonus on Strikes made against the character who failed this check during this time.

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Mist Escape.name: Mist Escape
Mist Escape.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
• Bat Harmony changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}. She gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike +26 for 3d8+10 piercing

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Create Spawn.name: Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|against:will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

Dominate.name: Dominate
Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[16[healing]] HP, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Turn to Mist.name: Turn to Mist
Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A hollow husk is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Memory Drain.name: Memory Drain
Memory Drain.description:
需求 The hollow husk has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}

效果 Memories flow from the grabbed creature into the empty void that is the hollow husk's mind. The hollow husk deals the creature @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage, and the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature takes half damage.

失败 The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

大失败 The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Part of the Attic.name: Part of the Attic
Part of the Attic.description: The hungering growth's hostile actions don't cause creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the tempting aroma in the attic to recover from being fascinated.

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description:
@Damage[(1d10+5)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic]

On a failed save, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Hungry Cottage.name: Hungry Cottage
Hungry Cottage.hazarddescription: Iron Taviah's cottage comes to life and tries to eat everyone in it. The hazard is divided into three areas: the basement becomes the cottage's stomach; the stairs act as the cottage's throat, becoming a steep, slippery incline that is greater difficult terrain; and the ground floor is the inside of the cottage's mouth. Creatures within the cottage can move around within it but can't exit without pulling the mouth open or slipping out while its teeth gnash. Characters who successfully escape the cottage are safe from the hazard.
Hungry Cottage.routine: The cursed cottage uses 3 actions: Acidic Assault in the stomach, Swallowing Staircase in the throat, and Gnashing Portal in the mouth (in that order). Checks to disable the areas might prevent these actions for a brief time.
Hungry Cottage.reset: Once no creatures remain in the cottage, the hazard resets and returns to a normal cottage. The stairs and the basement are gone, however, as is Iron Taviah's body.

The Cottage Hungers.name: The Cottage Hungers
The Cottage Hungers.description:
Trigger Iron Taviah is defeated in the cottage basement

Effect The basement floor absorbs Iron Taviah, and the cottage transforms into a hungry, semi-animate creature. The cottage rolls initiative.

Acidic Assault.name: Acidic Assault
Acidic Assault.description: The walls and floor of the stomach steam with digestive juices; all creatures in contact with these surfaces take @Damage[(2d8+4)[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic]).

Gnashing Portal.name: Gnashing Portal
Gnashing Portal.description:
Creatures on the cottage's main floor are ground down as massive teeth appear from the floor and ceiling, gnash, and recede into the architecture, dealing @Damage[(2d8+4)[bludgeoning]] damage. Creatures in this area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and, if within 10 feet of an exit on the ground floor, can choose to exit the cottage.

Success The creature takes half damage and, if within 10 feet of an exit on the ground floor, can attempt to escape the cottage as the teeth retract by attempting a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save. On a success, the creature exits the cottage; on a critical failure, the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked prone.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Swallowing Staircase.name: Swallowing Staircase
Swallowing Staircase.description: Muscular swallowing contractions force creatures down the stairs and into the stomach. Creatures on the stairs must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save or be pushed 15 feet down the stairs (and across the basement floor with any excess forced movement if they're pushed to the bottom of the stairs). Creatures who critically fail this Reflex save fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} at the end of this forced movement.

Hungry Cottage.disable: The hungry cottage can't be damaged or disabled, but the danger in each area can be temporarily mitigated. In the stomach: @Check[athletics|dc:17|traits:action:climb] (trained) to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} atop the hoarded belongings and avoid contact with the acidic walls or floor for 1 round, or @Check[crafting|dc:25] (expert) as a 2-action activity to concoct an alchemical antacid that neutralizes acid damage dealt by the stomach for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. In the throat: @Check[athletics|dc:23] (trained) to hold the throat open for one round, allowing all characters in the stairs to use a Reflex save result one degree of success greater than their roll to avoid being pushed into the stomach, or @Check[nature|dc:23] or Survival as a 2-action activity to ease the throat's contractions and provide the same effect for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. In the mouth: @Check[athletics|dc:22|traits:action:force-open] to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} a window or a door and forcibly expel one creature that's within 10 feet of an exit from the cottage, or @Check[athletics|dc:25] (expert) as a 2-action activity to jam furniture in place that prevents the teeth from gnashing for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds} and allows anyone in the cottage to move from it during that time.

Hyrune Loxenna.name: Hyrune Loxenna

Divided Faith.description: Hyrune's devotion to Urgathoa has become undermined by his obsession with Orgesh. Urgathoa's religious symbol can be brandished at Hyrune to trigger his revulsion, provided the person attempting to do so accuses Hyrune of being a heretic or of betraying his faith. Hyrune takes a -2 circumstance penalty to Will saves to overcome this revulsion.
Divided Faith.name: Divided Faith

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with a +28 attack modifier. These fangs deal 3d12+16 piercing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Create Spawn.name: Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|against:will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

Dominate.name: Dominate
Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[22[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Children of the Deep.name: Children of the Deep
Children of the Deep.description: Hyrune's presence brings forth creatures of the deep to do his bidding. These typically include bat swarms, giant spiders, and giant centipedes, but can include other Darklands creatures. Hyrune can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

Mist Escape.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.
Mist Escape.name: Mist Escape

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Familiar.name: Familiar
Familiar.description: Hyrune's familiar is Taulzhalotel, a one-eyed, long-tailed hairless bat with a fly speed of 25 feet, darkvision, manual dexterity (with its tail), speech, and spell delivery.

Gluttonous Gulp.name: Gluttonous Gulp
Gluttonous Gulp.description: Hyrune dislocates his jaw to open his mouth far wider than it should, growing a thicket of additional fangs as he does. He attempts a fangs Strike and deals an additional @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage on a successful hit and can attempt to Drink Blood if he as an action remaining, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus on his Athletics check to do so.

Turn to Mist.name: Turn to Mist
Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

Hyrune Loxenna.hp: 寝于棺木, 快速治疗 15, 虚能治疗

Iron Taviah.name: Iron Taviah

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: Iron Taviah adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Magic Passage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Magaambya Scar.name: Magaambya Scar
Magaambya Scar.description: Taviah has an old injury that sometimes causes her pain. A physical attack on Taviah that scores a critical hit exacerbates the injury in her wounded leg; in addition to the other effects of the critical hit, Taviah is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}.

Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
Bonds of Iron.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Iron Taviah can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring from nothingness around a target at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, Taviah gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Taviah doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature [[/act escape dc=24]]{Escapes} (DC 24), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it; the cage has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Iron Taviah can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed, or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Ritual Specialist.name: Ritual Specialist
Ritual Specialist.description: Iron Taviah has a +2 circumstance bonus to the primary checks to perform a ritual. In addition, she can reduce the number of secondary casters for a ritual by 1. When she does, she must fulfill any requirements for the secondary caster, and she attempts the secondary check normally performed by that secondary caster. She can't replace a secondary caster who is the target of the spell (as in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual).

Scattered Coven.name: Scattered Coven
Scattered Coven.description: When the characters meet Iron Taviah, the Graveclaw is at the height of its power. As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Taviah the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-rank occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}.

Iron Taviah.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Wing Buffet.name: Wing Buffet
Wing Buffet.description:
触发 An adjacent creature attacks the kapoacinth while the kapoacinth is Swimming

效果 The kapoacinth pushes the triggering creature 5 feet away from them, and the kapoacinth moves 10 feet in the opposite direction. If the triggering creature can no longer attack the kapoacinth from its new location, the attack misses.

Coral Reef.name: Coral Reef
Coral Reef.description: Until the next time they act, the kapoacinth appears to be a lump of coral. They have an automatic result of 31 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as coral.

Kelganth.name: Kelganth
Kelganth.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
触发 A creature casts a spell Kelganth has prepared

效果 Kelganth expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. Kelganth loses his spell slot as if he had cast the triggering spell.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[11d12[void]] damage in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic]); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Paralyzing Doom.name: Paralyzing Doom
Paralyzing Doom.description: A creature damaged by Kelganth's hand Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[medicine|dc:25] check reveals that the victim is alive.

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

效果 If Kelganth's next action is to cast an cantrip or spell that is 8th level or less, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Kelganth's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Drain Soul Cage.name: Drain Soul Cage
Drain Soul Cage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Kelganth taps into his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to 9th rank, even if the spell being cast is not one of his prepared spells. Kelganth's soul cage doesn't need to be present for him to use this ability.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

Kelganth.publicNotes:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.

Kepgeda the Hag-Nailed.name: “鬼婆指甲”凯普格达 Kepgeda the Hag-Nailed
Kepgeda the Hag-Nailed.allSaves: 对抗心灵效果时意志豁免+1环境加值
Kepgeda the Hag-Nailed.blurb: 女性替换儿人类死灵师

equipment-Familiar (Rat Named Iskessous).name: 魔宠（一只名叫伊斯克苏斯的老鼠） Familiar (Rat Named Iskessous)

Cackling Coven.description:
触发 凯普格达的回合开始

需求 凯普格达距离她的哀鸣坩埚30尺或更近

效果 凯普格达汲取她死去的姐妹们的灵魂以获得一次异能能量迸发，但要付出代价。凯普格达受到@Damage[10[mental]]伤害，然后从下列三项中选择一个：

  • 凯普格达进行维持法术动作。若她的下个动作是施展一个女巫巫术，则该巫术的DC加1；
  • 凯普格达将她的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]状态值降至0；
  • 若凯普格达在接下来的一分钟开始施展@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.c3b6LdLlQDPngNIb]仪式，当仪式完成时，她会尝试进行@Check[flat|dc:18]检定；如果成功，她所创造的不死生物会比仪式能提供的等级高3级（例如，创造一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.WioQ6rOeMRuTOliY]，而不是一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.Xo4IGzw28hivgMmM]）。
Cackling Coven.name: 尖笑巫团 Cackling Coven

Familiar.name: 魔宠 Familiar
Familiar.description: 凯普格达的魔宠是伊斯克苏斯（Iskessous），一只老鼠，有着25尺攀爬速度、黑暗视觉、以及范围至多30尺的模糊感官灵敏嗅觉。

equipment-Keys to Area E13 and the Crook.name: 通向E13 区和歪盖棺材栅栏门的钥匙 Keys to Area E13 and the Crooked Coffin Grates

Called.name: 受呼唤者 Called
Called.description: 不断抵制返回母亲身边的欲望，凯普格达建成了一座心智堡垒。她在抵抗一个能会令她被控制的心灵效果的豁免骰上成功时，她获得大成功。

+1 Circumstance Bonus to Will Saves Agai.name: 对抗心灵效果时意志豁免+1环境加值

Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.name: 凯普格达的哀鸣坩埚 Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:22] 来倾覆坩埚，或@Check[occultism|dc:20] 、@Check[religion|dc:20] (受训) 来破解坩埚的效果。不论采用哪个方法（或者二者结合）、以何种顺序，都需要三次检定成功来完全解除作祟。一旦作祟被解除，巫团会开始复仇。
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.hazarddescription: 坩埚那震耳欲聋的哀鸣声唤来幽魂般的利爪，摧残耳朵与灵魂。
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.reset: 在任意一轮结束时，如果厨房内除了凯普格达外没有其他生物，作祟变得不活跃（恢复它的通常音量）。

Crescendo of Claws.name: 利爪狂潮 Crescendo of Claws
Crescendo of Claws.description:
触发 除了凯普格达外的一个生物身处距离坩埚15尺及以内的区域至少1轮

效果 尖叫声陡然加剧，一团由魅影般、只有三指、生着铁质锐甲的手掌组成的旋风自锅中喷涌而出，摧残位于E13区的生物。在房间内的所有生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:23]豁免，其结果如下。由于凯普格达喜爱坩埚的尖叫，她免疫作祟的效果

大成功 该生物不受影响

成功 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

失败 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}，惊惧持续时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}

大失败 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}，惊惧持续时被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}

Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.routine: (1 动作) 幽魂般的手掌向外探出，擒抱E13区中所有凯普格达的敌人。该区域中的所有生物因幽魂利爪的袭扰各受到@Damage[3d6[mental]]伤害（@Check[will|dc:20|basic]豁免）。因本效果受到心灵伤害的生物在他们的下个回合结束时无法降低惊惧值

Biting Snakes.name: Biting Snakes
Biting Snakes.description:
触发 A creature ends its turn adjacent to Kerinza

效果 Kerinza makes a snake fangs Strike against the creature.

Petrifying Gaze.name: Petrifying Gaze
Petrifying Gaze.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save. If the creature fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute. Kerinza can activate or deactivate this aura by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait, but deactivating it is painful for her; she gains weakness 15 to physical damage while her petrifying gaze is deactivated.

Focus Gaze.name: Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: Kerinza fixes her glare on a creature she can see within 30 feet. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save against Kerinza's petrifying gaze. If the target was already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed} before attempting its save, a failed save causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} permanently. After attempting its save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of Kerinza's next turn.

Quick Responses.name: Quick Responses
Quick Responses.description: If Kerinza isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed}, her Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to slowed targets.

Serpent Venom.name: Serpent Venom
Serpent Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

阶段1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

阶段2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

阶段3 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)

Keystone Trap.name: Keystone Trap
Keystone Trap.hazarddescription: A 5-foot-square metal vault covered with knobs lies concealed within a stone block. A lever on the stone block slides the vault into view. When the vault is exposed-whether it's slid out or whether the stone is smashed open-the trap activates.

Exposed Vault.name: Exposed Vault
Exposed Vault.description:
触发 The vault is exposed

效果 The vault makes a poison dart spray Strike at a random creature within 30 feet. The trap then rolls initiative.

Electrify.name: Electrify
Electrify.description: The metal vault crackles with electricity. In air, this would damage only creatures touching it; in water, the trap deals @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic]).

Launch Darts.name: Launch Darts
Launch Darts.description: The vault fires a stream of poisoned darts. The trap attacks all creatures in a @Template[line|distance:30] with its poison dart spray Strike; roll [[/r 1d8]] to determine the line's direction. These Strikes don't have a multiple attack penalty.

Spin.name: Spin
Spin.description: The vault spins quickly for 1 round. While it Spins, checks to disable the trap have a -2 circumstance penalty, and it Launches Darts at all creatures within 30 feet of it, rather than in a line.

Keystone Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:24|traits:action:disable-a-device] (受训) to find and press hidden knobs in a specific order (three successes are required to disable the trap, which also opens it); @Check[crafting|dc:24] (expert) to sabotage the vault's mechanisms, reducing its actions by 1 (when the trap's actions are reduced to 0, it is disabled)
Keystone Trap.routine: The keystone uses its 3 actions to Electrify, Spin, and then Launch Darts. When the trap loses an action, roll randomly to determine which action it loses.

Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
Bardic Lore.description: Lasheeli can use Bardic Lore to Recall Knowledge on any topic.

Cautionary Tale.name: Cautionary Tale
Cautionary Tale.description:
触发 Lasheeli or an ally within 30 feet attempts a Will save

效果 Lasheeli orates a line or two from one of her stories and makes a Performance check. Lasheeli and any allies can use the better result of her check or their saving throw.

Divine Aegis.name: Divine Aegis
Divine Aegis.description: Once per day when Lasheeli takes damage that would reduce her to 0 Hit Points, a radiant, holy shield flashes over her, negating all of the attack's spirit damage and half of any other damage the attack deals. If the attacker is within 60 feet, divine aegis deals the attacker the same amount of damage it prevented (of the same type, except that if divine aegis prevents spirit damage, it deals the attacker spirit damage instead).

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Lasheeli's spellcasting, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]; on a success, the spell isn't disrupted.

Divine Destruction.name: Divine Destruction
Divine Destruction.description:
When the divine warden is reduced to 0 HP, it erupts with divine energy in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], dealing @Damage[5d6[void]] damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect] save with the following outcomes.

大成功 The creature takes half damage.

成功 The creature takes full damage.

失败 The creature takes full damage and becomes temporarily cursed by the patron deity. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} for 1 day; this is a curse effect that uses the Will save DC as the counteract DC.

大失败 As failure, except the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}.

Faith Bound.name: Faith Bound
Faith Bound.description: A divine warden can't attack a creature that openly wears or displays the religious symbol of the divine warden's patron deity unless that creature uses a hostile action against the divine warden first. If the divine warden is intelligent, it can also attack a creature it believes isn't faithful to its deity or who wears the religious symbol as a ruse (typically after succeeding at a Perception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive}).

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by fire (@Damage[4d6[untyped]], @Damage[1d8[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by electricity (area @Damage[1d6[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description: 40 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Vulnerable to Gentle Repose.name: Vulnerable to Gentle Repose
Vulnerable to Gentle Repose.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Peaceful Rest} spell on a meat guardian causes it to grow stiff. The golem attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save. It's unaffected on a critical success, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a success, and on a failure is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and slowed for 1d4 rounds.

Faithful Weapon.name: Faithful Weapon
Faithful Weapon.description:
Scythe

A divine warden always wields its patron deity's favored weapon. If the weapon is a ranged weapon, the divine warden automatically generates new ammunition with each attack. For a divine warden of 4th level or higher, the deity's favored weapon gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} rune while the divine warden wields it; at 12th level, these effects are of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} rune, and at 19th level, they're instead of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.woxl2FrrgAcJDu0t]{Major Striking} rune.

Filth Fever.name: Filth Fever
Filth Fever.description:
The @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions from filth fever can't end or be reduced until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ([[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 sickened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it remains sickened (1 day)

Stage 4 unconscious (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

Instrument of Faith.name: Instrument of Faith
Instrument of Faith.description: The divine warden is a beacon for its deity's faith. A cleric of the divine warden's patron deity can channel a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell through a divine warden they can see within 60 feet. The cleric determines any targets or area for the spell as if they were standing in the divine warden's space.

Mechanical Laborer.name: Mechanical Laborer

Construct Armor (Hardness 8).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 8)
Construct Armor (Hardness 8).description: Like normal objects, a mechanical laborer has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by 8. Once a mechanical laborer is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks. It loses its Hardness, and its Armor Class is reduced to 18.

Mechanical Laborer.publicNotes:
Animated statues are often used to guard crypts, small shrines, or areas in government buildings where they can be positioned amid normal statues to hide their true nature until an intruder arouses their ire. Adventurers' suspicions regarding statues suddenly animating and attacking has led many less scrupulous adventurers to automatically attack any statues they encounter, ruining harmless, ancient relics.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

Memory Hole.name: Memory Hole
Memory Hole.hazarddescription: Anyone looking into the hole has memories sucked from their head.
Memory Hole.reset: The trap resets after 1 hour if it's not disabled.

Drink Thoughts.name: Drink Thoughts
Drink Thoughts.description:
触发 A creature looks into the pit

效果 Ephemeral energies pour from the creature's head, and the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

失败 The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2} for 1 hour and loses 1 minute of recent memories (a memory of the GM's choosing within the last 24 hours).

大失败 As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 3}.

Memory Hole.disable: @Check[deception|dc:29] (master) to feed the pit false thoughts that plug it, or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (expert) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 27) to drain the pit's magic

Mosghuta, Boss Cow.name: 头牛莫斯古塔 Mosghuta, Boss Cow

Darkvision.name: 黑暗视觉 黑暗视觉 Darkvision

Slow.name: 缓慢 Slow
Slow.description: 僵尸永远陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}且无法使用反应动作。

Negative Healing.name: 虚能治疗 虚能治疗 Void Healing

Trundling Gore.name: 拖曳角抵 Trundling Gore
Trundling Gore.description: 莫斯古塔压低牛角，猛冲向她的敌人。她行走一次，如果她结束移动时近战触及内有至少一个敌人，她对该敌人进行一次牛角打击。如果打击成功，莫斯古塔能以自由动作使用击倒能力。

Mummy Valet.name: Mummy Valet

Subtle Presence.name: Subtle Presence
Subtle Presence.description: The mummy valet activates or deactivates its despair aura.

Despair.name: Despair
Despair.description:
30 feet. Living creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} while in a mummy guardian's despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave the area. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1bOSJ2LbEC28aI9f]{Effect: Despair}

Mummy Rot.name: Mummy Rot
Mummy Rot.description:
This disease and any damage from it can't be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by mummy rot turns to dust and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Mummy Valet.publicNotes:
The majority of mummies were created by cruel and selfish masters to serve as guardians to protect their tombs from intruders. The traditional method of creating a mummy guardian is a laborious and sadistic process that begins well before the poor soul to be transformed is dead, during which the victim is ritualistically starved of nourishing food and instead fed strange spices, preservative agents, and toxins intended to quicken the desiccation of the flesh. The victim remains immobile but painfully aware during the final stages, where its now-useless entrails are extracted before it's shrouded in funerary wrappings and entombed within a necromantically ensorcelled sarcophagus to await intrusions in the potentially distant future. While it's certainly possible to use other methods to create a mummy guardian from an already-deceased body, those who seek to create these foul undead as their guardians in the afterlife often feel that such methods result in inferior undead-the pain and agony of death by mummification being an essential step in the process.

Regardless of the method of their creation, mummy guardians are more than just physical shells of flesh and bone-they retain fragmented, distorted versions of their minds, with only enough memories of their living personality remaining to fuel their undead anger and jealousy of those who yet live. This burning rage only intensifies over the centuries of waiting within a crypt for the chance to actually act, and thus when most mummy guardians are awoken by tomb robbers or adventurers, they stop at nothing in pursuit of glorious slaughter.

While many cultures practice mummification of the dead for benign reasons, undead mummies are created through foul rituals, typically to provide eternally vigilant guardians.

Necrohulk Flailer.name: Necrohulk Flailer
Necrohulk Flailer.hp: 虚能治疗, 再生15 (酸蚀使其失效)

Alchemical Cartridge.name: Alchemical Cartridge
Alchemical Cartridge.description: Critical hits rupture the necrohulk's alchemical cartridge. The first time the necrohulk takes a critical hit, it loses its regeneration. The second time it takes a critical hit, it takes @Damage[15[persistent,acid]]{15} damage that it can't heal unless the cartridge is stitched back into place.

Alchemical Amplification.name: Alchemical Amplification
Alchemical Amplification.description:
Frequency once per hour

效果 The necrohulk draws upon alchemical stores to push its body into overdrive. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Quickened Duration]]{1d4轮}. It can use this extra action to Step, Stride, or Strike.

Tentacle Storm.name: Tentacle Storm
Tentacle Storm.description: The necrohulk flailer makes up to four tentacle Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the necrohulk makes all of these attacks.

Necrohulk Flailer.publicNotes:
Additional limbs, failing tentacles, and rubbery bodies are common among Mana Wastes mutants, and aspiring necrohulk creators like to combine flesh from more than one of these kinds of mutants to create gangly but powerful warriors.

The strange, terrible energies swirling about on the winds and embedded in the earth of the Mana Wastes have led to unexpected changes and mutations in the bodies of those who dwell there. These mutants usually have little chance to escape their hardscrabble existence, as they're ostracized by other societies. People in the kingdom of Nex to the north look on such folk with suspicion, as do the dwarves of Alkenstar to the west. Surprisingly, the undead nation of Geb to the south is often the best hope for a future among people with unusual appearances.

Those who flee to Geb or are convinced to make it their home frequently find their welcome to be a false promise, however. Necromancers who long ago tired of animating the same humanoids find new potential in mutated flesh, and mutants who aren't careful might find themselves led into laboratories or crypts for experimentation.

Enterprising twilight sages of Yled's Mortuarium have innovated bizarre combinations of alchemy and necromancy that boost their victims' mutations to persist even after reanimation. Although these necrohulks are virtually mindless and require a constant influx of chemicals to retain their might, they're more than powerful enough to make the extremely difficult process worth the effort. The cartridge containing the alchemical formulation that sustains them is perhaps the trickiest part of necrohulk animation, and it's easiest to simply stitch the cartridge right into the necrohulk's flesh.

Yled's armies contain a growing number of necrohulks. This isn't solely because these juggernauts are frightening effective combatants on the field of battle; leveraging the instinctive revulsion that mutants create carries some strategic advantage. Although the occasional necrohulks do run amok in Yled, addled on the chemical cocktails that sustain them, military necromancers generally keep them under control.

Necrohulk Smasher.name: Necrohulk Smasher
Necrohulk Smasher.hp: 虚能治疗, 再生15 (被酸无效)

Alchemical Cartridge.name: Alchemical Cartridge
Alchemical Cartridge.description: Critical hits rupture the necrohulk's alchemical cartridge. The first time the necrohulk takes a critical hit, it loses its regeneration. The second time it takes a critical hit, it takes @Damage[15[persistent,acid]]{15} damage that it can't heal unless the cartridge is stitched back into place.

Alchemical Amplification.name: Alchemical Amplification
Alchemical Amplification.description:
Frequency once per hour

效果 The necrohulk draws upon alchemical stores to push its body into overdrive. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Quickened Duration]]{1d4轮}. It can use this extra action to Step, Stride, or Strike.

Smashing Blow.name: Smashing Blow
Smashing Blow.description:
The necrohulk smasher makes a fist Strike. If it hits, the necrohulk smashes the target into the floor or nearby wall. The target takes an additional @Damage[6d10[bludgeoning]] damage, depending on its @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save.

大成功 The target takes half of the additional damage.

成功 The target takes half the additional damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}.

失败 The target takes full additional damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}, and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

大失败 The target takes double the additional damage, is stunned 3, and knocked prone.

Necrohulk Smasher.publicNotes:
Mutants with incredible strength make the most powerful necrohulks. These necrohulk smashers are so swollen with biological and alchemical muscle enhancements that they can simply pound their way through enemies.

The strange, terrible energies swirling about on the winds and embedded in the earth of the Mana Wastes have led to unexpected changes and mutations in the bodies of those who dwell there. These mutants usually have little chance to escape their hardscrabble existence, as they're ostracized by other societies. People in the kingdom of Nex to the north look on such folk with suspicion, as do the dwarves of Alkenstar to the west. Surprisingly, the undead nation of Geb to the south is often the best hope for a future among people with unusual appearances.

Those who flee to Geb or are convinced to make it their home frequently find their welcome to be a false promise, however. Necromancers who long ago tired of animating the same humanoids find new potential in mutated flesh, and mutants who aren't careful might find themselves led into laboratories or crypts for experimentation.

Enterprising twilight sages of Yled's Mortuarium have innovated bizarre combinations of alchemy and necromancy that boost their victims' mutations to persist even after reanimation. Although these necrohulks are virtually mindless and require a constant influx of chemicals to retain their might, they're more than powerful enough to make the extremely difficult process worth the effort. The cartridge containing the alchemical formulation that sustains them is perhaps the trickiest part of necrohulk animation, and it's easiest to simply stitch the cartridge right into the necrohulk's flesh.

Yled's armies contain a growing number of necrohulks. This isn't solely because these juggernauts are frightening effective combatants on the field of battle; leveraging the instinctive revulsion that mutants create carries some strategic advantage. Although the occasional necrohulks do run amok in Yled, addled on the chemical cocktails that sustain them, military necromancers generally keep them under control.

Necromunculus.name: 尸造尸 Necromunculus
Necromunculus.languages: 死灵语（无法说任何语言）；系于亡主

Undead Master Link.name: 系于亡主 Undead Master Link
Undead Master Link.description: 一个尸造尸不能说话，但它与它的创造者间有心灵感应。它可以来回分享信息，包括主人的知识和尸造尸听到的一切。这个连接的距离是1500尺。如果尸造尸被摧毁，它的主人会受到@Damage[2d10[mental]]伤害。如果主人被杀，尸造尸变为无心智，漫无目的地寻找不死生物来攻击并试图吃掉它们。

Stupefying Touch.name: 弱智之触 Stupefying Touch
Stupefying Touch.description: 被尸造尸的利爪打击命中的生物必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:15]豁免，否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续1轮。

Necromunculus.publicNotes:
尸造尸是一种只能由不死生物创造的超小型不死仆人。这些侍从是盖布最常见的造物，在那里，不死工匠和主谋有着无尽的年岁来涉猎死灵工艺，且亟需忠心不二且比简单的不死仆从更加狡猾的不死仆人。

尸造尸与人造人相似，但这些不死生物与为它们定名的构装体间有些明显的区别。尸造尸可能对它的主人十分忠诚，但它对所有其他不死生物，甚至是自己，恨之入骨。如果放任其自由，尸造尸会立即开始谋划杀死并啃啮任何必须经常与之打交道的不死生物，甚至是它的主人，尽管它不需要进食。只要有其他命令需要服从，尸造尸就不能心甘情愿地按照这种冲动行事，所以它们的创造者努力确保它们不断有任务供应，以此让它们忙个不停。

尽管有着同类相食的冲动，但尸造尸在盖布的不死死灵师之间越来越受欢迎。每个创造者都想看看它们是否能在这些讨人喜爱的叛逆仆人身上注入更多自己的力量或个性。此外，尸造尸也是未来的鲜血领主在间谍活动和逻辑思维方面的绝佳练习对象。

尸造尸看上去像是个皮包骨头、长着革质翅膀、宛若小魔鬼的类人生物。它们是由泥浆、骨粉、杜松油、几滴仍活着的哺乳动物的血以及创造者自己的一磅肉、血或骨头混合而成。没有实体的不死生物可以使用另一个自愿的智慧不死生物的一磅肉、血或骨头，但这个过程通常会摧毁那名志愿者。

Night's Breath Trap.name: Night's Breath Trap
Night's Breath Trap.hazarddescription: The night giant mummy unfolds its arms and leans forward to exhale a blast of gray mist and shrieking spirits into the room.
Night's Breath Trap.reset: The trap resets during the following round, after which it can be triggered again.

Night's Breath.name: Night's Breath
Night's Breath.description:
Trigger A Small or larger creature in area A2 moves within 15 feet of the secret door to the north or the double door to area A5

Effect The mummy exhales a blast of gray mist into the room that imparts an overwhelming sense that night itself is consuming all thought. The trap deals @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage to all creatures in area A2, who each must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as they remain frightened.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}, and is fleeing for as long as they remain frightened.

Night's Breath Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] to "blind" the statue so that it cannot notice any who approach, @Check[occultism|dc:35] to redirect and expend the trap's occult energies harmlessly, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank, counteract DC 32) to counteract the trap.

Nightmare Portal.name: Nightmare Portal
Nightmare Portal.hazarddescription: Horrific visions of a lumbering monstrosity whose face is nothing but a fanged mouth lurch out of the violet mist to attempt to eat the viewer alive.
Nightmare Portal.reset: The nightmare portal resets 1 minute after it no longer detects targets.
Nightmare Portal.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:42|name:Focus the Portal's Energy|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to focus the portal's energies back in on itself to close it off, or @Check[occultism|dc:36|name:Invoke the Proper Chant] (master) to invoke the proper chant and make the proper hand gestures to untether the portal from the Dreamlands, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 34) to counteract the portal for 1 minute and prevent Orgesh's influence from reaching through during that time
Nightmare Portal.routine: (2 actions) A vision of an immense lumbering figure with nothing but a circular mouth for a face lurches out of the portal. For each action, the nightmare portal casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} (heightened to 8th level, @Check[will|dc:38|traits:death,emotion,fear,mental]), targeting a different creature both times. It can select targets in area E11, the secret alcove to the northeast, or up to 10 feet east from the door (although a closed door blocks it), choosing the closest two targets each round. The nightmare portal loses 1 action if it's broken and can thus only cast phantasmal killer once per round.

Dreadful Vision.name: Dreadful Vision
Dreadful Vision.description:
Trigger At the start of a round after a creature who can dream and isn't immune to sleep effects enters the room, the portal starts to glow with purple mist. At this point, the portal triggers as soon as such a creature looks into it. A character who just passes by and doesn't specifically avert their gaze must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11] to not accidently glance into the portal, while a character who Searches this room automatically looks into it unless they specify otherwise.

Effect The nightmare portal casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity} (heightened to 8th level, @Check[will|dc:37|traits:mental]), making reality appear to crumble away to reveal a vast cavern filled with bones through which immense wormlike creatures burrow as they endlessly eat away at the world. The trap then rolls initiative.

Swift Sneak.name: Swift Sneak
Swift Sneak.description: The archer can move their full Speed while Sneaking.

Spry Dodge.name: Spry Dodge
Spry Dodge.description:
触发 The archer is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see

效果 The archer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the archer can Step.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The archer's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the archer.
Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack

Bravery.name: Bravery
Bravery.description: Whenever the defender rolls a success at a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the frightened condition, they reduce its value by 1.

Offensive Line.name: Offensive Line
Offensive Line.description: The defender's Strikes deal an extra 1d6 damage when adjacent to an ally.

Nydazuul.name: Nydazuul
Nydazuul.publicNotes: The brutish and gluttonous augnagar live to feast- preferably on rotten flesh, and when possible, demon flesh. But to them, the greatest delicacy is the flesh of other augnagars. Augnagars have spiderlike legs with leathery membranes like a bat's wings, and three tails ending in hooked claws perfect for slicing flesh.

Confusing Display.name: Confusing Display
Confusing Display.description:
The augnagar's writhing limbs and flesh seethe and squirm in a disorienting and unsettling manner. Creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Confusing Displays for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't attempt a flat check to recover from confusion whenever it takes damage from an attack or spell.

Inhale Vitality.name: Inhale Vitality
Inhale Vitality.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The augnagar inhales sharply, drawing life force out of creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:50]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[11d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save, and the creature is fatigued on a failure). The augnagar becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round on its next turn, and it can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

Rotting Curse.name: Rotting Curse
Rotting Curse.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the creature displays hideous, festering wounds exuding a horrific stench. Any creature within 30 feet of the victim must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on a critical failure, for as long as it's sickened).

While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute. The victim of the disease doesn't roll a save, but takes the failure effects automatically and can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 day).

Opkherab.name: 奥普赫拉布 Opkherab

Draining Peek.name: 吸能一窥 Draining Peek
Draining Peek.description:
触发 30尺内一个能被奥普赫拉布的生命感知察觉到的生物开始了他的回合

效果 目标必须进行@Check[fortitude|dc:17]豁免，如果失败，奥普赫拉布获得@Damage[3[healing]]HP而目标获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。奥普赫拉布在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Draining Peek]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用本能力。

Key Conditioning.name: 钥匙调教 Key Conditioning
Key Conditioning.description: 奥普赫拉布在攻击任何手持任意一把银行钥匙的生物时有-1环境减值。

Sunlight Vulnerability.name: 阳光易伤 Sunlight Vulnerability
Sunlight Vulnerability.description: 如果暴露于阳光直射下，奥普赫拉布无法使用带有“死亡”特征的动作，并获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。每当他在阳光下结束其回合时，缓慢值都将增加1点，如果奥普赫拉布因此失去了其所有动作，他就被摧毁。

Death Grip.name: 死亡之握 Death Grip
Death Grip.description: 当奥普赫拉布擒获一个生物，包括使用擒获来延长对一个生物的擒抱时，他获得3点临时生命，而被擒抱的生物必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:17]豁免否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。这会将目标生物的流失值+1，最高到流失4。

Zombie Spawn.name: 丧尸衍体 Zombie Spawn
Zombie Spawn.description: 任何类人生物若在死亡时拥有因奥普赫拉布而获得的流失值，就会在死亡后24小时复活为拥有自我意识的丧尸。你或许能借此机会来允许玩家继续玩同一个角色，选用丧尸变体重建角色卡。

Opkherab.publicNotes:
当一个鲜活、有知觉的生物被暴露于超自然邪恶的极端表现下时，这种经历会不可挽回地诅咒这名受害者，并通过一种骇人且亵渎的转化来碾碎他们的心智、撕裂他们的灵魂，其结果是一种诅咒生命的“生物”——波达尸。

从这种绝对的腐化中幸存下来的身体碎屑只会让这个类人生物的外表进一步令人不安。波达尸的身体严重扭曲，仿佛它被束缚于痛苦与恐惧所带来的痉挛中。它那干瘪无毛的肉体散发着不属于凡间的珍珠样光泽，绷在一副畸形的骨架上，令它步履蹒跚。但在这其中最令人不安的，是它那镶嵌在一张低垂、融化，几乎没有留下什么生前结构的面孔上的眼睛。这双眼睛，尽管深陷于眼窝中，却散发着秽恶的光，瞳孔中放出的凝视包含着无尽的恶意，而它的眼眶中不断地泣出有毒的蒸汽。

生前生活的记忆碎片经由对生者的仇恨所过滤，促使波达尸尝试回到那些它曾经了解的地方。如果成功了，他就会用凶残的凝视和装点着恶毒的咒骂、控告、谴责的胡言乱语来袭击从前的朋友、点头之交和爱人——此类袭击常常令受害者复活为新的波达尸。

Ostovite Nest.name: 活骨魔虫巢 Ostovite Nest
Ostovite Nest.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Topple the Mound] (受训) 来推倒并摧毁骨丘。
Ostovite Nest.routine: (1 动作) 危害对最近的一个生物进行一次酸液喷吐打击。

Skittering Surge.name: 蜂拥而上 Skittering Surge
Skittering Surge.description:
触发 一个生物进入巢穴15尺范围内

效果 一大群颤动的活骨魔虫幼体爬满了巢穴，向各个方向喷吐酸液。距离巢穴@Template[emanation|distance:30]内的所有生物都会受到@Damage[(1d10+4)[acid]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还会受到@Damage[1[persistent,acid]]伤害。随后，危害骰先攻。

Ostovite Nest.hazarddescription: 一个类似于蚁丘的骨质巢穴里有无数微小的食腐性害虫，长着一副凶恶，滴着酸液的下颚。
Ostovite Nest.reset: 如果在它的回合开始时没有可作为酸液喷吐打击的目标，该危害就会关闭。幼体回到巢穴中，危害随即重置。如果受伤但并未被摧毁，巢穴会随着幼体的修复每小时恢复@Damage[1d6[healing]]生命值。

Pain Milker.name: Pain Milker
Pain Milker.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) to deactivate the machine, or @Check[perception|dc:38] (expert) to decipher the proper order in which the switches and dials should be adjusted in order to power the device down harmlessly
Pain Milker.hazarddescription: An eerie machine made of levers, crystals, and glowing bits of metal that, as one draws near, causes unsettling aches and pains.
Pain Milker.reset: If the augnagar still lives and at least one crystallized agony is still functional, the pain milker resets automatically in a number of rounds equal to 7 - the number of remaining crystallized agonies.

Agonizing Overload.name: Agonizing Overload
Agonizing Overload.description:
Trigger The pain milker is struck hard enough to take damage, or any of its dials and levers are adjusted carelessly

Effect The pain milker emits a shrill whine and exudes a blast of violet light. All creatures in area B2 must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save. This DC is reduced by 2 if the machine is broken.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[4d10[vitality]] or @Damage[4d10[void]] damage (whichever is more harmful).

Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d10[vitality]] or @Damage[8d10[void]] damage (whichever is more harmful) and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Critical Failure As failure but @Damage[16d10[vitality]] or @Damage[16d10[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Perilous Flash Flood.name: Perilous Flash Flood
Perilous Flash Flood.hazarddescription: Whether made up of water rushing through the streets that sweeps up dangerous debris along the way or a less natural substance bursting free of its container, this relentless flood batters everything in its path.

Burst Free.name: Burst Free
Burst Free.description:
触发 A creature or effect breaks the flood's containment.

效果 The hazard rolls initiative as the flood surges forth.

Perilous Flash Flood.disable: Three @Check[athletics|dc:35|name:Move Barricade], @Check[crafting|dc:35|name:Construct Barricade], or @Check[survival|dc:35|name:Construct Barricade] checks to move or construct barricades strong enough to create a shelter from the flood. While this creates a safe place to stand, creatures outside of the barricaded area may still be in danger depending on the nature and the source of the flood.
Perilous Flash Flood.routine:
(1 动作) The flood advances forward 60 feet, crashing into all creatures within its area. Each creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save as the floodwaters pummel them and pull them downstream. The amount and type of damage dealt are based on the nature of the flood, and certain types of floods impose additional effects. The turbulent waters mean creatures within the area of the flood must attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Swim|traits:action:swim] check to Swim in order to move, and those who do not succeed at a check to Swim each round may drown.

This caustic flood dissolves flesh as it moves, dealing @Damage[1d12[bludgeoning],(1d12+8)[acid]]{1d12 bludgeoning damage and 1d12+8 acid damage}. Additionally, it deals @Damage[2d6[persistent,acid]] damage to creatures who critically fail their Fortitude saves.

大成功 The creature takes no damage.

成功 The creature takes half damage.

失败 The creature takes full damage and is moved 10 feet along with the water.

大失败 The creature takes double damage and is moved 20 feet along with the water.

Pesgahi the Poisoner.name: 毒师佩斯伽希 Pesgahi the Poisoner

Infused Items.name: 灌注物品 Infused Items
Infused Items.description: 佩斯伽希携带以下灌注物品，这些物品持续24小时，或直到他进行每日准备时：@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{次等解毒剂 Antidote (Lesser)} (2)，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]{次等发烟棒 Smokestick (Lesser)} (2)，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{中等强酸瓶 Acid Flask (Moderate)} (6)，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nVvH1ZcM7OwIVIs8]{中等霜冻瓶 Frost Vial (Moderate)} (4)

Consume Flesh.name: 啃食尸体 Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
需求 佩斯伽希与刚死亡1小时内的生物尸体相邻

效果 佩斯伽希吞食一大块尸体并恢复@Damage[2d6[healing]]点生命值。

它只能从每具尸体上获取1次生命值恢复。

Ghoul Fever.name: 食尸鬼热 Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

阶段1 携带病原但无不良效果（1天）

阶段2 @Damage[2d6[void]]且从任何治疗获得的生命值恢复均减半（1天）

阶段3 同阶段2（1天）

阶段4 @Damage[2d6[void]]且无法从治疗获得任何好处（1天）

阶段5 同阶段4（1天）

阶段6 死亡并在下一个午夜复生为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{食尸鬼 Ghoul}。

Paralysis.name: 麻痹 Paralysis
Paralysis.description: 任意活着的非精灵生物在受到佩斯伽希的攻击时必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:19]豁免，失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}。被麻痹的生物可以在每个自己的回合结束时尝试一次新的豁免，每次此豁免的DC都会递减1点。

Quick Bomber.name: 高速投弹手 Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: 佩斯伽希使用交互动作取出一枚炸弹，然后立即用它进行打击。

Swift Leap.name: 迅捷跳跃 Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: 佩斯伽希跳跃至多以半速跳跃。这次移动不会触发反应动作。

Phalanx of Phalanges.name: 趾骨方阵 Phalanx of Phalanges

Predetermined Path.name: 预设路径 Predetermined Path
Predetermined Path.description: 趾骨方阵知晓一条位于匀称地面上的单一路径，其长度不超过100尺，具体由方阵创造者决定。趾骨方阵除了沿着这条路径移动或对挡道的生物进行累累指骨攻击外，不会进行任何行动。如果这条道路受到阻碍，或者方阵受到伤害，趾骨方阵不再被那条路径束缚并陷入永久的狂暴，尽其所能地攻击附近的生物。

Countless Digits.name: 累累指骨 Countless Digits
Countless Digits.description: 趾骨方阵中的所有其他生物都会受到@Damage[1d6[piercing]]伤害（如果集群狂暴，则@Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]]伤害）（@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]豁免）。如果大失败，目标还会被趾骨彻底钉住，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}，直到尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escapes}（DC17）或任何生物使用2个交互动作来刮掉钉住他们的骨头。

Phalanx of Phalanges.publicNotes:
由数以百计的手指骨和脚趾骨组成，趾骨方阵在地上哗哗作响，整齐划一到了令人感到阴森的地步。

常常被误认为不死生物，活化骨骼是一种与死灵术毫无关系的无心智构装体。以下几种是典型的活化骨骼样例。

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, Pokmit automatically attempts to counteract it, with a [[/r 1d20+29 #Counteract]]{+29} counteract modifier.

Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description: Pokmit unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of cold. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]). The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4轮}.

Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

豁免检定 @Check[will|dc:44] save

潜伏期 1 hour

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove the armor（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor（1天）

阶段3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

Pike Master.name: Pike Master
Pike Master.description: Pokmit's longspear reach increases by 5 feet until the start of his next turn, and he makes a single longspear Strike against any number of creatures. These attacks count toward Pokmit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

Ruinous Weapons.name: Ruinous Weapons
Ruinous Weapons.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Pokmit uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sexud7FdxIrg50vU]{Greater Frost} weapons runes. (These bonuses are included in his statistics above.)

Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: Pokmit has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons he wields.

Pokmit's Discernment.name: Pokmit's Discernment
Pokmit's Discernment.description:
Frequency once per round

效果 Pokmit sizes up the defenses of a creature within 30 feet; he must know the creature is near, but need not be able to see it. Until the start of Pokmit's next turn, Pokmit's attacks against the target ignore any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

Prachalla.name: Prachalla
Prachalla.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors.
