Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories. The Prachalla doll is animated by the soul of a spy who worked for an organized crime ring in Kaer Maga; she was working undercover as a maid when she died.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Prachalla deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Prachalla.

Precarious Bone Pile.name: 岌岌可危的骨堆 Precarious Bone Pile
Precarious Bone Pile.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:20] (受训) 或 @Check[stealth|dc:20] (受训) 来在避免扰动骨头的情况下扭过去，或在远处造成任意数值的伤害以触发坍塌。
Precarious Bone Pile.hazarddescription: 这个古老的骨堆看上去很稳定，但哪怕是最轻微的干扰都会使它们倒塌。

Collapse.name: 崩塌 Collapse
Collapse.description:
触发 一个生物在骨堆边的险恶方格上移动或伤害堆在其中一格中的骨头

效果 骨堆崩塌成骨头残骸组成的洪流，从骨堆当前所占的区域向各个方向扩散5尺。这将对距离骨堆5尺范围内的所有生物造成@Damage[(6d4+9)[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic]豁免）。这些区域成为困难地形。

Prince Doriel.name: Prince Doriel

Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories. The Doriel doll is animated by Kerinza's idealized version of her childhood friend. He can telepathically communicate with the Kerinza doll as long as they're within 60 feet of each other.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Prince Doriel deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Prince Doriel.

Princess Kerinza.name: Princess Kerinza

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Princess Kerinza deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: The Kerinza doll is animated by a piece of Kerinza's soul, energized by the happiest time in her life. She can telepathically communicate with the Doriel doll as long as they're within 60 feet of each other. If the Doriel doll is defeated, her eyes turn black, and black veins run beneath her porcelain skin. She can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Wave of Despair} again if she's already cast it, and she can cast it as a single action.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Princess Kerinza.

Pyrogeist.name: Pyrogeist

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a pyrogeist is destroyed, it reforms where it was destroyed after [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2d4 days}, fully healed. The pyrogeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: A pyrogeist can spit a cone of spectral fire in a @Template[cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[10d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]). A creature that fails the save also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage and is subject to the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire} until the persistent damage ends.

Pyrokinetic Whirlwind.name: Pyrokinetic Whirlwind
Pyrokinetic Whirlwind.description: The pyrogeist transforms into a 40-foot tall vortex of spectral flame that appears to immolate everything within a @Template[burst|distance:10]. A creature within this area take @Damage[(2d12 + 20)[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic]).

Soul Consumption.name: Soul Consumption
Soul Consumption.description: The spirit of a creature that dies from damage dealt by the pyrogeist's Pyrokinetic Whirlwind is trapped within the pyrogeist as if subjected to the effects of the bind soul spell. This effect persists until the pyrogeist is destroyed or chooses to set the soul free. The spirit remains trapped whether or not the pyrogeist is using Pyrokinetic Whirlwind. A pyrogeist can contain only one soul at a time in this manner.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

Pyrogeist.publicNotes: Born from the deaths of arsonists who died in the fires they started, pyrogeists are roiling infernos whose spectral fire emits no actual heat and harms only living creatures. Obsessed with sharing their torment with the living, pyrogeists haunt the area of their demise until whatever wrong they refuse to forgive has been righted, and they are finally put to rest. While pyrogeists can't set their own fires, they often use their terrifying illusory capabilities and telekinetic powers to lure their victims into setting themselves ablaze.

Restored Doll.name: Restored Doll
Restored Doll.publicNotes:

Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories.

For You, Mistress.name: For You, Mistress
For You, Mistress.description:
触发 An attack would reduce Kerinza to 0 HP

需求 The soulbound doll is within 60 feet of Kerinza

效果 The attack is redirected to the soulbound doll, and the doll is destroyed, regardless of the damage dealt to it.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The restored doll deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the restored doll.

Rotbomber.name: Rotbomber

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A rotbomber is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Pressurized Pustules.name: Pressurized Pustules
Pressurized Pustules.description: When a rotbomber takes acid, fire, physical or sonic damage, there is a chance a prematurely developed pustule bursts open, determined by a @Check[flat|dc:11]. All creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must succeed at @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. A creature that gets a critical failure becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}. Any creature who attempts this save becomes temporarily immune to pressurized pustules for 24 hours.

Gaseous Smash.name: Gaseous Smash
Gaseous Smash.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The rotbomber pulls two necrotic pustules from its body, one in each hand, and leaps into the air in an attempt to detonate them simultaneously on a hapless victim. The rotbomber Leaps up to 15 feet horizontally and 10 feet vertically to land in a square adjacent to a target creature and makes a necrotic pustule Strike against the target. If the Strike hits, it deals an additional @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage to the target. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of determining the rotbomber's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after the Gaseous Smash.

Necrotic Rot.name: Necrotic Rot
Necrotic Rot.description:
Necrotic rot withers and corrupts living tissue at an alarming rate. An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from necrotic rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}

Stage 4 dead, rising as a rotbomber immediately

Propulsive Pestilence.name: Propulsive Pestilence
Propulsive Pestilence.description: The pressurized necrotic gases within the rotbomber's pustules make them explode far more dramatically than most alchemists' bombs. The rotbomber's necrotic pustules deal splash damage to every creature within 15 feet of the target.

Rotbomber.publicNotes: Disgusting and dangerous, rotbombers bound around on all four limbs, ripping off the pressurized and explosive necrotic pustules that grow out of their backs to lob them toward their enemies. When they explode, the pustules emit concussive blasts of force and deadly pestilence that can infect a victim. Though slow and overburdened by the intense weight of the pustules, rotbombers can move with a surprising speed when they need to hunt down their quarry.

equipment-Key to all locks in Cerulean G.name: Key to all locks in Cerulean Glade

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If Rumin rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

Susceptible to Mockery.name: Susceptible to Mockery
Susceptible to Mockery.description:
A character can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} Rumin by mocking the fact that he hasn't yet been turned into a vampire. On a success, in addition to the normal effects, Rumin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3} on a critical success), but on a critical failure he becomes enraged and gains a +1 status bonus to Strikes and damage rolls against foes for 1 minute, during which time he can't be mocked further.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.APJJCYdq4gNe0PF4]{Effect: Susceptible to Mockery (Critical Failure)}

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Rumin's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Rust Hag.name: Rust Hag
Rust Hag.publicNotes:
Rust hags have a knack for technology. They make their homes in hollowed-out factories, abandoned tenements, and other sites of urban decay.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
Rust Hag.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Hagshot.name: Hagshot
Hagshot.description: Any firearm wielded by a rust hag gains the benefits of +1 striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} runes, and it functions properly no matter how rusty it gets. In addition, when a rust hag critically hits a target with a firearm, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}.

Rusting Touch.name: Rusting Touch
Rusting Touch.description: A rust hag's touch causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If the hag succeeds at a Strike with her claw, she deals [[/r 2d6 #Rusting Touch Damage]] damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the hag hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against the hag's claw attack, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item is rusted on that attack. Objects made of skymetal, such as adamantine and orichalcum, are immune to rusting touch.

Change Shape.description:
The rust hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: Change Shape

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: A rust hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0fYE64odlKqISzft]{Rusting Grasp}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct} to her coven's spells.

Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea.name: Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea
Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: Sahni adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk} to her coven's spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Bride's Bargain.name: Bride's Bargain
Bride's Bargain.description: Sahni can make a bargain with a willing creature of sound mind. The creature gives away a special quality-such as its courage, beauty, or voice-or sacrifices a loved one in exchange for a boon or a promise from Sahni. As long as Sahni keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore a lost quality is to defeat Sahni or make another bargain for its return. Loved ones sacrificed for Sahni's bargain can't be restored except with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle}, or similarly powerful magic.

Curse of Futility.name: Curse of Futility
Curse of Futility.description:
Sahni gazes upon a creature, affecting it with an overwhelming sense that every action it takes is futile; that humiliating failure is their only possible future. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:25] save; the target doesn't need to be able to see Sahni.

大成功 The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to Sahni's Curse of Futility for 24 hours.

成功 The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} for 1 round and then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

失败 The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

大失败 The target is stupefied 2 for 1 hour and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} as long as it is stupefied.

Scattered Coven.name: Scattered Coven
Scattered Coven.description: As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Sahni the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-rank occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}. If Sahni is the third hag they confront, the coven is broken and she lacks these coven spells.

Sahreg the Dirge Screamer.name: 哀号者萨雷格 Sahreg the Dirge Screamer

Entangling Net.name: Entangling Net
Entangling Net.description: A Sallowdrudge uses their net to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a Medium or smaller creature within 30 feet. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed} until it Escapes (DC 16) or until an adjacent creature Interacts to remove the net. On a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained} rather than grabbed. The Sallowdrudge can't use Entangling Net again until they take 1 minute to refold their net.

Spear Fisher.name: Spear Fisher
Spear Fisher.description: A Sallowdrudge attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} target rolls the attack roll twice and takes the better result.

Scrabbling Ribcage.name: 窜爬肋廓 Scrabbling Ribcage
Scrabbling Ribcage.publicNotes:
窜爬肋廓的肋骨只与胸骨或脊椎之一相连，好让肋骨起到腿的功能。

常常被误认为不死生物，活化骨骼是一种与死灵术毫无关系的无心智构装体。以下几种是典型的活化骨骼样例。

Scrabble.name: 窜爬 Scrabble
Scrabble.description:
触发 一个生物移动远离窜爬肋廓，或被窜爬肋廓@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}的一个生物成功@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escapes}；

效果 肋廓行走或攀爬。这次移动不会触发反应。

Skittering Rush.name: 轻捷突进 Skittering Rush
Skittering Rush.description: 窜爬肋廓行走或攀爬两次，在这次移动时它的速度增加10尺。

Shadow Heart.name: Shadow Heart
Shadow Heart.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:26] or @Check[occultism|dc:26] (expert) to counter the heart's offensive magic, or @Check[religion|dc:28] (受训) to purify the area containing the heart. Four successes are required to disable it; after two successes, the shadow heart can't use its shadow lash Strike.
Shadow Heart.hazarddescription: A heart of tumorous, shadowy tissue unleashes magic on nearby creatures.
Shadow Heart.routine: The shadow heart uses Battering Vortex, and then uses shadow lash on a random creature within range.

Shadow Pulse.name: Shadow Pulse
Shadow Pulse.description:
触发 A creature approaches within 10 feet of the heart

效果 The heart gives a slow beat, and all creatures in the room must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1} and unable to take reactions for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3} on a critical failure). The dark heart then rolls initiative.

Battering Vortex.name: Battering Vortex
Battering Vortex.description:
A swirling vortex of shadows forms around the heart, lifting all creatures in the room and slamming them forcefully to the ground, dealing @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]] damage. Each creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save. Anyone adjacent to a wall may @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} with a successful @Check[reflex|dc:28] save; on a success at Grabbing an Edge, the creature uses a result one step better than the roll of their Fortitude save.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature takes half damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

失败 The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

大失败 The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 3} for 1 round.

Shadow Heart.reset: The heart deactivates if there are no creatures present in the room. It resets in 1 hour.

Shadowbound Monk Statue.name: Shadowbound Monk Statue

Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: Like normal objects, the statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 24.

Clinging Gloom.name: Clinging Gloom
Clinging Gloom.description: The statue pulls a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed} into its grasping shadows. The target takes @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,void]] damage.

Cowl of Shadow.name: Cowl of Shadow
Cowl of Shadow.description: Shifting shadows cover the statue. If the statue is dealt at least @Damage[15[vitality]] damage or brought within an area of magical light, the shadows recede, and the statue can't make darkness mote attacks or use Clinging Gloom.

Shadowbound Monk Statue.publicNotes:
As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

Shadowforged Guardian.name: Shadowforged Guardian

Eager Shadows.name: Eager Shadows
Eager Shadows.description: The shadowforged guardian increases all of its Speeds by 30 feet during the first round of combat after rolling initiative.

Induction Word.name: Induction Word
Induction Word.description: Each shadowforged guardian is activated during creation by a special word or short phrase spoken by its creator, and hearing this induction word resets its functions. If the guardian hears a creature within 30 feet utter its induction word, the guardian must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3} on a critical failure). Regardless of the result of this save, it's immune to utterances of its induction word until the end of its next turn.

Twilight Aura.name: Twilight Aura
Twilight Aura.description: 30 feet. The shadowforged guardian's presence dims light and brightens shadows to a strange, twilit half-light. Light can't emanate brighter than dim light in this area while darkness is simultaneously illuminated to dim light. The shadowy aura automatically attempts to counteract any 5th-rank or lower magical light or darkness effect brought into this aura or created in this area (counteract check [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21}, 5th level). As long as the guardian is in dim light, it gains a fly Speed of 30 feet.

Shadow Breath.name: Shadow Breath
Shadow Breath.description:
The shadowforged guardian expels a @Template[cone|distance:30] of twisting shadows from its mouth. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save. The guardian can't use Shadow Breath for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shadow Breath]]{1d4轮}.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its next turn.

失败 The creature is enfeebled 1 for 1 hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

大失败 The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 24 hours and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2} for 1 minute.

Shadowforged Guardian.publicNotes:
Shadowforged guardians are created through the intricate and dangerous process of siphoning penumbral energies and matter from the Shadow Plane and then binding them to a physical skeleton of wood and metal.

The first shadowforged guardians were created thousands of years ago in Nidal and were usually crafted in the likeness of that nation's patron deity, Zon-Kuthon. Shadowforged guardians are understandably in high demand; unfortunately, only the person who speaks a special word or phrase at the moment of the construct's creation can command it. Those who know the hidden formula to craft these constructs guard the secret well and only a few shadowcasters deign to create these guardians on another person's behalf-for a hefty price.

Shimmernewt.name: Shimmernewt

Gaping Chomp.name: Gaping Chomp
Gaping Chomp.description:
The shimmernewt chews on a creature that it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}. The target creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save.

大成功 The creature takes no damage.

成功 The creature takes @Damage[1d10[piercing]] damage.

失败 The creature takes @Damage[2d10[piercing]] damage and @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage.

大失败 The creature takes @Damage[4d10[piercing]] damage, @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} by the pain of the chomp.

Shimmer Step.name: Shimmer Step
Shimmer Step.description: The shimmernewt surges forward so quickly it slips through space, teleporting to a target for an unexpected attack. The shimmernewt teleports to an empty space adjacent to a creature it can see within 60 feet, then attempts a jaws Strike against the creature. The target creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against this Strike.

Trip.name: Trip
Trip.description:
需求 You have at least one hand free. Your target can't be more than one size larger than you

You try to knock a creature to the ground. Attempt an Athletics check against the target's Reflex DC.

大成功 The target falls and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

成功 The target falls and lands prone.

大失败 You lose your balance and fall and land prone.

Shimmernewt.publicNotes:
Native to the coastal provinces of eastern Holomog, these strange amphibians have frilled, iridescent gills that appear asymmetrically on either side of their bodies. Random arrays of spots, stripes, and other patterns decorate their flanks, and it's said no two shimmernewts have the same coloration. Originally, shimmernewts were ordinary (if oversized) amphibians, living their lives between brackish coastal lakes or tidal pools and the steamy jungles nearby. Over time, the ambient chaotic energies flowing through Holomog magically altered their evolution. The shimmernewts of today barely resemble their ancestors.

Their inherent chaotic nature has resulted in shimmernewts operating on different cycles from one another. Some are diurnal, some are nocturnal, but most are crepuscular. Shimmernewts that live close to peaceful humanoid settlements are often docile, but wild populations, whether deep in the jungle or in proximity to more violent settlements, can be quite aggressive. When provoked, all shimmernewts can inflate their gills in impressive displays to appear more attractive to mates or more intimidating to rivals. The capricious amphibians lack any natural predators, and conservation- minded locals are trying to prevent them from migrating further inland.

Some underground rings host shimmernewt fights, an unsavory form of entertainment made alluring by lucrative betting. Strolling down the docks of any port town in Holomog for a few minutes provokes whispered invitations to these fights. Though many locals decry these fights as inhumane, each time a ring is shut down, another group pops up sooner or later.

Sickle Blade.name: 小型摆镰 Sickle Blade
Sickle Blade.hazarddescription: 一只握着镰刀的骷髅手臂隐藏在天花板中，并连接至它下方的推拉门。

Sickle.name: 镰刀 Sickle
Sickle.description:
触发 一个生物尝试开门

效果 一只骷髅手臂抡着镰刀从天花板挥下，对触发生物进行一次打击。

Sickle Blade.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (受训) 用于门框或天花板凹槽，或在门另一侧使用交互动作来操作拉杆（分别位于D2和D4区）。
Sickle Blade.reset: 陷阱在15分钟后重置。此外，一个生物可以与门另一侧的拉杆交互来手动重设陷阱。

Lancer.name: Lancer
Lancer.description: The skeletal knight uses a lance in one hand, even when it isn't mounted. If the skeletal knight critically hits a creature with its lance Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1} until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

Skull Fairy.name: 颅骨仙 Skull Fairy

Coven.name: 巫团 Coven
Coven.description: 颅骨仙将@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{回避帷幕 Veil of Privacy}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{臭云术 Stinking Cloud}加入他们的巫团法术。

Shadowy Pop.name: 阴影炸裂 Shadowy Pop
Shadowy Pop.description: 当被杀死时，颅骨仙会像一个破裂的气泡一样炸成影子般朦胧的、有毒的组织。5尺内的所有生物都必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:18]豁免，否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}（大失败时获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3}）。

Skull Twist.name: 拧头 Skull Twist
Skull Twist.description:
需求 颅骨仙上一个动作是对一个有颅骨的生物进行的一次成功的拳头打击

效果 颅骨仙扭动该生物的脖子，使其迷失方向。该生物必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:20]豁免，否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}（大失败时获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}）。

Terminal Tug.name: 了结一拔 Terminal Tug
Terminal Tug.description: 颅骨仙试图揪下一个邻接@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{濒死 Dying}生物的头。目标必须尝试@Check[fortitude|dc:20]豁免。若失败，他死亡，颅骨仙获得10点临时生命，持续1小时。

Skull Fairy.publicNotes:
颅骨仙诞生自那些暴露在影界（ShadowPlane）的恶毒能量后身亡的生物的头。他们不是精类，但他们娇小、带翅的外形和进行恶毒的恶作剧的倾向使“颅骨仙”的称谓得以保留。

在从死者的头骨中迸发出来后，颅骨仙寻找着受害者来砍下他们的头。颅骨仙最喜欢的莫过于把头从身体上拧下来的可怖声音。他们经常把最近的受害者的颅骨像帽子一样戴在他们圆鼓鼓大脑袋上。颅骨仙把他们获得的头颅带到与世隔绝的山洞里，在那里他们小心翼翼地剥去血肉，露出颅骨。如果颅骨仙觉得自己需要新的头饰，他们会挖出一个新的颅骨来佩戴，并将旧的放到一个显眼的地方。

一个由正好三个颅骨仙组成的团体，如果每位都活了至少13年，就会变得比单独或年幼的亲族们强得多。这类巫团的成员会变得更强壮、更聪明，在把心思放在制造更大的范围邪恶和混乱上——尽管对于颅骨仙来说，任何比四处游荡拧下脑袋更复杂的事情都会显得很有追求。加入巫团的颅骨仙会获得精英调整，并常常获得更强大的内在法术。回避帷幕和臭云术是颅骨仙巫团能获得的最常见法术，但其他的法术当然存在。颅骨仙只能加入一个完全由颅骨仙组成的巫团。

Slamming Gate.name: 猛闭大门 Slamming Gate
Slamming Gate.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:15|traits:action:disable-a-device|name:Loosen the Gate Springs] (受训) 来在门猛地关上前松开它的弹簧。
Slamming Gate.hazarddescription: 沉重的大门在被拉开超过一半的时候就会猛地关回去。
Slamming Gate.reset: 这个陷阱可以通过拨动一个隐藏于附近墙壁上的拉杆来重启（或关闭，如果拨动拉杆时陷阱处于激活状态）。搜寻该区域的人物能通过成功的@Check[perception|dc:18|traits:action:seek]检定来发现它。

Slam Shut.name: 猛然关闭 Slam Shut
Slam Shut.description:
触发 门被拉开超过一半

效果 门猛地关上，对它闭合路径上的任何生物造成@Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物还会被关上的大门@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}，直到他@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escapes}（DC17）。

Solar Glass Golem.name: Solar Glass Golem

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by sonic (@Damage[8d6[untyped]], @Damage[2d6[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[2d6[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Spell Reflection.name: Spell Reflection
Spell Reflection.description:
Trigger The glass golem is targeted by a spell

Effect The glass golem positions its magical, reflective surfaces to turn the spell back on the caster. It tries to counteract the spell by attempting an @Check[acrobatics] check for its counteract check. If it successfully counteract the spell, the effect is turned back on the caster.

Vulnerable to Shatter.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
Vulnerable to Shatter.description: A glass golem is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell as though the golem were an unattended object.

Solar Flare.name: Solar Flare
Solar Flare.description:
The glass golem holds up its stained-glass frame and angles it downward, causing the image of the sun in the artwork to flash brightly, illuminating a @Template[cone|distance:30]. This blast of light deals @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage to creatures in the area, plus @Damage[4d6[vitality]]{4d6} additional vitality damage to undead creatures. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:30|traits:damaging-effect] save. If this solar flare overlaps an area of magical darkness, it attempts to counteract the darkness effect ([[/r 1d20+22 #Counteract]]{+22} counteract check).

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} permanently.

Solar Glass Golem.publicNotes:
Crafted of hardened glass and held together by magically treated lead, glass golems are both deadly guardians and works of exquisite art. Glass golems most often protect grand cathedrals or opulent palaces-testaments to the wealth and power of those they serve, or once served. Once spurred into action by the commands of their creators, glass golems are quicker and more agile than most other golems. Their sharp, blade-like limbs can easily sever veins and arteries, creating wounds that bleed profusely.

Of all the various types of golems, the glass golem is the one most akin to a work of art. Just as powerful aristocrats might use an ice golem for temperature regulation or a wood golem as an ego-boosting statue, a glass golem's colorful glass construction can elevate the beauty of any chamber by its mere presence.

Sorvinaesen.name: Sorvinaesen

equipment-Small Bag of Ash Containing a.name: Small Bag of Ash Containing a Black Onyx Gem

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d12[void]] damage energy in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Impart Doom.name: Impart Doom
Impart Doom.description: A creature hit by Sorvinaesen's claw Strike, or one who critically fails a save from one of Sorvinaesen's spells, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Visions of Death.name: Visions of Death
Visions of Death.description: Sorvinaesen's Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d10[mental]] damage to doomed creatures as visions of their impending deaths fill their minds.

Sorvinaesen.publicNotes:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

Straugh.name: Straugh

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[7d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Fetid Screech.name: Fetid Screech
Fetid Screech.description:
Unaware that its vocal organs have withered and decayed, the straugh instinctively but ineffectively attempts to screech, instead releasing malodorous gas, half-digested corpse flesh, and small swarms of maggots from its open beak. The straugh releases a disgusting cloud of gas and decaying detritus in a @Template[cone|distance:15]; any creature within the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. On a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5 foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. Any creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune to Fetid Screech for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.lIEc8Lx3ROm17Dqa]{Effect: Fetid Screech (Critical Failure)}

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[4d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: A straugh can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

Tunneling Strike.name: Tunneling Strike
Tunneling Strike.description:
Requirements The straugh has Burrowed underground and remains undetected by the creature it plans to attack

Effect The straugh Burrows twice to emerge from the ground adjacent to at least one enemy and immediately makes a Strike against that foe.

Straugh.publicNotes: When skirmishes break out between tunneling ghouls and creatures that dwell beneath the surface of Golarion, there's a chance that ghoul fever could infect such animals, producing strange new variants of ghoul beasts. However, letting the natural corruption run its course sometimes results in unsatisfying monsters, so some necromancers speed the process. This is the situation that led to the creation of the first straugh. A priest of Kabriri made the monstrosity to defend a claimed cemetery from another sect of ghouls who were preying upon the interred bodies. In some places, ghouls use straughs to tunnel into rival warrens or highly fortified mausoleums.

Independent Brains.name: Independent Brains
Independent Brains.description: Each of Sulvik's heads rolls its own initiative and has its own turn. Neither head can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.A72nHGUtNXgY5Ey9]{Delay}. At the start of a head's turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls its own tongue and one of Sulvik's arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever Sulvik's head (such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal} weapon property) doesn't cause him to die if he has his other head, but does cause him to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head. Mental effects that target a single creature affect only one of Sulvik's heads.

Mohrg Spawn.name: Mohrg Spawn
Mohrg Spawn.description: When Sulvik kills a living creature of 8th level or less, that creature rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.OaNtHZAraCrVLuSo]{Mohrg} after [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, on its turn. This mohrg spawn is under Sulvik's command. If Sulvik is destroyed, the mohrg spawn is destroyed as well, immediately collapsing into a pile of decayed flesh and bones.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: A living creature hit by Sulvik's tongue Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each attempt.

Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).name: 召唤符文-鸡蛇兽 Summoning Rune (Cockatrice)
Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).hazarddescription: 一团隐形的魔法传感器漂浮在一个隐形、刻在地表的符文上。

Summon Monster.name: 召唤怪物 Summon Monster
Summon Monster.description:
触发 一个生物进入那团魔法传感器

效果 陷阱召唤一只@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.MrzlaE7k1PEsd3iQ]。鸡蛇兽进行先攻检定并持续存在[[/gmr 2d6 #Summoning Duration]]{2d6轮}；持续时间过后，法术效果结束，鸡蛇兽消失。若在持续时间结束前有人解除了陷阱则鸡蛇兽也会消失。和大多数召唤的生物不同的是，此陷阱召唤的鸡蛇兽每轮拥有3个动作并且可以使用反应动作。

Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:18]检定在不触发陷阱的情况下接近陷阱，之后通过@Check[thievery|dc:20]（受训）来破坏符文的召唤效果，或通过@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]（2环级；反制DC17）来反制符文。

Sacrifice Minion.name: Sacrifice Minion
Sacrifice Minion.description:
触发 The teaching assistant is adjacent to a minion ally when they're targeted by an attack or an effect that requires a Reflex saving throw

效果 The triggering effect is redirected to target the minion ally.

Necromantic Revitalization.name: Necromantic Revitalization
Necromantic Revitalization.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The teaching assistant disperses void energy in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Living creatures in the area take @Damage[3d8[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic]); willing undead creatures in the area regain an equal amount of Hit Points.

Tenebric Giant.name: Tenebric Giant

Cloying Shadows.name: Cloying Shadows
Cloying Shadows.description:
The tenebric giant's attacks leave behind a residue of energy from the Shadow Plane. A creature hit by the tenebric giant's melee Strike takes an additional 1d8 persistent void damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:36] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until its next turn begins.

Failure The creature is blinded for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is permanently blinded.

Tenebric Stride.name: Tenebric Stride
Tenebric Stride.description: The tenebric giant can move quickly in shadowy conditions. The tenebric giant Strides twice and makes a scythe Strike at any point during this movement against a target that is in darkness or dim light. This movement doesn't provoke reactions.

Tenebric Giant.publicNotes: Necromancers reaching for the greatest heights of experimentation know that creating a new terror requires exacting, careful work at every stage of the process. In the case of the tenebric giant, this process begins with a tomb giant who dies after consuming a dose of several poisons combined with the shadow ash reagent. This creates the right circumstances for a necromancer to raise them as a tenebric giant. They're particularly obedient to the will of the necromancer who created them and are charged full of energy from the Shadow Plane, which grants them new powers and abilities.

Terra-cotta Soldier.name: Terra-cotta Soldier
Terra-cotta Soldier.publicNotes:
Terra-cotta warriors guard the tombs of ancient rulers, where they stand vigil, animating only when intruders break in to pilfer riches or defile the tomb itself. Each warrior is meticulously crafted from clay and given unique features.

A single terra-cotta warrior stands 6 feet tall and weighs 600 pounds.

Terrorguard.name: Terrorguard
Terrorguard.publicNotes: Spellcasters who harness the power of the Dimension of Dreams may use it to fuel vicious servitors known as terrorguards-hulking terrors adorned with frames made of an Abysium alloy. Terrorguards come in many forms; creators often design the constructs' frames to mimic grotesque aberrations by mixing-and-matching parts.

Breath of Phantasms.name: Breath of Phantasms
Breath of Phantasms.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The terrorguard's ram-skull head opens at the jaw, allowing a horde of swirling phantasms to escape from its maw in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Each creature in the area is subjected to a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} spell (@Check[will|dc:31], @Check[fortitude|dc:31|traits:incapacitation]).

Draw the Line.name: Draw the Line
Draw the Line.description: A terrorguard plunges its dreamscythe into the ground and rends a glowing line across the surface that reverberates with the essence of the Dimension of Dreams. Chose up to four unoccupied squares which are adjacent to one another and adjacent to the terrorguard. For [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, any creature besides the terrorguard who enters such a square must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:31] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4} as they behold grotesque visions from the nightmare realm. A creature that succeeds at this save is temporarily immune to the effect for 24 hours.

Nightmare Essence.name: Nightmare Essence
Nightmare Essence.description: A creature damaged by a terrorguard's dreamscythe hallucinates that the environment and creatures around them have transformed into a hellscape reminiscent of their most horrifying dreams. A creature hit with a dreamscythe Strike must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:31] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. A creature who succeeds at this save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Skull Charge.name: Skull Charge
Skull Charge.description: The terrorguard Strides twice in a straight line and then makes a horn Strike with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

The Fight.name: The Fight
The Fight.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:28] or @Check[religion|dc:28] (expert) in the room to drain away the haunt's spiritual energy. Each successful check reduces the number of actions in the haunt's routine; three successful checks are required to completely disable the haunt.
The Fight.hazarddescription: Nearby creatures are caught in the memory of the struggle between Iron Taviah and the Benefactor.
The Fight.reset: Unless completely disabled or destroyed, the haunt resets at the next moonrise at full strength.

Spectral Combat.name: Spectral Combat
Spectral Combat.description:
触发 A creature approaches within 10 feet of the spilled goblet

效果 The desperation of the sudden fight fills the minds of all creatures in the dining room as the apparition of Iron Taviah at the north end of the table lunges. The haunt deals @Damage[4d10[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:30|basic]) to each creature in the room. On a failed save, the creature also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,mental]] damage. The haunt then rolls for initiative.

The Fight.routine: (3 actions) The spectral Taviah uses 1 action to appear adjacent to a random creature within 30 feet if not already adjacent to a creature. It then uses its spectral claw Strike with its remaining actions.

The Flight.name: The Flight
The Flight.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:30] or @Check[religion|dc:30] (expert) to drain away the haunt's spiritual energy. This check can be attempted only from the top of the stairs behind the secret door.
The Flight.reset: The haunt ends as soon as there are no creatures within 60 feet. It resets when the secret door is closed.

Defensive Shove.name: Defensive Shove
Defensive Shove.description:
触发 The secret door to the basement stairs opens

效果 The spectral figure's shout shoves every creature in the room away from the east wall. Creatures in the drawing room or the adjacent foyer must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

大成功 The creature isn't moved.

成功 The creature is pushed back 10 feet. If this movement would push it into a wall, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to the number of feet it was moved.

失败 As success, but 20 feet and the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

大失败 As success, but 20 feet, and the creature is knocked prone and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}.

The Flight.hazarddescription: The spectral figure of a handsome, well-dressed man flees down the stairs, clutching a wound in his side with one hand and making a shoving motion with the other. His shout drives creatures back.
The Flight.routine: (1 动作) (divine, evocation, incapacitation, sonic) The spectral figure shouts, dealing @Damage[4d10[sonic]] damage to all creatures within 60 feet of the secret door (@Check[will|dc:28|basic|traits:divine,evocation,incapacitation,sonic]). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed} for 1 round.

The Putrid Rise.name: The Putrid Rise
The Putrid Rise.hazarddescription: The stink of bile suddenly grows as the myriad mouths carved into the walls begin to vomit forth a deluge of acidic slurry.
The Putrid Rise.reset: The trap deactivates 1 round after no targets can be sensed, but resets immediately.

Vomit.name: Vomit
Vomit.description:
触发 The trap's sensors notice a creature on the stairs north of the entrance to area D4

效果 The myriad mouths on the walls spew out a foul-smelling acidic slurry along the entire stairwell. The stairs in areas D3 become difficult terrain, and all creatures in area D3 must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:34|traits:damaging-effect] saving throw. A creature that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} by hunger takes a -2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw. The trap then rolls initiative.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature takes @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}.

失败 The creature takes @Damage[8d6[acid]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}, and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

大失败 The creature takes @Damage[16d6[acid]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3}, is knocked prone, and then tumbles down the stairs. The fall ends once the creature reaches the next lowest landing (note that a creature falling at the lowest flight tumbles into the carrion pit at area D2, but can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} as detailed in that room). A creature that falls down the steps takes an additional @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic]) from the tumble, regardless of the total distance traveled.

The Putrid Rise.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) to disrupt the trap's magical network of sensors and effectively "blind" it to targets to react to, @Check[religion|dc:38] (master) to recognize the carvings and recall one of the mantras needed to pass safely, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank; counteract DC 32) to counteract the trap.
The Putrid Rise.routine: On its turn, the trap Vomits as its action. As long as the Putrid Rise is active, the stairs in area D3 are difficult terrain.

Theater Phantasm.name: Theater Phantasm
Theater Phantasm.publicNotes: Theater phantasms are amalgamations of the spiritual and emotional energy given up by entertainers and audiences of powerful performances.
Theater Phantasm.hp: emotional consumption, dramatic return, void healing

Bonded Theater.name: Bonded Theater
Bonded Theater.description: A theater phantasm can't travel more than 50 feet from the theater (or similar location) where it was created.

Catharsis.name: Catharsis
Catharsis.description: When a theater phantasm is destroyed, it emits waves of emotional energy. All creatures within 50 feet take @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:34|basic]) as they experience a crushing barrage of emotions.

Dramatic Return.name: Dramatic Return
Dramatic Return.description: A destroyed theater phantasm slowly reforms to full strength over the course of 1 week. The only way to permanently destroy the phantasm is to reduce it to 0 Hit Points during a performance occurring in its bonded theater.

Emotional Consumption.name: Emotional Consumption
Emotional Consumption.description: If a theater phantasm is within 100 feet of an audience of 20 or more intelligent beings witnessing a performance in its bonded theater, it gains fast healing 20.

Spotlight.name: Spotlight
Spotlight.description:
Frequency once per round

效果 The theater phantasm draws attention to a creature it admires. The phantasm designates a target other than itself within 50 feet with a subtle spotlight, giving the target a +2 status bonus to Performance checks and resistance 10 to mental damage for 1 minute. If it uses this ability again on a new target, the former creature loses its spotlight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.irSKPLF5oLfnqUNW]{Effect: Spotlight}

Tombstone Troll.name: 墓碑巨魔 Tombstone Troll
Tombstone Troll.hp: 再生 5 (酸，火焰或命能使其失效)

Regeneration 5 (Deactivated by Acid, Fir.name: 再生 5 (酸，火焰或命能使其失效)

Death Feast.name: 死亡盛宴 Death Feast
Death Feast.description:
需求 墓碑巨魔上一个动作是对一个活物或尸体进行的啃咬打击

效果 巨魔对目标造成@Damage[1d6[bleed]]伤害，因为他吞下一口肉并将其转化为虚能。它的颚齿和利爪打击会在1分钟内造成额外1点虚能伤害，或者直到它使用坟墓吐息能力，以先发生的为准。

Grave Breath.name: 坟墓吐息 Grave Breath
Grave Breath.description:
需求 巨魔正因为死亡盛宴能力而胀满虚能；

效果 巨魔呼出一道@Template[cone|distance:15]范围的腐臭、寒冷入魂的气体。区域内的所有生物受到@Damage[2d6[void]]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:14|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还会额外获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。巨魔在再次使用死亡盛宴之前不能使用本能力。

Regeneration 5 (Deactivated by Acid, Fir.name: Regeneration 5 (Deactivated by Acid, Fire, or Vitality)

Tombstone Troll.publicNotes:
有时，当巨魔从死灵法术或虚能造成的危及生命的伤口中再生时，邪恶的能量会在巨魔韧性超凡的再生中占据优势。本应杀死巨魔的力量反而成为巨魔奇怪的生理结构的一部分。这些巨魔并非不死生物，但他们体内的力量侵蚀着他们的身体和灵魂，令他们字面意义上的变成了以前的缩影。这些所谓的“墓碑巨魔”就像枯槁、矮小的巨魔，因饥饿而浮肿，其病态一览无余。他们的牙齿、头发和指甲每隔几天就会腐烂、脱落又再生，这种无休止的循环看上去既痛苦又恶心。

其他巨魔回避并鄙视墓碑巨魔，这名字源于他们挖坟来寻找没法反抗的食物的习惯。墓碑巨魔回避任何形式的对抗，尤其是在他们盗墓可能使他们与强大的不死生物发生冲突的地方。他们经常在地下筑巢，每次在墓园的洞穴中安全地呆上几天，逐渐挖出地道吞噬附近的尸体。除了土壤中的一些凹陷或软点外，地面可能没有任何它们存在的证据。一旦墓碑巨魔吃光了坟场里唾手可得的食物，它就会在夜深人静的时候继续前进，寻找新的猎场。若他们的旅途漫长或艰难，饥饿感可能会驱使他们去攻击活人。

Tylegmut's Last Meal.name: 泰拉格穆特的最后一餐 Tylegmut's Last Meal
Tylegmut's Last Meal.hazarddescription: 前银行经理那幽灵般的存在，诱惑着生物去享用一顿可疑的食物。
Tylegmut's Last Meal.reset: 作祟在1小时后重组。如果一个生物在办公桌前吃了一顿饱饭，作祟就会被解除并不会重新重组——这顿饭可以是任何食物，而不仅仅是此刻桌上的“食物”。

Foul Temptation.name: 恶浊诱惑 Foul Temptation
Foul Temptation.description:
触发 一个生物看了眼桌上的东西

效果 作祟将摆在桌上的盘碗中的食物隐藏于一个令观察者认为它们很美味的幻象中，引诱周围的生物吃下它们。身处D5区的所有生物必须进行一次@Check[will|dc:21]豁免检定。接着，作祟骰先攻。

大成功 该生物完全识破了幻象，并在1分钟内临时免疫作祟的流程。

成功 该生物未被食物引诱。

失败 该生物认为食物十分诱人，并被驱使着去食用它们。该生物会因咀嚼锯齿状的骨骼和虫壳而受到@Damage[(4d4+4)[slashing]]伤害。

大失败 如同失败，但该生物受到双倍伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}1轮，因为作祟正不断地引诱他。

Tylegmut's Last Meal.disable: @Check[religion|dc:18|name:Recite a Prayer to Urgathoa] (受训) 来向厄伽图娅祈祷，并让作祟暂时安息至其下一次重置，@Check[occultism|dc:22|name:Commune with the Manager's Spirit] (受训) 来与银行经理的魂魄沟通并说服她永久离世，从而解除作祟。
Tylegmut's Last Meal.routine: (1 动作) 作祟发出一股席卷整个房间的灰尘与骨片云。尘土和碎骨猛击房间里的所有生物，造成@Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{目盲 Blinded}1轮（大失败则为1分钟）。

prototypeToken.name: 泰拉格穆特的最后一餐

Umbraex.name: Umbraex
Umbraex.hp: ashen rise, void healing, regeneration 20 (deactivated by fire or holy)

Ashen Rise.name: Ashen Rise
Ashen Rise.description: When an umbraex is destroyed, its body discorporates into fine ash before being restored, fully healed, [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4轮} later. An umbraex can't use this ability as long as its remains are within an area consecrated to a good deity or an area of bright light. The umbraex can't use Ashen Rise again for 1 day.

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description: 40 feet. Umbraex leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes @Damage[8d6[void]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the vanyver.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: An umbraex caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}.

Life-Siphoning Screech.name: Life-Siphoning Screech
Life-Siphoning Screech.description:
The umbraex Flies, shrieking as it passes its enemies. Creatures within 20 feet of the umbraex's flight path take @Damage[22d6[mental]] damage depending on their @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

失败 The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

大失败 The creature takes double damage and is drained 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Umbraex.publicNotes: An umbraex appears at first glance to be a massive, majestic bird, much like a phoenix. Instead of compassion and warmth, however, it seethes with cold and hate. The umbraex is among the largest of the nihilistic undead called darvakkas.

Unfinished Portalrender.name: Unfinished Portalrender
Unfinished Portalrender.hazarddescription: A sphere of concentrated agony harvested from a qlippoth begins pulsing with violet light as it blasts the room with otherworldly agony.
Unfinished Portalrender.routine: The unfinished portalrender continues to flood area B4 with agony, and everyone in the room must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save against its Agonizing Pulse. At the end of its turn, the unfinished portalrender attempts a @Check[flat|dc:6]. On a failure, its stores of agony deplete and it deactivates, causing the central orb of agony to fade away permanently.

Agonizing Pulse.name: Agonizing Pulse
Agonizing Pulse.description:
触发 The unfinished portalrender takes any damage or is moved (the portalrender is Bulk 5)

效果 The central sphere of concentrated agony flashes bright violet, filling the mind's of the room's inhabitants with overwhelming mental sensations of pain and hallucinations that the world around them is being torn away and replaced by a demon-haunted apocalypse. All creatures in area B4 must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save, then the trap rolls initiative.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage from the pain.

失败 The creature takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage from the pain and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} until the end of their next turn.

大失败 The creature takes @Damage[16d6[mental]] damage from the pain, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}, and is confused for 1 minute.

Unfinished Portalrender.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:37] (master) to dismantle the housing and refocus the agony inward so it consumes itself harmlessly, @Check[arcana|dc:33] or @Check[occultism|dc:33] (master) to vent the agony in a controlled way that causes the portalrender to become inert after 1 minute (during which it can still be triggered normally), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank; counteract DC 31)

Urbulinex.name: Urbulinex

Cowering Fear.name: Cowering Fear
Cowering Fear.description:
90 feet. @Check[will|dc:37]

A ravener's frightful presence causes creatures to cower in fear as well. As long as a creature is at least @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or more as a result of the ravener's frightful presence, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} from the fear.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Discorporate.name: Discorporate
Discorporate.description:
触发 The ravener takes excess damage to their soul ward but still has at least 51 Hit Points in their soul ward

效果 The ravener draws deeply into their soul ward, discorporating their body into soul energy in order to escape. They take 50 damage to their soul ward and their physical body vanishes, reappearing [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours} later in a random location within 1 mile from the location where they used Discorporate.

Soul Ward.name: Soul Ward
Soul Ward.description:
An intangible field of necromantic energy protects a ravener from total destruction. A soul ward has 150 maximum Hit Points.

Whenever a ravener would be reduced below 1 Hit Point, all damage in excess of what would reduce them to 1 Hit Point is instead dealt to their soul ward. If this damage reduces the soul ward to fewer than 0 Hit Points, the ravener is destroyed.

A soul ward's Hit Points can be restored only via specific ravener abilities such as Consume Soul, ravenous breath, or vicious criticals. A ravener who goes more than a week without successfully using Consume Soul to feed on a dying creature starves, and their soul ward loses [[/r {1d4} #Soul Ward Decay]] Hit Points each day until they feed. If the ravener's soul ward loses all its Hit Points while the ravener still has more than 1 HP, they become a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.Yv0005Vym1peVKHq]{Ravener Husk}.

Consume Soul.name: Consume Soul
Consume Soul.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet of the ravener dies

Effect The ravener tears the creature's soul from its body with their maw and gulps it down. The dying creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save with the same DC as the ravener's Breath Weapon.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The ravener tears off a small chunk of the creature's soul. If the victim is restored to life, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} in addition to any other side effects of returning to life. The ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to half the creature's level.

Failure As success, but the creature's soul is ravaged. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to the creature's level.

Critical Failure As failure, but the ravener devours the entire soul. The victim can't be restored to life as long as the ravener exists except via a 10th-rank effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to twice the creature's level.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The ravener makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The ravener recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Ghost Bane.name: Ghost Bane
Ghost Bane.description: The ravener's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune, and the ravener's jaws deal an additional @Damage[6d6[force]] damage to undead.

Ravenous Breath Weapon.name: Ravenous Breath Weapon
Ravenous Breath Weapon.description:
The ravener breathes in one of two ways. With either option, a creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). If at least one creature is drained by the ravener's Ravenous Breath Weapon, the ravener's soul ward gains @Damage[5[healing]] HP. The ravener can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Void (necromancy, primal, void) The ravener breathes a blast of darkness in a @Template[cone|distance:40] that deals @Damage[17d6[void],4d6[persistent,void]]{17d6 void damage plus 4d6 persistent void damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic|traits:necromancy,primal,void] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[22d6[force]] damage instead of the void damage.
  • Shadows (necromancy, primal, shadow) The ravener breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[cone|distance:40]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:39|traits:necromancy,primal,shadow] save.

    Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

    Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

    Failure The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.

    Critical Failure The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Vicious Criticals.name: Vicious Criticals
Vicious Criticals.description:
The ravener treats an attack roll as a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, as long as the attack roll was a success. Additionally, whenever the ravener makes a critical hit with one of their Strikes, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save or gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} condition. If the target already has a drained value of greater than 0, their drained value instead increases by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}. Whenever the ravener applies drain to a creature in this way, their soul ward gains 5 Hit Points.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

Soulsense 60 feet.name: Soulsense 60 feet
Soulsense 60 feet.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.

Urbulinex.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Urglid.name: Urglid
Urglid.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Consecration Vulnerability.name: Consecration Vulnerability
Consecration Vulnerability.description: Dedicated to the desecration of graves, an urglid takes @Damage[(3d6 + 6)[mental]] damage each round it's within the area of an effect with the consecration trait. In addition, the demon takes triple the damage from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water}.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The urglid can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, the urglid moves at their full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing unless they choose to do so.

Gravechoke.name: Gravechoke
Gravechoke.description: The urglid emits a putrid pulse that targets all living creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area that fail a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Ravenous Earth.name: Ravenous Earth
Ravenous Earth.description: With a single, devious thought, the urglid causes a mound of grave soil to well up at a creature's feet. A creature failing a @Check[reflex|dc:30] save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}. The restrained creature then begins sinking below the ground into a spontaneously formed grave. A creature restrained by this ability for three rounds is buried 6 feet deep in the ground and begins suffocating within 1 minute. A buried creature must be dug up to be freed. A creature who is slain by Ravenous Earth rises as a ghoul the next midnight.

Urglid.publicNotes: The hulking monstrosities known as urglids form from the souls of murderous undertakers, sadists who buried their victims alive, and intentionally neglectful grave keepers who gave up their watch over the dead. Standing over 30 feet tall and weighing over 3,000 pounds, the demon's head seems sunken into its torso, and a gaping, toothy mouth opens at the top of its chest.

Vampire Guardian.name: Vampire Guardian
Vampire Guardian.hp: 寝于棺木, 快速治疗 10, 虚能治疗

Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Mist Escape.name: Mist Escape
Mist Escape.description:
触发 The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

效果 The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with a +21 attack bonus. These fangs deal the same amount of damage as the vampire's claws, but deal piercing damage rather than slashing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Create Spawn.name: Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|against:will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

Dominate.name: Dominate
Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains @Damage[13[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A vampire guardian deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Turn to Mist.name: Turn to Mist
Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

Vampire Taviah.name: Vampire Taviah
Vampire Taviah.hp: 快速治疗 10, 虚能治疗

Thoughtsense 100 feet.name: Thoughtsense 100 feet
Thoughtsense 100 feet.description: Taviah senses non-mindless creatures within 100 feet as a precise sense.

Magaambya Scar.name: Magaambya Scar
Magaambya Scar.description: A physical attack on Taviah that scores a critical hit exacerbates the injury in her wounded leg; in addition to the other effects of the critical hit, Taviah is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}.

Mental Rebirth.name: Mental Rebirth
Mental Rebirth.description:
Unlike most other undead, a vetalarana isn't destroyed when they reach 0 HP. Instead, their body is destroyed, crumbling to ash, and their mind is immediately transferred into a creature they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts. This creature must be within 1 mile; if no such creature is in range, the vetalarana is destroyed. The creature becomes controlled by the vetalarana and loses the stupefied and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious} conditions. If the creature controlled by a vetalarana in this way is killed, the vetalarana's mind transfers to another creature within 1 mile who they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts.
