Critical Success The eseneth grabs the target's soul. The body is released and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 2 rounds. When the body ceases being paralyzed, its soul returns instantly and the target wakes. The soul—grabbed by the eseneth—is incorporeal, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, has a fly Speed equal to the creature's Speed, and otherwise has all the same statistics. It can't attack, cast spells, or attempt any skill checks that require a physical body other than checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}, and it must always maintain line of effect to its body.

Success As critical success, but the paralysis ends after 1 round.

Failure The target remains grabbed or restrained, but its soul remains in its body.

Critical Failure The grab ends.

Shred Soul.name: Shred Soul
Shred Soul.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The eseneth deals @Damage[(3d10+14)[force]] damage to an incorporeal creature they've @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Spirit Grasp.name: Spirit Grasp
Spirit Grasp.description: An eseneth can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} incorporeal creatures despite being corporeal. The eseneth uses their Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] incorporeal creatures as normal but can't use Athletics for other actions against incorporeal creatures, like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}.

Spirit Touch.name: Spirit Touch
Spirit Touch.description: A eseneth's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[2d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[2d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Button Mash.name: Button Mash
Button Mash.hazarddescription: The room floods with harmful effects by pressing a magic sigil on a console. Each sigil causes different results. There are six sigils on the console.
Button Mash.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:40] (master) to disenchant each sigil (can be done from either side of the reception desk), @Check[thievery|dc:43] (master) twice to disable the console (can only be done while behind the reception desk), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 40) to counteract each sigil; prevent Noph from pressing the buttons by gaining access to the reception desk or other methods

Lockdown.name: Lockdown
Lockdown.description:
Trigger Noph or another creature arms the trap by pressing a sigil on the console

Effect A barrier of force forms from floor to ceiling surrounding the reception desk. The DC to counteract this barrier with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} is 43. The trap then rolls initiative.

Button Mash.routine:
(2 actions) Noph frantically pecks and stomps on the console, using each action to press a random sigil. Roll [[/gmr 1d6 #Pressed Sigil]] to determine which sigil Noph presses. Psychopomps are immune to the effects of these sigils.

1 The area is flooded with holy light, dealing @Damage[(3d12+19)[vitality]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic]).

2 The area is flooded with unholy darkness, dealing @Damage[(3d12+19)[void]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic]).

3 The area is flooded with blue flames, dealing @Damage[(3d10+19)[fire]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic]). On a critical failure, a creature additionally takes @Damage[1d10[persistent,fire]] damage.

4 A comet streaks through the area, attacking the nearest creature to Noph with a comet Strike.

5 Force tethers sprout from the floor, grasping at intruders. Each creature in the area is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:43] save.

6 Ghostly blue mist surrounds each psychopomp in the area, healing them @Damage[(3d8+19)[healing]]{3d8+19} HP and granting them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} for 1 round.

equipment-Facetbound Nullifier.name: equipment-Facetbound Nullifier
equipment-Facetbound Nullifier.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Implanted Stone.name: Implanted Stone
Implanted Stone.description: A nullifier's aeon stone can't be Disarmed or removed until the nullifier is destroyed.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Always Ready.name: Always Ready
Always Ready.description: The nullifier gains an additional reaction each round that can be used only for Defensive Dispel.

Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

The nullifier can also make attacks of opportunity against concentrate actions to Cast a Spell, and it disrupts that action on any hit, not just a critical hit.

Field of Force.name: Field of Force
Field of Force.description: A nullifier's melee Strikes deal an additional 2d10 force damage (already included in the Strikes above).

Sever Spell.name: Sever Spell
Sever Spell.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The nullifier makes a melee Strike against a target. If the attack hits, the nullifier attempts to counteract a spell or magical effect on the target (of the nullifier's choice), with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27]]{+27}. The target is temporarily immune to Sever Spell for 24 hours.

Defensive Dispel.name: Defensive Dispel
Defensive Dispel.description:
Trigger The nullifier is the target of a spell

Effect The nullifier attempts to counteract the triggering spell, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 #Counteract]]{+27}. This can be used only on spells that target the nullifier, not area spells that don't have targets. If it succeeds, it counteracts the spell for all targets, if other creatures were targeted in addition to the nullifier.

equipment-Facetbound Nullifier.publicNotes:
Designed to serve as devastatingly powerful foot soldiers against enemies with plentiful magic, facetbound nullifiers shear through magical effects as easily as they slice through flesh and bone. The pale lavender ellipsoid aeon stones they bear are sunk deep into their heads and surrounded by an ugly bruise.

Inspired by the work of the Azlanti and their obsessions with aeon stones, certain necromancers strive to tap into those curious magical items to create undead with powerful abilities. A facetbound is created from a living being with an aeon stone surgically attached to their skull who is killed in a specific, secret ritual. Each facetbound must bear a single aeon stone, and this stone determines the powers the facetbound wields (in place of the normal powers of the implanted stone)

Bravery.name: Bravery
Bravery.description: Whenever the defender rolls a success at a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the frightened condition, they reduce its value by 1.

Offensive Line.description: The defender's Strikes deal an extra 1d6 damage when adjacent to an ally.
Offensive Line.name: Offensive Line

Avian Rage.hazarddescription: Hundreds of panicked whippoorwills swarm through the area.
Avian Rage.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any undead or creatures with void healing in the garden.

Panic!.name: Panic!
Panic!.description:
Trigger An undead or a creature with void healing enters the garden

Effect The birds screech in panic, dealing @Damage[(3d12+20)[sonic]] damage to all creatures in the garden (@Check[fortitude|dc:44|basic]). On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure). The trap then rolls initiative.

Avian Rage.name: Avian Rage
Avian Rage.disable: @Check[nature|dc:43] (master) to calm the birds, @Check[occultism|dc:45] (master) to alter your aura, or @Check[performance|dc:45] (master) to imitate the living
Avian Rage.routine: (1 action) The birds swarm wildly through the garden, pecking and slashing at all undead creatures and creatures with void healing in the garden, dealing @Damage[(3d10+20)[slashing]] damage and @Damage[1d10[bleed]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic]).

equipment-Facetbound Cascader.name: equipment-Facetbound Cascader
equipment-Facetbound Cascader.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Implanted Stone.name: Implanted Stone
Implanted Stone.description: A cascader's aeon stone can't be Disarmed or removed until the cascader is destroyed.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Energy Ward.name: Energy Ward
Energy Ward.description:
Trigger The facetbound cascader would take acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage

Effect The cascader gains resistance 15 to the triggering damage, replacing any other resistance gained from this ability. Most facetbound cascaders begin combat with resistance 15 to cold.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.No817gKxdliCVQ9K]{Effect: Energy Ward}

Energy Charge.name: Energy Charge
Energy Charge.description: The cascader's melee Strikes deal an additional 4d10 damage of the type resisted by its Energy Ward.

Energy Shift.name: Energy Shift
Energy Shift.description: The cascader can alter its spell damage. If the next action it uses is to Cast a Spell that deals acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage, the cascader can change the damage type to match its Energy Ward instead of the spell's normal damage type (replacing the spell's corresponding trait).

equipment-Facetbound Cascader.publicNotes:
Facetbound cascaders must have been arcane spellcasters in life; in undeath, they draw upon the power of embedded orange prism aeon stones to defend themselves from magical damage and redirect that energy toward their opponents. Despite their incredible intelligence, facetbound cascaders have few memories of their former lives and typically serve the whims of their creator.

Inspired by the work of the Azlanti and their obsessions with aeon stones, certain necromancers strive to tap into those curious magical items to create undead with powerful abilities. A facetbound is created from a living being with an aeon stone surgically attached to their skull who is killed in a specific, secret ritual. Each facetbound must bear a single aeon stone, and this stone determines the powers the facetbound wields (in place of the normal powers of the implanted stone)

Crush the Uninvited.name: Crush the Uninvited
Crush the Uninvited.hazarddescription: A warning carved into the door frame magically crushes any who pass through the doorway without Kemnebi's permission.
Crush the Uninvited.stealthdetails: (legendary); @Check[perception|dc:20] to notice the warning carved in the door frame

Implosion.name: Implosion
Implosion.description:
Trigger A creature passes through the doorway without Kemnebi's permission

Effect The trap casts implosion on the triggering creature. This is a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4WS7HrFjwNvTn8T2]{Implosion} spell that deals [[/r 85 #Implosion Damage]]{85} damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:47|basic]).

Crush the Uninvited.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to scratch out the warning or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th rank; counteract DC 48) to counteract the magic in the warning

equipment-Aeolaeka.name: equipment-Aeolaeka

Earthglide.name: Earthglide
Earthglide.description: An aeolaeka can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, the aeolaeka moves at their full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of their passing.

Liberate the Earth.name: Liberate the Earth
Liberate the Earth.description:
The aeolaeka conjures churning stones, creating a @Template[line|distance:60]{60-foot-long line} of rolling boulders that deals @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|traits:damaging-effect|dc:32] save, after which the area becomes difficult terrain for 24 hours before the leftover stone crumbles to dust. The aeolaeka can't Liberate the Earth for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Liberate the Earth]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the rubble (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 32).

Statue.name: Statue
Statue.description: Until the next time they act, the aeolaeka appears to be a statue. They have an automatic result of 45 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue.

Sacred Hammer.name: Sacred Hammer
Sacred Hammer.description: Any bludgeoning weapon becomes a holy striking weapon while the aeolaeka wields it.

equipment-Aeolaeka.publicNotes: Aeolaekas, also known as stone azatas, embody the slow but inevitable chaos of rock itself. Stone is often thought to be steadfast and unchanging, but, when viewed on a grander scale over vast periods of time, stone can transform into things as diverse as intricate crystals and fine powder. To the aeolaeka, anything that could become either sand or diamond is the very incarnation of the chaos of reality-just on a slower scale. As a result of their stone affinity, aeolaekas are less capricious than other azatas, and some have willingly forged lasting accords or agreements with mortals. Stone-skinned aeolaekas are sometimes mistaken for statues and use this fact to hide in plain sight when they don't want their presence known.

Shadow Shift.name: Shadow Shift
Shadow Shift.description: Being made partially of shadow themselves, shae are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} in dim light or darkness even to creatures that can see clearly in those light levels.

Slip.name: Slip
Slip.description:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to Ghiono

Effect Ghiono teleports to a clear space adjacent to another creature he can see within 30 feet.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Ghiono deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Tenebral Form.name: Tenebral Form
Tenebral Form.description: Ghiono can Fly at full Speed in @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form}.

Counterattack.name: Counterattack
Counterattack.description:
Trigger Ghiono is targeted by an attack from an adjacent creature that misses due to him being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}

Requirements Ghiono is aware of the attack

Effect Ghiono makes a Strike against the attacker.

Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
Bardic Lore.description: Lasheeli can use Bardic Lore to Recall Knowledge on any topic.

Cautionary Tale.name: Cautionary Tale
Cautionary Tale.description:
Trigger Lasheeli or an ally within 30 feet attempts a Will save

Effect Lasheeli orates a line or two from one of her stories and makes a Performance check. Lasheeli and any allies can use the better result of her check or their saving throw.

Divine Aegis.name: Divine Aegis
Divine Aegis.description: Once per day when Lasheeli takes damage that would reduce her to 0 Hit Points, a radiant, holy shield flashes over her, negating all of the attack's evil damage and half of any other damage the attack deals. If the attacker is within 60 feet, divine aegis deals the attacker the same amount of damage it prevented (of the same type, except that if divine aegis prevents evil damage, it deals the attacker good damage instead).

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Lasheeli's spellcasting, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]; on a success, the spell isn't disrupted.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul gnawer is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghoul gnawer devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 5d6[healing]]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Drain Corpse.name: Drain Corpse
Drain Corpse.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The ghoul gnawer uses Consume Flesh

Effect In addition to gaining Hit Points, using Consume Flesh refreshes one spell slot the cultist has already expended.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

Stage 1 carrier with no effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and regains half as many hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul gnawer's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

equipment-Graelar the Whisper.name: equipment-Graelar the Whisper

Dooming Touch.name: Dooming Touch
Dooming Touch.description: The tomb giant's claws carry the accursed power of their foul gods. A creature hit by the tomb giant's claw Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of negative energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with negative energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this negative energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d12[void]] damage in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic]); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Slippery Fighter.name: Slippery Fighter
Slippery Fighter.description: Graelar moves up to his Speed, attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} a creature within his reach, then makes a melee Strike against that creature.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Graelar's Strikes deal an extra 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

equipment-Graelar the Whisper.publicNotes:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

Biting Snakes.name: Biting Snakes
Biting Snakes.description:
Trigger A creature ends its turn adjacent to Kerinza

Effect Kerinza makes a snake fangs Strike against the creature.

Petrifying Gaze.name: Petrifying Gaze
Petrifying Gaze.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save. If the creature fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute. Kerinza can activate or deactivate this aura by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait, but deactivating it is painful for her; she gains weakness 15 to physical damage while her petrifying gaze is deactivated.

Focus Gaze.name: Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: Kerinza fixes her glare on a creature she can see within 30 feet. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save against Kerinza's petrifying gaze. If the target was already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} before attempting its save, a failed save causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} permanently. After attempting its save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of Kerinza's next turn.

Quick Responses.name: Quick Responses
Quick Responses.description: If Kerinza isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, her Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to slowed targets.

Serpent Venom.name: Serpent Venom
Serpent Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)

equipment-Weeping Jack.name: equipment-Weeping Jack
equipment-Weeping Jack.hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, negative healing

Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.sPClc6y3dT3XZupv]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.Oilfs8Atv2LjAsUS]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
• Bat Jack changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.C9s5tBxVValC2HTE]{Giant Bat}. He gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike ([[/r 1d20+25]]{+25}, [[/r 1d20+20]]{+20}, [[/r 1d20+15]]{+15}) @Damage[(2d8+13)[piercing]]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Create Spawn.name: Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|dc:resolve(10+@actor.system.saves.will.value)|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.
Dominate.name: Dominate

Dread Striker.name: Dread Striker
Dread Striker.description: Any creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Weeping Jack's attacks.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains [[/r 16[healing]]]{16 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Weeping Jack deals 3d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Turn to Mist.name: Turn to Mist
Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

Final Rest.name: Final Rest
Final Rest.description: A shabti slayer's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune and deal @Damage[2d10[vitality]] damage to undead creatures.

Immortal.name: Immortal
Immortal.description: Shabtis don't age naturally and can't die of old age. Spells and effects that cause aging still affect a shabti as normal. They also can't be turned into undead.

Prayer-Blessed Blade.name: Prayer-Blessed Blade
Prayer-Blessed Blade.description:
Requirements The shabti slayer has successfully identified an undead with Recall Knowledge

Effect The shabti slayer prays to Pharasma to bless their weapon, enabling them to exploit the weaknesses of an undead they've identified with Recall Knowledge. If the identified undead has a resistance that can be bypassed by a special material or a weakness to a special material (such as cold iron, darkwood, or silver), weapons wielded by the shabti slayer count as that special material for 1 minute. If the creature has multiple materials that qualify, the shabti slayer chooses which material their weapon counts as for the duration.

Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description: The shabti slayer draws a weapon using the Interact action, then Strikes with that weapon.

Two-Weapon Flurry.name: Two-Weapon Flurry
Two-Weapon Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements A shabti slayer is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand

Effect A slayer lashes out with both weapons. They Strike twice, once with each weapon.

equipment-Shabti Slayer.name: equipment-Shabti Slayer
equipment-Shabti Slayer.publicNotes:
Shabtis raised among the secret Pharasmin sect of the Carters Consortium are trained to destroy undead and the necromancers who create them.

Shabtis are facsimiles of the rich and powerful, patched together from shards of other souls and offered as a sacrifice to the Boneyard to suffer for the sins of their creator. Shabtis are unaware they aren't the person they emulate, and most spend an eternity enduring the punishments owed to another while the soul they emulate escapes judgement. Some shabtis discover their nature and often become adrift, drowning in the feelings and memories of their foul creator, with no true purpose and identities of their own.

Shield Warden.name: Shield Warden
Shield Warden.description: When a Firebrand bastion has a shield raised, they can use their Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an adjacent ally. If they do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing the bastion from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield block.

Shoving Block.name: Shoving Block
Shoving Block.description:
Trigger The Firebrand bastion uses the Shield Block reaction, and the opponent that triggered Shield Block is adjacent to the bastion and is the bastion's size or smaller

Effect The Firebrand bastion automatically Shoves the target of the Shield Block 10 feet. If this would cause the creature to hit an object, the creature takes @Damage[6[bludgeoning]] damage from the impact.

Battering Blow.name: Battering Blow
Battering Blow.description: The Firebrand bastion Strikes an adjacent creature, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoves} the same creature.

Quick Shield Block.name: Quick Shield Block
Quick Shield Block.description: At the start of each of a Firebrand bastion's turns, the bastion gains an additional reaction they can use only to Shield Block.

Blessed Armaments.name: Blessed Armaments
Blessed Armaments.description: Weapons and shields wielded by the Firebrand bastion affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional 3d6 positive damage.

Keen Eyes.name: Keen Eyes
Keen Eyes.description: Ruby gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to find @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creatures within 30 feet. When she targets an opponent that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or hidden, she reduces the DC of the flat check to @Check[flat|dc:3] for a concealed target or @Check[flat|dc:9] for a hidden one.

Daring Gambit.name: Daring Gambit
Daring Gambit.description: Ruby attempts to distract an enemy with a death-defying maneuver. She attempts an @Check[acrobatics|defense:reflex] check against the Reflex DC of one target within her melee reach. On a success, Ruby Strides up to 15 feet (or 30 feet on a critical success) without triggering reactions from her target due to her movement, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against Ruby's next melee Strike before the end of her turn. Regardless of the result of her Acrobatics check, Ruby attempts a melee Strike against the target.

Light Step.name: Light Step
Light Step.description: Ruby ignores difficult terrain when she Strides or Steps.

Mobile Combatant.name: Mobile Combatant
Mobile Combatant.description: Ruby's Strikes deal an additional 4d6 damage if she has moved at least 10 feet during her turn.

Timely Boast.name: Timely Boast
Timely Boast.description:
Trigger A creature is critically hit by Ruby, or a creature critically misses Ruby

Effect Ruby taunts the triggering creature and boasts about her prowess. Ruby attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.

equipment-Decrosia.name: equipment-Decrosia
equipment-Decrosia.publicNotes:
Rust hags have a knack for technology. They make their homes in hollowed-out factories, abandoned tenements, and other sites of urban decay.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
equipment-Decrosia.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: A rust hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse Of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0fYE64odlKqISzft]{Rusting Grasp}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct} to her coven's spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The rust hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Hagshot.name: Hagshot
Hagshot.description: Any firearm wielded by a rust hag gains the benefits of +1 striking and ghost touch runes, and it functions properly no matter how rusty it gets. In addition, when a rust hag critically hits a target with a firearm, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Rusting Touch.name: Rusting Touch
Rusting Touch.description: A rust hag's touch causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If the hag succeeds at a Strike with her claw, she deals [[/r 2d6 #Rusting Touch Damage]] damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the hag hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against the hag's claw attack, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item is rusted on that attack. Objects made of skymetal, such as adamantine and orichalcum, are immune to rusting touch.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 6d6[healing]]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Drain Wand.name: Drain Wand
Drain Wand.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Yulthruk hasn't acted yet on his turn

Effect On his turn Yulthruk can Cast a Spell he's prepared and already cast this day without spending a spell slot. Yulthruk must still meet the spell's other requirements.

Ghast Fever.name: Ghast Fever
Ghast Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: Yulthruk jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Consume Arcana.name: Consume Arcana
Consume Arcana.description:
Trigger Yulthruk succeeds at a saving throw against an arcane spell cast by another creature

Effect Yulthruk inhales some of the averted energy and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the start of his next turn. He can use this extra action to Cast a Spell or Sustain a Spell

Caustic Shower.name: Caustic Shower
Caustic Shower.hazarddescription: Contact with the doors, pillars, or statue causes a shower of acid.

Acid Shower.name: Acid Shower
Acid Shower.description:
触发 A creature touches the doors, pillars, or statue directly or with a tool

效果 A shower of acid rains down from the ceiling, dealing @Damage[(8d10+48)[acid]] damage to all creatures in the chamber (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic]). On a critical failure, a creature additionally takes @Damage[1d10[persistent,acid]] damage.

Caustic Shower.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:48] (master) to ground the charged features or @Check[thievery|dc:50] (legendary) to disable the contact sensors

Shadow Worm.name: Shadow Worm

Inexorable.name: Inexorable
Inexorable.description: The shadow worm recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

Shadow Healing.name: Shadow Healing
Shadow Healing.description: As long as a shadow worm is in an area of dim light or darkness, it gains fast healing 20. When affected by a magical shadow effect from anything other than itself, a shadow worm becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened} 1 for 1 round.

Shrink from the Light.name: Shrink from the Light
Shrink from the Light.description: A shadow worm takes an additional 20 damage from any spell or ability with the light trait and uses the outcome one degree worse for saving throws made against a spell or ability with the light trait.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: The shadow worm exhales a blast of clinging shadow, dealing @Damage[11d6[cold],10d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect]). If the cone passes through an area of magical light or targets a creature affected by magical light, Breath Weapon attempts to counteract the light ([[/br 1d20+34 #Counteract]]{+34} counteract modifier). The shadow worm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
Fast Swallow.description:
触发 The shadow worm Grabs a creature

效果 The worm uses Swallow Whole.

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: A shadow worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

Thrash.name: Thrash
Thrash.description: The worm makes a Strike once against each creature in its reach. It can Strike up to once with its jaws and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.

Shadow Worm.publicNotes: Shadow worms are monstrous cave worms that dwell on the Shadow Plane. Larger and more cunning than most cave worms, shadow worms are fearsome predators that leave swaths of devastation in their wake. Most have glossy, black-armored hide, but those that burrow near velstrac lands are streaked with dark red, for the blood the velstracs spill has soaked into the very stones these shadow worms consume.

equipment-Tenebric Giant.name: equipment-Tenebric Giant

Cloying Shadows.name: Cloying Shadows
Cloying Shadows.description:
The tenebric giant's attacks leave behind a residue of energy from the Shadow Plane. A creature hit by the tenebric giant's melee Strike takes an additional 1d8 persistent negative damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:36] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until its next turn begins.

Failure The creature is blinded for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is permanently blinded.

Tenebric Stride.name: Tenebric Stride
Tenebric Stride.description: The tenebric giant can move quickly in shadowy conditions. The tenebric giant Strides twice and makes a scythe Strike at any point during this movement against a target that is in darkness or dim light. This movement doesn't provoke reactions.

equipment-Tenebric Giant.publicNotes: Necromancers reaching for the greatest heights of experimentation know that creating a new terror requires exacting, careful work at every stage of the process. In the case of the tenebric giant, this process begins with a tomb giant who dies after consuming a dose of several poisons combined with the shadow ash reagent. This creates the right circumstances for a necromancer to raise them as a tenebric giant. They're particularly obedient to the will of the necromancer who created them and are charged full of energy from the Shadow Plane, which grants them new powers and abilities.

equipment-Prince Doriel.name: equipment-Prince Doriel

Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories. The Doriel doll is animated by Kerinza's idealized version of her childhood friend. He can telepathically communicate with the Kerinza doll as long as they're within 60 feet of each other.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Prince Doriel deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Prince Doriel.

equipment-Prince Doriel.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

Keystone Repulsion.name: Keystone Repulsion
Keystone Repulsion.hazarddescription: Four magic keystones repel creatures when one is damaged or tampered with.

Repel.name: Repel
Repel.description:
触发 A creature damages or tampers with a keystone

效果 The triggering creature is moved back 10 feet by a wave of force. A successful @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save reduces the distance moved to 5 feet. The trap then rolls initiative.

Keystone Repulsion.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to remove each keystone or @Check[occultism|dc:48] (legendary) to manipulate the magic to isolate each keystone
Keystone Repulsion.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each removed or isolated keystone. Each keystone spends 1 action to release a wave of force, dealing @Damage[(4d10+22)[force]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic]) and pushing each creature back 5 feet. On a failed save, the distance a creature is pushed increases to 10 feet.

equipment-Terra-cotta Soldier.name: equipment-Terra-cotta Soldier
equipment-Terra-cotta Soldier.publicNotes:
Terra-cotta warriors guard the tombs of ancient rulers, where they stand vigil, animating only when intruders break in to pilfer riches or defile the tomb itself. Each warrior is meticulously crafted from clay and given unique features.

A single terra-cotta warrior stands 6 feet tall and weighs 600 pounds.

Shadow Lash.name: Shadow Lash
Shadow Lash.hazarddescription: Four pillars manifest shadow lashes that attack intruders.

Manifest.name: Manifest
Manifest.description:
触发 A creature other than Kemnebi enters the chamber

效果 Four pillars manifest a writhing whip composed of solidified shadows. The trap then rolls initiative.

Long-Rage Lash.name: Long-Rage Lash
Long-Rage Lash.description: The lash lengthens, increasing its reach to 60 feet, and makes a lash Strike. The lash's length then reverts to normal.

Shadow Lash.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:46] (legendary) to drain the magic from each shadow lash or @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to disable each shadow lash
Shadow Lash.routine: (8 actions) This trap loses 2 actions each turn for each disabled shadow lash. Each shadow lash has 2 actions it can use to perform the following actions.

Sacrifice Minion.name: Sacrifice Minion
Sacrifice Minion.description:
Trigger The teaching assistant is adjacent to a minion ally when they're targeted by an attack or an effect that requires a Reflex saving throw

Effect The triggering effect is redirected to target the minion ally.

Necromantic Revitalization.name: Necromantic Revitalization
Necromantic Revitalization.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The teaching assistant disperses negative energy in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Living creatures in the area take @Damage[3d8[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic]); willing undead creatures in the area regain an equal amount of Hit Points.

Urgathoa's Ire.name: Urgathoa's Ire
Urgathoa's Ire.hazarddescription: A statue of Urgathoa fires eye beams at intruders.

Glare.name: Glare
Glare.description:
触发 A creature other than Kemnebi enters the chamber

效果 The trap shoots a concentrated beam of fire at the triggering creature. The trap makes an eye beam Strike. If one of Urgathoa's eyes has been disabled, this Strike deals half damage. The trap then rolls initiative.

Urgathoa's Ire.disable: @Check[religion|dc:48] (legendary) to disenchant each eye through prayer or @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to disable each eye
Urgathoa's Ire.routine: (1 动作) The trap shoots a concentrated beam of fire at a random intruder. The trap makes an eye beam Strike. If one of Urgathoa's eyes has been disabled, this Strike deals half damage.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Bolster Dead.name: Bolster Dead
Bolster Dead.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Effect You harness the residual energy from the spell you last cast into the body of an undead creature within 30 feet. That creature's resistances increase by an amount equal to the level of the spell cast until the beginning of the next turn.

Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The necromancer expends the power stored in their dagger. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

equipment-Ghiasi.name: equipment-Ghiasi
equipment-Ghiasi.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. divination

Shadow Shift.name: Shadow Shift
Shadow Shift.description: Being made partially of shadow, shae are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} in dim light or darkness even to creatures that can see clearly in those light levels.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Counterattack.name: Counterattack
Counterattack.description:
Trigger Ghiasi is targeted by an attack from an adjacent creature that misses due to her being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}

Requirements Ghiasi is aware of the attack

Effect Ghiasi makes a Strike against the attacker.

Multiple Reactions.name: Multiple Reactions
Multiple Reactions.description: Ghiasi gains an additional reaction each turn that she can only use to Slip.

Slip.name: Slip
Slip.description:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to Ghiasi

Effect Ghiasi teleports to a clear space adjacent to another creature she can see within 30 feet.

Shadow Gate.name: Shadow Gate
Shadow Gate.description: Ghiasi opens or closes a gate between Twined Stories and the House of Inspiring Shadows, although the gate must be opened in the same place each time. It remains open until she uses this ability again, but she can't close the gate until at least 10 minutes after she opens it.

Tenebral Form.name: Tenebral Form
Tenebral Form.description: Ghiasi can Fly at full Speed in gaseous form.

equipment-Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: Sahni adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk} to her coven's spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Bride's Bargain.name: Bride's Bargain
Bride's Bargain.description: Sahni can make a bargain with a willing creature of sound mind. The creature gives away a special quality-such as its courage, beauty, or voice-or sacrifices a loved one in exchange for a boon or a promise from Sahni. As long as Sahni keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore a lost quality is to defeat Sahni or make another bargain for its return. Loved ones sacrificed for Sahni's bargain can't be restored except with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle}, or similarly powerful magic.

Curse of Futility.name: Curse of Futility
Curse of Futility.description:
Sahni gazes upon a creature, affecting it with an overwhelming sense that every action it takes is futile; that humiliating failure is their only possible future. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:25] save; the target doesn't need to be able to see Sahni.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to Sahni's Curse of Futility for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is stupefied 2 for 1 hour and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} as long as it is stupefied.

Scattered Coven.name: Scattered Coven
Scattered Coven.description: As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Sahni the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-level occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse Of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}. If Sahni is the third hag they confront, the coven is broken and she lacks these coven spells.

equipment-Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea.name: equipment-Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea

Spiraling Comets.name: Spiraling Comets
Spiraling Comets.disable: @Check[religion|dc:42] (master) to command each comet to disperse with Pharasmin prayers, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 42) to counteract each comet
Spiraling Comets.hazarddescription: Three blue comets orbiting the room turn red and attack when intruders enter.
Spiraling Comets.routine: (3 action) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each comet disabled, counteracted, or destroyed. Each comet uses 1 action to attack the nearest intruder with a comet Strike.

Intruder Alert.name: Intruder Alert
Intruder Alert.description:
触发 An intruder enters the room

效果 The comets change from blue to red in color. The trap then rolls initiative.

Time Rift.name: Time Rift
Time Rift.disable: Three @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) or @Check[occultism|dc:48] (master) checks to mend the time rift.
Time Rift.hazarddescription: A time rift focused on the sundial causes time to pass erratically for all creatures in the area.
Time Rift.routine:
(1 动作) On its initiative, the time rift alters each creature's timeline. Each creature in the area rolls a [[/gmr 1d4 #Time Rift Effect]]{1d4} to randomly determine the effect on them.

1 The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for 1 round.

2 The creature is unaffected.

3 The creature is affected erratically by time; they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} for 1 round.

4 The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened} 1 for 1 round.

Pause.name: Pause
Pause.description:
触发 A creature enters the area

效果 The triggering creature becomes temporarily unmoored from time, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}. If the creature succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:47] save, they reduce this to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}. The trap then rolls initiative.

Phantom Soldiers.name: Phantom Soldiers
Phantom Soldiers.disable: @Check[intimidation|dc:45] (legendary) to scare off the soldiers or @Check[deception|dc:46] (legendary) to order the soldiers to stand down
Phantom Soldiers.hazarddescription: Spirits of long-dead soldiers appear in the mist and attack intruders.

Battle.name: Battle
Battle.description:
触发 A creature enters the area

效果 Spirit soldiers lunge out of the mist and attack intruders. The spirit soldiers attempt a spear Strike against each creature within 30 feet.

Construct Armor (Hardness 8).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 8)
Construct Armor (Hardness 8).description: Like normal objects, an animated tea cart has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the tea cart takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated tea cart is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 24.

Scald.name: Scald
Scald.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The tea cart ejects piping-hot tea in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]).

equipment-Bloodshroud.name: equipment-Bloodshroud
equipment-Bloodshroud.publicNotes: During the war between Geb and Nex, necromancers conducted dangerous magical experiments to gain every possible advantage over their enemies. One such endeavor attempted to distill the essence of vampiric mists to create a protective shroud for an army of undead maguses.

Bloodshift.name: Bloodshift
Bloodshift.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the bloodshroud takes damage

Effect The bloodshroud transports itself and any items it's carrying to any unoccupied space adjacent to the triggering creature.

Sanguine Shroud.name: Sanguine Shroud
Sanguine Shroud.description:
The bloodshroud is enveloped by a shroud of flowing blood. If a creature deals damage to a bloodshroud with a melee Strike or touches the bloodshroud, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save. Any temporary Hit Points the bloodshroud gains from Sanguine Shroud fade after 1 hour.

Critical Success As success, but the creature becomes temporarily immune to Sanguine Shroud for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and takes @Damage[2d6[bleed]] damage. The bloodshroud gains 15 temporary Hit Points.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, and the bloodshroud gains 25 temporary Hit Points.

Spellstrike.name: Spellstrike
Spellstrike.description:
Frequency until recharged

Effect The bloodshroud channels a spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll into a claw or greatsword Strike. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into the bloodshroud's attack instead. The bloodshroud makes a melee Strike with a weapon or claw. The spell is coupled with the bloodshroud's attack, using the attack roll result to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of determining the bloodshroud's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty is not applied until after the Spellstrike. Using Bloodshift automatically recharges the bloodshroud's Spellstrike.

Swift Sneak.name: Swift Sneak
Swift Sneak.description: The archer can move their full Speed while Sneaking.

Spry Dodge.name: Spry Dodge
Spry Dodge.description:
Trigger The archer is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The archer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the archer can Step.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The archer's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the archer.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When Vikroti is destroyed, her soul immediately transfers to her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. She can be permanently destroyed only if her soul cage is found and destroyed.

Cold Beyond Cold.name: Cold Beyond Cold
Cold Beyond Cold.description: Vikroti's hand Strike deals cold damage, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}. A successful @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save reduces this to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or negates on a critical success).

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell Vikroti has prepared

Effect Vikroti expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. She loses her spell slot as if she'd cast the triggering spell. Vikroti then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

Death's Chill.name: Death's Chill
Death's Chill.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:15] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Vikroti is surrounded by an unnatural chill. Creatures that enter or begin their turn within the aura take @Damage[5d10[cold]] damage and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic]).

Drain Soul Cage.name: Drain Soul Cage
Drain Soul Cage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Vikroti taps into her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level she can cast, even if the spell being cast isn't one of her prepared spells. Her soul cage doesn't need to be present for her to use this ability.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Vikroti's spellcasting action, Vikroti attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Lancer.name: Lancer
Lancer.description: The skeletal knight uses a lance in one hand, even when it isn't mounted. If the skeletal knight critically hits a creature with its lance Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

Soul Stasis.hazarddescription: Four steel pillars emit pulsing energy to slow souls' processes.
Soul Stasis.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any souls in the area.

Pulse.name: Pulse
Pulse.description:
触发 A soul or creature with a soul enters the area

效果 The steel pillars activate with an audible hum that resonates with spirits. Each non-psychopomp creature with a soul is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:43] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Soul Stasis.name: Soul Stasis
Soul Stasis.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:43] or Religion (master) to reweave the magic within each pillar, @Check[thievery|dc:46] (master) to disable each pillar, or dispel magic (8th level; counteract DC 43) to counteract each pillar
Soul Stasis.routine: (4 actions) This trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. Each pillar uses 1 action to emit a @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30-foot-radius burst} of inhibiting energy that slows souls. Each non-psychopomp creature with a soul in the area is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:43] save.

Psychic Wave.name: Psychic Wave
Psychic Wave.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:50] (legendary) to stymie the psychic energy before it manifests

Psychic Assault.name: Psychic Assault
Psychic Assault.description:
触发 A creature has been in the room for more than 1 round

效果 A wave of psychic energy slams into the minds of creatures in the chamber, dealing @Damage[(8d10+48)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:44|basic]). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}.

Psychic Wave.hazarddescription: A wave of psychic energy ripples through the room, violently prying into the minds of creatures in the area and alerting Kemnebi to the presence of intruders.

Unstable Fiendflame Cage.name: Unstable Fiendflame Cage
Unstable Fiendflame Cage.hazarddescription: The Fiendflame Cage is uncontrolled, releasing holy light and hellfire in the area.
Unstable Fiendflame Cage.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:48], @Check[nature|dc:48], @Check[occultism|dc:48], or @Check[religion|dc:48] (master) four times on the Fiendflame Cage to calm it through ritual incantations
Unstable Fiendflame Cage.routine: (2 actions) On its initiative, the Fiendflame Cage uses 1 action to release a wave of hellfire, dealing @Damage[(2d10+12)[spirit],(2d10+12)[fire]|traits:unholy]{2d10+12 spirit damage and 2d10+12 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:15]{15-foot-radius burst} (@Check[reflex|dc:47|basic]). The Fiendflame Cage uses its second action to release a wave of holy light, dealing @Damage[(2d10+12)[spirit],(2d10+12)[fire]|traits:holy]{2d10+12 spirit damage and 2d10+12 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:15]{15-foot-radius burst} (@Check[reflex|dc:47|basic]).

Smite.name: Smite
Smite.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area

Effect The triggering creature is exposed to the Fiendflame Cage's clashing energies. The triggering creature takes @Damage[8d6[spirit],4d6[spirit],4d6[spirit]]{8d6 spirit damage, 4d6 spirit damage, and 4d6 spirit damage} (@Check[fortitude|dc:47|basic]). The trap then rolls initiative.

equipment-Restored Doll.name: equipment-Restored Doll

Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories.

For You, Mistress.name: For You, Mistress
For You, Mistress.description:
Trigger An attack would reduce Kerinza to 0 HP

Requirements The soulbound doll is within 60 feet of Kerinza

Effect The attack is redirected to the soulbound doll, and the doll is destroyed, regardless of the damage dealt to it.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The restored doll deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the restored doll.

equipment-Restored Doll.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

Give Them the Slip.name: Give Them the Slip
Give Them the Slip.description:
Trigger Dead Faine gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} condition

Effect Dead Faine slips out of his disguise to escape; he removes the grabbed, immobilized, and restrained conditions imposed by the triggering event, then he Steps. If Dead Faine is currently Impersonating, his disguise is ruined, and he's exposed as himself.

Adopt Persona.name: Adopt Persona
Adopt Persona.description: Dead Faine attempts a Deception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate}. He doesn't take a penalty to this check due to lacking a disguise kit, to appear as an undead, or to appear as a specific individual.

Feinting Strike.name: Feinting Strike
Feinting Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Dead Faine is within melee reach of an enemy

Effect Dead Faine Feints, then Strikes the target of his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Dead Faine deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures. This increases to 6d6 against creatures off-guard due to Dead Faine's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or Traitorous Betrayal.

Traitorous Betrayal.name: Traitorous Betrayal
Traitorous Betrayal.description: Dead Faine Interacts to draw his dagger and Strikes with it. If the target believes Dead Faine was anyone other than himself, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against Dead Faine's attack.

equipment-Rust Hag.name: equipment-Rust Hag
equipment-Rust Hag.publicNotes:
Rust hags have a knack for technology. They make their homes in hollowed-out factories, abandoned tenements, and other sites of urban decay.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
equipment-Rust Hag.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: A rust hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse Of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0fYE64odlKqISzft]{Rusting Grasp}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct} to her coven's spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The rust hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Hagshot.name: Hagshot
Hagshot.description: Any firearm wielded by a rust hag gains the benefits of +1 striking and ghost touch runes, and it functions properly no matter how rusty it gets. In addition, when a rust hag critically hits a target with a firearm, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Rusting Touch.name: Rusting Touch
Rusting Touch.description: A rust hag's touch causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If the hag succeeds at a Strike with her claw, she deals [[/r 2d6 #Rusting Touch Damage]] damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the hag hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against the hag's claw attack, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item is rusted on that attack. Objects made of skymetal, such as adamantine and orichalcum, are immune to rusting touch.

Puncture.name: Puncture
Puncture.description:
Requirements The tough has two bone shards in hand

Effect The tough attempts to use one shard of bone to hammer another into a creature, creating a gaping wound. The tough attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:reflex] check against the target's Reflex DC. On a hit, the target takes the listed bone shard damage and @Damage[1d4[bleed]].

Teach You a Lesson.name: Teach You a Lesson
Teach You a Lesson.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The members of the mob wildly swing their textbooks and supplies—primarily spellbooks and staves—in a chaotic attack at each enemy adjacent to the troop (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic]). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(2d12+14)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(3d12+14)[bludgeoning]] damage

3 @Damage[(4d12+14)[bludgeoning]] damage

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: Whenever the troop Strides, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

Troop Spellcasting.name: Troop Spellcasting
Troop Spellcasting.description: When the necromancer troop Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius isn't affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that's normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Controlled.name: Controlled
Controlled.description: Kemnebi can manipulate one of his comatose victims as if they were a puppet, maintaining complete control over each. Kemnebi's puppets are immune to all mental effects. Kemnebi can stop controlling one of his puppets as a free action. If he does, the puppet returns to its comatose state, becoming permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}. Kemnebi can reassert control as a free action, causing the puppet to temporarily lose the unconscious condition.

Gang Up.name: Gang Up
Gang Up.description: Kemnebi's puppets work together to take down more powerful foes. A puppet's Strikes deal an additional 4d6 damage against a creature that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed} by at least one of the puppet's allies.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Trundling Gore.name: Trundling Gore
Trundling Gore.description: Mosghuta surges forward at her foe, horn lowered. She Strides once. If she ends her movement within melee range of an enemy, she makes a horn Strike against that enemy. If that Strike succeeds, Mosghuta uses Knockdown as a free action.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 7d6[healing]]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

She also absorbs a portion of the memories once possessed by the creature she fed upon, potentially revealing secrets held by the flesh at the GM's discretion, and also gains a +1 status bonus to all skill checks for 1 minute.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Recall Memory.name: Recall Memory
Recall Memory.description:
