Frequency once per day

Effect Yurgak focuses her thoughts and recalls a memory from a previously fed-upon corpse. She can attempt to Recall Knowledge using any Lore as if she has legendary proficiency with it ([[/r 1d20+26 #Recall Knowledge]]{+26} on the check).

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Soul Slime.name: Soul Slime

Disgorge Soul.name: Disgorge Soul
Disgorge Soul.description:
触发 The soul slime takes physical damage

效果 The impact causes the soul slime to release a burst of semi-digested soul fragments. The soul slime becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until the beginning of its next turn. The soul slime can't use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.

Disturbing Wail.name: Disturbing Wail
Disturbing Wail.description:
需求 The soul slime is using Soul Facsimile to adopt a creature's form

效果 The soul slime releases an incoherent wail composed of countless overlapping noises made by the creatures whose souls it has siphoned. This disturbing cacophony deals @Damage[6d10[mental],6d10[sonic]]{6d10 mental damage and 6d10 sonic damage} to each creature in a @Template[burst|distance:30]{30-foot-radius burst} centered on the soul slime (@Check[will|dc:37|basic]). On a failed save, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}. The soul slime can't use Disturbing Wail again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Disturbing Wail]]{1d4轮}.

Soul Facsimile.name: Soul Facsimile
Soul Facsimile.description: The soul slime assumes the shape and features of any Large, Medium, or Small creature whose soul the soul slime has siphoned for up to 1 minute. This doesn't change the soul slime's statistics, only its outward appearance. While transformed in this way, the soul slime can revert to its natural shape as a single action, and the soul slime automatically reverts to its natural shape when it takes physical damage.

Siphon Soul.name: Siphon Soul
Siphon Soul.description: A soul slime's touch siphons away portions of a creature's soul. Its Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[3d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[3d6[vitality]] damage to undead and other creatures with void healing.

Soul Slime.publicNotes: Soul slimes are swirling, blue-gray masses of protoplasm that feed on the quintessence contained within souls. Typically, soul slimes acquire this quintessence by consuming the living, the undead, or souls imprisoned in other objects, although soul slimes can also feed on the quintessence of the Outer Planes and their occupants. Soul slimes digest these siphoned souls over decades. As long as a portion of a soul remains undigested, a soul slime can adopt the shape and use the vocalizations of that soul—a tactic soul slimes routinely adopt to get close to their prey while hunting. As soul slimes lack the intelligence to truly impersonate or mimic the souls they digest, they are obvious facsimiles and are entirely incapable of speech.

Coordinated Assault.name: Coordinated Assault
Coordinated Assault.description: The Bellator Mortus acts as part of a well-trained unit. Their Strikes deal an additional 4d6 damage to creatures within reach of at least one of the Bellator Mortus's allies.

Battering Defense.name: Battering Defense
Battering Defense.description: The Bellator Mortus uses their shield as both a weapon and a defensive measure. Attempt a shield Strike. If the Strike hits, Raise a Shield.

Cleansing Hall.name: Cleansing Hall
Cleansing Hall.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.

Force Barrier.name: Force Barrier
Force Barrier.description:
触发 A creature reaches the hall's midpoint

效果 Force barriers seal the hall's entrance and exit for 1 minute. The trap then rolls initiative.

Cleansing Hall.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:48] (master) to deface the script without triggering, @Check[arcana|dc:47] (master) to redirect the magical energy, or @Check[religion|dc:46] (master) to quote Pharasmin prayers
Cleansing Hall.hazarddescription: The hall's entry and exit seal with a force barrier, then waves of force surge through the hall.
Cleansing Hall.routine: (1 动作) A wave of force flows down the hall from north to south, dealing @Damage[(3d10+20)[force]] damage to each creature in the corridor. Each creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]. On a failure, a creature is pushed back 5 feet (10 feet on a critical failure). If this movement would cause a creature to hit another creature, both creatures take @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage. If this movement would cause a creature to hit a force barrier, the creature takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage. Animals, plants, and worshippers of Pharasma are immune to this force damage.

equipment-Vanth Warrior.name: equipment-Vanth Warrior
equipment-Vanth Warrior.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Infuse Weapon.name: Infuse Weapon
Infuse Weapon.description: A vanth's scythe is their symbol of office and gains a measure of their personal power. This scythe becomes a +2 striking scythe and is treated as if it were adamantine while the vanth wields it. A vanth whose scythe is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

Reaping Scythe.name: Reaping Scythe
Reaping Scythe.description: The vanth throws their scythe, which flies in a @Template[line|distance:60], dealing @Damage[6d8[slashing]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic]) and returns to the vanth's hand.

Spirit Touch.name: Spirit Touch
Spirit Touch.description: A vanth's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune and deal @Damage[3d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[3d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Vanth's Curse.name: Vanth's Curse
Vanth's Curse.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The vanth bestows a curse on a creature by touching it with their scythe. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Vanth's Curse for 24 hours.

Success The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.

Failure The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}. Each time the target gains the dying condition, the stupefied value increases by 1, to a maximum value of stupefied 6.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is permanent.

equipment-Vanth Warrior.publicNotes: Protecting the Boneyard are the stern and resolute guardians of the dead known as vanths, psychopomps who resemble skeletons with raven-like wings and a mask resembling a vulture's skull. Vanths carry black scythes to fight against those who would disturb the natural progression of souls, and they consider any visitor to the Boneyard a potential troublemaker. When the psychopomp armies go to war, vanths serve as front-line soldiers. They rarely speak and even more rarely show any emotion other than a grim adherence to duty.

equipment-Kelganth.name: equipment-Kelganth
equipment-Kelganth.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. positive

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell Kelganth has prepared

Effect Kelganth expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. Kelganth loses his spell slot as if he had cast the triggering spell.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

Drain Soul Cage.name: Drain Soul Cage
Drain Soul Cage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Kelganth taps into his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to 9th level, even if the spell being cast is not one of his prepared spells. Kelganth's soul cage doesn't need to be present for him to use this ability.

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of negative energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with negative energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this negative energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[11d12[void]] damage in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic]); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Paralyzing Doom.name: Paralyzing Doom
Paralyzing Doom.description: A creature damaged by Kelganth's hand Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[medicine|dc:25] check reveals that the victim is alive.

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Kelganth's next action is to cast an cantrip or spell that is 8th level or less, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Kelganth's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

equipment-Kelganth.publicNotes:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 6d6[healing]]] Hit Points

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Ghast Fever.name: Ghast Fever
Ghast Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The ghast jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The ghast's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
24 hours, @Check[thievery|traits:action:disable-a-device|dc:22], standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Device} to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.

Bayonet Charge.name: Bayonet Charge
Bayonet Charge.description: The clockwork rifler Strides twice and Strikes with its bayonet.

equipment-Clockwork Rifler.name: equipment-Clockwork Rifler
equipment-Clockwork Rifler.publicNotes:
These diligent machines guard their assigned posts tirelessly. A typical clockwork soldier stands 6 feet tall and consists of 500 pounds of metal and magic.

Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner.

Devastator.name: Devastator
Devastator.description: Grace's Strikes ignore 10 points of a creature's resistance to physical damage.

Celestial Rage.name: Celestial Rage
Celestial Rage.description:
Requirements Grace isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect Grace unleashes her inner fury. She gains 20 temporary Hit Points that last until her Celestial Rage ends and she casts one divine innate spell or focus spell she knows. While raging, she gains weakness to evil 10, gains a +10-foot status bonus to her Speed, and takes a -1 penalty to AC. She can't use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. This Celestial Rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies Grace can perceive, or until she falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first. When the Celestial Rage ends, Grace can't use Celestial Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Celestial Rage}

Rhino Charge.name: Rhino Charge
Rhino Charge.description: Grace Strides twice; if she ends her movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, she can make a melee Strike against that enemy. Grace can Fly instead of Stride if she has a fly speed (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kRsmUlSWhi6PJvZ7]{Angelic Wings}).

Great Cleave.name: Great Cleave
Great Cleave.description: When Grace's melee Strike reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, she can make a melee Strike against another foe adjacent to that creature. If that Strike also reduces the creature to 0 Hit Points, she can continue making melee Strikes until she makes a Strike that doesn't reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points, or until there are no creatures adjacent to the most recent creature she attacked while cleaving, whichever comes first.

Hatred of Red.name: Hatred of Red
Hatred of Red.description: Pairakas hate the color red. They won't wear the color or willingly enter any place painted red. Given a choice, they'll attack a creature wearing red first. If barred from expressing their displeasure toward the color by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn.

Bubonic Plague.name: Bubonic Plague
Bubonic Plague.description:
A creature can't remove the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} condition while infected

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 fatigued (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, fatigued, and take @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage every [[/gmr 1d20 #Minutes]] minutes (1 day)

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Yshula can take the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid or animal. This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage modifiers with the Strikes, but it might change the damage type his strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Cottage-Drained.name: Cottage-Drained
Cottage-Drained.description: Yshula is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and can't recover from his drained condition while he's in the cottage. These reductions are included in his statistics.

Tormenting Dreams.name: Tormenting Dreams
Tormenting Dreams.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Yshula torments a sleeping creature within 100 feet with visions of betrayals by loved ones and friends. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save, with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell.

Mithral Golem.name: Mithral Golem

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by cold and water (@Damage[8d10[untyped]], @Damage[2d10[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by transmutation (area @Damage[2d10[healing]] HP); slowed by electricity

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Swift Steps.name: Swift Steps
Swift Steps.description: A mithral golem is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened}, and it can use the extra action only to Step or Stride.

Vulnerable to Slow.name: Vulnerable to Slow
Vulnerable to Slow.description: A mithral golem is not healed by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow} spell, and such spells affect them normally. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste} spell reverses the effects of a slow spell immediately.

Liquefy.name: Liquefy
Liquefy.description: The mithral golem becomes fully liquid and amorphous. It gains immunity to precision damage, but it takes double damage from cold and water magic (see golem antimagic). The only actions it can use while Liquefied are move actions, Spike Storm, and spike Strikes. It can resume its normal form by taking this action again.

Spike Storm.name: Spike Storm
Spike Storm.description: The mithral golem makes a spike Strike against each target within its reach. These attacks count toward the mithral golem's multiple attack penalty, but its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: When the mithral golem rolls a success on a Reflex save, it gets a critical success instead.

Mithral Golem.publicNotes:
Mithral golems are gorgeously crafted, silvery humanoids made from colossal amounts of the purest dawnsilver. While massive in construction, they possess amazing speed and grace through literal fluidity. Unpredictable and flexible, they can melt into liquid form and reform into a solid shape in mere seconds, allowing them to shape their limbs into sharp spikes or heavy fists as needed.

Powerful constructs that blend magic and raw material, golems make ideal guardians and bodyguards, with forms and functions as varied as the needs of those who employ them. As their crafters experiment with more exotic components and create new formulas, golems with surprising abilities emerge.

Skewering Hall.name: Skewering Hall
Skewering Hall.hazarddescription: A dozen spears hidden within sockets in the walls thrust into the hall when the pressure plate is triggered.

Skewer.name: Skewer
Skewer.description:
触发 Pressure is applied to the pressure plate

效果 A dozen spears extend into the hall, making one spear Strike against each creature in the hall, up to a total of 12 spear Strikes.

Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
Bardic Lore.description: Sphinxes are naturally curious, and their love of puzzles and mysteries leads them to gather information on a broad range of topics. Sphinxes have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.uVXEZblPRuCyPRua]{Bardic Lore} bard feat, allowing them to Recall Knowledge on any topic.

Aquatic Assault.name: Aquatic Assault
Aquatic Assault.description: Basiri Swims and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If both she and her opponent are submerged underwater, she can Strike one additional time.

Harness Wellspring.name: Harness Wellspring
Harness Wellspring.description: Basiri draws upon the necromantic wellspring to power her spellcasting. During her turn, she gains the ability to cast one of the following spells, heightened to 9th level: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ht35SDf9PDStJfoC]{Spirit Song}.

Wellspring Guardian.name: Wellspring Guardian
Wellspring Guardian.description: Once per day, Basiri can protect the necromantic wellspring by inscribing a magical sigil around the wellspring orrery. The first time a creature other than Basiri touches the orrery, that creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:41|traits:occult,spell,force,necromancy] save or be affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} (9th).

Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.name: Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors
Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.disable: @Check[religion|dc:47] (legendary) to sever the connection between Urgathoa and each spirit collector, @Check[thievery|dc:50] (legendary) to deactivate each spirit collector, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 50) to counteract each spirit collector
Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.hazarddescription: Four spirit collectors drain the souls from nearby creatures.

Repulse.name: Repulse
Repulse.description:
触发 A creature damages a spirit collector

效果 The damaged spirit collector releases a wave of force to repel the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[(4d10+20)[force]] damage to the triggering creature, who must attempt a Reflex save. The trap then rolls initiative.

大成功 The creature is unaffected.

成功 The creature takes half damage and is pushed back 5 feet.

失败 The creature takes full damage, is pushed back 10 feet, and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

大失败 The creature takes double damage, is pushed back 20 feet, and lands prone.

Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.routine: (4 actions) This trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled spirit collector. Each spirit collector uses 1 action to drain the souls of all creatures within 30 feet, dealing @Damage[(4d10+20)[force]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:46|basic]). On a failed save, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} or increases their drained and stupefied conditions by 1 (by 2 on a critical failure).

Revisit Past Pains.name: Revisit Past Pains
Revisit Past Pains.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:48] (master) to calm the spirit or @Check[occultism|dc:46] (master) to ward off the spirit
Revisit Past Pains.hazarddescription: A spirit locked in memories of its death flies down the hall, forcing intruders to experience the agony of its death.

Share Pain.name: Share Pain
Share Pain.description:
触发 A creature enters the area

效果 Creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} take @Damage[(6d12+41)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:40|basic]) as they experience the spirit's death.

Shrieking Souls.name: Shrieking Souls

Scream.name: Scream
Scream.description:
触发 A creature enters the area

效果 The spirit screams, dealing @Damage[(6d12+41)[sonic]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic]).

Shrieking Souls.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:44] (master) to comfort the spirit or @Check[occultism|dc:45] (master) to ward off the spirit
Shrieking Souls.hazarddescription: A terrified soul releases an earsplitting scream.

Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The necromancer expends the power stored in their dagger. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

Flamboyant Reposition.name: Flamboyant Reposition
Flamboyant Reposition.description: With a flourish, a celebrant shrouds themself in a puff of smoke, glitter, or colorful ribbons. If the celebrant is adjacent to an enemy, they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} that adjacent enemy. The celebrant Steps or Strides; they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} during this movement.

Bolster Dead.name: Bolster Dead
Bolster Dead.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Effect You harness the residual energy from the spell you last cast into the body of an undead creature within 30 feet. That creature's resistances increase by an amount equal to the level of the spell cast until the beginning of the next turn.

Feed.name: Feed
Feed.description:
Requirements The vampiric creature's most recent action was a successful jaws Strike that dealt damage

Effect The vampiric creature drains blood from its victim, dealing minimum jaws damage and regaining [[/r 10[healing]]]{10 Hit Points}.

Circling Assault.name: Circling Assault
Circling Assault.description: The corpsekiller circles around their target then attacks, throwing their foe off balance and puncturing its defenses. The corpsekiller Steps or Strides, then attempts a glaive Strike. On a hit or critical hit, the Strike ignores 10 of their target's resistances. Regardless of the result of the Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round.

Corpsekiller.name: Corpsekiller
Corpsekiller.description: A corpsekiller's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage to undead creatures.

Flamboyant Reposition.description: With a flourish, a celebrant shrouds themself in a puff of smoke, glitter, or colorful ribbons. If the celebrant is adjacent to an enemy, they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} that adjacent enemy. The celebrant Steps or Strides; they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} during this movement.
Flamboyant Reposition.name: Flamboyant Reposition

equipment-Sorvinaesen.name: equipment-Sorvinaesen

Impart Doom.name: Impart Doom
Impart Doom.description: A creature hit by Sorvinaesen's claw Strike, or one who critically fails a save from one of Sorvinaesen's spells, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Visions of Death.name: Visions of Death
Visions of Death.description: Sorvinaesen's Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d10[mental]] damage to doomed creatures as visions of their impending deaths fill their minds.

Small Bag of Ash Containing a Black Onyx.name: Small Bag of Ash Containing a Black Onyx Gem

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of negative energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with negative energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this negative energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d12[void]] damage energy in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

equipment-Sorvinaesen.publicNotes:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

equipment-Vampire Guardian.name: equipment-Vampire Guardian
equipment-Vampire Guardian.hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, negative healing

Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.sPClc6y3dT3XZupv]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.Oilfs8Atv2LjAsUS]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Mist Escape.name: Mist Escape
Mist Escape.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.C9s5tBxVValC2HTE]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with a +21 attack bonus. These fangs deal the same amount of damage as the vampire's claws, but deal piercing damage rather than slashing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Create Spawn.name: Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|dc:resolve(10+@actor.system.saves.will.value)|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

Dominate.name: Dominate
Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains [[/r 13[healing]]]{13 Hit Points}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A vampire guardian deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Turn to Mist.name: Turn to Mist
Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

Spear Fisher.name: Spear Fisher
Spear Fisher.description: A Sallowdrudge attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} target rolls the attack roll twice and takes the better result.

Entangling Net.name: Entangling Net
Entangling Net.description: A Sallowdrudge uses their net to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a Medium or smaller creature within 30 feet. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until it Escapes (DC 16) or until an adjacent creature Interacts to remove the net. On a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} rather than grabbed. The Sallowdrudge can't use Entangling Net again until they take 1 minute to refold their net.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description: Pesgahi carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{Antidote (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]{Smokestick (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)} (6), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nVvH1ZcM7OwIVIs8]{Frost Vial (Moderate)} (4)

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements Pesgahi is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect Pesgahi devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 2d6[healing]]] Hit Points.

He can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by Pesgahi's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Pesgahi can use Interact to draw a bomb and then Strike with it.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: Pesgahi jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Iron Command.name: Iron Command
Iron Command.description:
Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages Seldeg

Effect Seldeg puts an impertinent foe who dared harm him in their proper place. He commands the enemy to kneel in obedience. If they refuse, they must pay the price in pain and anguish. The triggering creature must choose one of the following options: the enemy kneels, dropping @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} as a free action, or the enemy refuses and takes @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage. In addition, Seldeg's Strikes against the triggering creature deal an additional 3 damage until the end of his next turn. Seldeg chooses whether the additional damage is evil or negative each time he uses this reaction.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 #Counteract]]{+27}.

Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description: Seldeg unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of fire. Creatures in the area take @Damage[9d12[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic]). Seldeg can use this ability once every [[/r 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:35] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]{Effect: Graveknight's Curse}

Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
Phantom Steed.description:
HP 130; AC 39, Fort +28, Ref +25, Will +22

Seldeg summons a supernatural mount as per @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Phantom Steed} (8th level). Unlike phantom steed, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 levels lower than Seldeg's, and the steed has one-third of Seldeg's Hit Points (rounded down). If the steed is destroyed, Seldeg must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.

Ruinous Weapons.name: Ruinous Weapons
Ruinous Weapons.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Seldeg uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and greater flaming runes.

Unyielding Block.name: Unyielding Block
Unyielding Block.description: At the start of each of Seldeg's turns, he gains two additional reactions he can use only to perform a Shield Block.

Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

Shadow Hooks.name: Shadow Hooks
Shadow Hooks.hazarddescription: Hooks of solidified shadow extend from the walls, hook into creatures, and pull, tearing them open.

Tearing Hooks.name: Tearing Hooks
Tearing Hooks.description:
触发 A creature reaches the hall's midpoint

效果 The trap attempts a shadow hook Strike against each creature in the hall. On a critical hit, a creature additionally takes @Damage[1d10[bleed]] damage.

Castigate the Faithless.name: Castigate the Faithless
Castigate the Faithless.hazarddescription: Magic forces those who pass by the statue to the ground with sudden force; pressing the bypass button deactivates the trap for 1 minute.
Castigate the Faithless.reset: The trap resets automatically if triggered, after 1 minute if the bypass button is pressed, or after 15 minutes if disabled or counteracted.

Kneel!.name: Kneel!
Kneel!.description:
触发 A creature passes by the statue

效果 The trap deals @Damage[(7d12+40)[force]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic]). On a failed save, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and on a critical failure, the creature is knocked prone and takes an additional @Damage[1d12[bludgeoning]] damage from the force of the fall.

Castigate the Faithless.disable: @Check[religion|dc:47] (legendary) to deactivate the trap through prayer, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 47) to counteract the trap, or press the bypass button
Castigate the Faithless.stealthdetails: (master) or @Check[perception|dc:50] (legendary) to notice the bypass button hidden in Urgathoa's skeletal feet

equipment-Agorron Guard.name: equipment-Agorron Guard

Dooming Touch.name: Dooming Touch
Dooming Touch.description: The Agorron guard's claws carry the accursed power of their foul gods. A creature hit by the guard's claw Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of negative energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with negative energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this negative energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d10[void]] damage energy in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Wicked Blow.name: Wicked Blow
Wicked Blow.description: The Agorron guard makes a Strike with their scythe. A creature damaged by this attack takes @Damage[3d6[bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

equipment-Agorron Guard.publicNotes:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

Bolster Dead.name: Bolster Dead
Bolster Dead.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Effect You harness the residual energy from the spell you last cast into the body of an undead creature within 30 feet. That creature's resistances increase by an amount equal to the level of the spell cast until the beginning of the next turn.

Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The necromancer expends the power stored in their dagger. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

equipment-Kemnebi.name: equipment-Kemnebi
equipment-Kemnebi.hp: fast healing 20, mental rebirth, negative healing

Thoughtsense (Precise) 100 feet.name: Thoughtsense (Precise) 100 feet
Thoughtsense (Precise) 100 feet.description: Kemnebi senses all non-mindless creatures within 100 feet as a precise sense.

Enlightened Mind.name: Enlightened Mind
Enlightened Mind.description: Whenever Kemnebi is targeted by a mental effect, that effect's source or caster must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5]. If this check fails, the mental effect doesn't affect Kemnebi.

Mental Rebirth.name: Mental Rebirth
Mental Rebirth.description:
Unlike most other undead, a vetalarana isn't destroyed when they reach 0 HP. Instead, their body is destroyed, crumbling to ash, and their mind is immediately transferred into a creature they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts. This creature must be within 1 mile; if no such creature is in range, the vetalarana is destroyed. The creature becomes controlled by the vetalarana and loses the stupefied and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions. If the creature controlled by a vetalarana in this way is killed, the vetalarana's mind transfers to another creature within 1 mile who they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts.

After [[/gmr 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days} of being controlled, the controlled creature dies, and its body transforms into that of the vetalarana who rendered it comatose.

Vetalarana Vulnerabilities.name: Vetalarana Vulnerabilities
Vetalarana Vulnerabilities.description:
All vetalaranas possess the following weaknesses.

  • Barred Senses A vetalarana can't see or sense through force effects or cold iron, and their mind can't penetrate force effects or cold iron. Such barriers can prevent the transference of a vetalarana's mind through Mental Rebirth.
  • Revulsion A vetalarana delights in consuming memories and secrets, and is disgusted by those who share such sensitive tidbits openly. A vetalarana can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of a creature loudly voicing their intimate personal secrets or most cherished memories aloud. Speaking such information aloud with conviction is a single action that has the auditory, concentrate, and linguistic traits, and protects the creature until the start of its next turn. A vetalarana that involuntarily comes within 10 feet of a creature sharing such information gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition until they're 10 feet or farther from the creature. After 1 round of being exposed to the secrets of a creature, a vetalarana can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Vulnerable to Brain Destruction A vetalarana whose brain has been destroyed, or is reduced to 0 HP while unable to take mental actions, can't use Mental Rebirth.

Center Self.name: Center Self
Center Self.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Kemnebi regains 1 Focus Point. If he's stupefied, he reduces the value of his stupefied condition by one. If Kemnebi is affected by a mental effect or spell, Kemnebi attempts to counteract that effect or spell with a [[/r 1d20+33 #Counteract]]{+33} counteract modifier.

Control Comatose.name: Control Comatose
Control Comatose.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The vetalarana manipulator spends 10 minutes to take psychic control of the creatures they've rendered comatose with Drain Thoughts. This has the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell, but lasts for up to 6 hours, has a range of 1 mile, and the vetalarana can control a number of comatose victims at a time equal to half the vetalarana's level. A comatose victim can't resist this possession and automatically gets a critical failure on its saving throw against Control Comatose.

As long as a comatose victim is controlled by a vetalarana manipulator in this way, the victim's stupefied and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions are temporarily suppressed.

Deflect Attack.name: Deflect Attack
Deflect Attack.description:
Requirements Kemnebi is aware of the attack, isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and has a hand free

Trigger Kemnebi is the target of a physical ranged attack or ranged spell attack

Effect Kemnebi gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, Kemnebi has deflected it. He can't use this reaction to deflect unusually massive ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

Drain Thoughts.name: Drain Thoughts
Drain Thoughts.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within Kemnebi's reach

Effect Kemnebi seizes a creature and consumes its memories. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and Kemnebi regains [[/r 35[healing]]]{35 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Draining Thoughts from a creature that's already stupefied doesn't restore any HP to Kemnebi but increases the victim's stupefied value by 2. Additionally, Kemnebi views one of the victim's memories and can choose to alter, enhance, or erase the memory he views as 4th- level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Modify Memory}.

A victim's stupefied condition value decreases by 1 every week.

A victim who becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 5} in this way is rendered comatose, becoming permanently unconscious. As long as Kemnebi lives, a comatose victim can't regain consciousness, and its stupefied condition doesn't decrease.

Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Kemnebi makes two claw Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. Kemnebi applies his multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

Paralyzing Claws.name: Paralyzing Claws
Paralyzing Claws.description: Any living, non-mindless creature hit by Kemnebi's claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Key to all locks in Cerulean Glade.name: Key to all locks in Cerulean Glade

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If Rumin rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

Susceptible to Mockery.name: Susceptible to Mockery
Susceptible to Mockery.description:
A character can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} Rumin by mocking the fact that he hasn't yet been turned into a vampire. On a success, in addition to the normal effects, Rumin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} on a critical success), but on a critical failure he becomes enraged and gains a +1 status bonus to Strikes and damage rolls against foes for 1 minute, during which time he can't be mocked further.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.APJJCYdq4gNe0PF4]{Effect: Susceptible to Mockery (Critical Failure)}

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Rumin's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

equipment-Blaanlool.name: equipment-Blaanlool
equipment-Blaanlool.publicNotes:
Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants are hideous in appearance indeed, with fishlike mouths, slimy gray-green skin, and dark, beady eyes. They prefer to eat the flesh of those they slay in battle, but many are also cannibals. It is perhaps this vicious behavior that keeps the creatures in check, for if a fellow marsh giant becomes too dangerous and powerful, it runs the risk of being ambushed and consumed by its clan.

Marsh giants are insular and mysterious, dedicating much of their lives to zealous worship of sea-dwelling deities or stranger entities. While there is no central religion followed by all marsh giants, many are known to venerate the demon lord Dagon, while others worship even more powerful monstrosities from the Elder Mythos, such as distant, dreaming Cthulhu.

Only rarely do more than a dozen marsh giants settle together in a location, but when they do it is often for a religious purpose. Whatever call from the deep draws them together also tugs at nearby creatures such as boggards or skum, who look upon marsh giants in fear and reverence. The grim, terrifying chants and screams coming from such an encampment are a sure sign of terror to come for any other residents of the area.

Barely topping 11 feet tall and 1,000 pounds, marsh giants are small for giants but make up for their relatively diminutive stature with their zealotry.

Hook Shake.name: Hook Shake
Hook Shake.description:
Requirements A creature adjacent to the marsh giant is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in water at least 1 foot deep

Effect The marsh giant uses its gaff to shake the creature back and forth and hold it underwater. The giant attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the target's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success The target takes @Damage[(6d6+14)[piercing]] damage and loses 5 rounds' worth of air if they were holding their breath.

Success The target takes @Damage[(3d6+14)[piercing]] damage and loses 3 rounds' worth of air if they were holding their breath.

Failure The target is unaffected.

Critical Failure As failure, but the giant drops its gaff as well.

Twist the Hook.name: Twist the Hook
Twist the Hook.description: The marsh giant makes a melee Strike with its gaff. If it hits, it twists and yanks the gaff to create an awful wound, dealing @Damage[3d6[bleed]] to the creature.

Compression Tunnel.name: Compression Tunnel
Compression Tunnel.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:46] (legendary) twice to push back the shadows or @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) three times to pierce through the shadows
Compression Tunnel.hazarddescription: This shadow tunnel compresses when creatures pass through.

Shudder.name: Shudder
Shudder.description:
触发 A creature reaches the tunnel's midpoint

效果 The tunnel shudders, knocking creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} unless they succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Compression Tunnel.routine: (1 动作) The tunnel compresses, crushing all creatures in it and dealing @Damage[(4d10+22)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic]). On a failed save, a creature additionally becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape} DC 42).

Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, Pokmit automatically attempts to counteract it, with a [[/r 1d20+29 #Counteract]]{+29} counteract modifier.

Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description: Pokmit unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of cold. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]). The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:44] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

Pike Master.name: Pike Master
Pike Master.description: Pokmit's longspear reach increases by 5 feet until the start of his next turn, and he makes a single longspear Strike against any number of creatures. These attacks count toward Pokmit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

Pokmit's Discernment.name: Pokmit's Discernment
Pokmit's Discernment.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Pokmit sizes up the defenses of a creature within 30 feet; he must know the creature is near, but need not be able to see it. Until the start of Pokmit's next turn, Pokmit's attacks against the target ignore any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: Pokmit has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons he wields.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

Ruinous Weapons.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Pokmit uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and greater frost weapons runes. (These bonuses are included in his statistics above.)
Ruinous Weapons.name: Ruinous Weapons

equipment-Shabti Votary.name: equipment-Shabti Votary
equipment-Shabti Votary.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. mental and possession

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental and Po.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental and Possession

Discerning Aura.name: Discerning Aura
Discerning Aura.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

All undead within the aura glow blue, shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius. Visible undead can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} while affected by this aura. Invisible undead are concealed while affected by this aura, rather than being undetected.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.mo4IRyv7GGRBJihU]{Effect: Discerning Aura}

Gird in Prayer.name: Gird in Prayer
Gird in Prayer.description:
Trigger An ally within the shabti votary's aura is the target of a death, mental, or possession effect

Effect The shabti votary girds their ally in protective prayers. The triggering creature gains a +2 status bonus to saving throws against death, mental, and possession effects until the beginning of the shabti votary's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.VLOvyQiZKeXppS2L]{Effect: Gird in Prayer}

Immortal.name: Immortal
Immortal.description: Shabtis don't age naturally and can't die of old age. Spells and effects that cause aging still affect a shabti as normal. They also can't be turned into undead.

Cremate Undead.name: Cremate Undead
Cremate Undead.description: A shabti votary's positive energy sets undead alight. When a shabti votary uses a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell to damage undead, each undead that takes damage also takes persistent fire damage equal to the spell's level.

Expand Aura.name: Expand Aura
Expand Aura.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The shabti votary focuses their will, expanding the area of their discerning aura by 20 feet for 1 minute. This expansion is cumulative with other uses of Expand Aura.

equipment-Shabti Votary.publicNotes:
Shabti votaries are devout clerics of Pharasma who heal and protect their allies while destroying enemies of their faith. Although shabti votaries focus primarily on destroying undead, they remain a potent enemy against living foes.

Shabtis are facsimiles of the rich and powerful, patched together from shards of other souls and offered as a sacrifice to the Boneyard to suffer for the sins of their creator. Shabtis are unaware they aren't the person they emulate, and most spend an eternity enduring the punishments owed to another while the soul they emulate escapes judgement. Some shabtis discover their nature and often become adrift, drowning in the feelings and memories of their foul creator, with no true purpose and identities of their own.

Electrified Gate.name: Electrified Gate
Electrified Gate.hazarddescription: A warded metal gate electrocutes anyone who touches the gate without pressing the bypass button.

Electrocution.name: Electrocution
Electrocution.description:
触发 A creature touches the gate directly or with a tool

效果 The trap deals @Damage[(8d10+40)[electricity]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic]).

Electrified Gate.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:47] (legendary) to destroy the ward, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 47) to counteract the ward, or press the bypass button
Electrified Gate.reset: The trap resets automatically if triggered, after 1 minute if the bypass button is pressed, or after 15 minutes if disabled or counteracted.
Electrified Gate.stealthdetails: (master) or @Check[perception|dc:50|traits:secret] (legendary) to notice the bypass button hidden in a skull's eye socket

equipment-Iron Taviah.name: equipment-Iron Taviah
equipment-Iron Taviah.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: Iron Taviah adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Passwall}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

Magaambya Scar.name: Magaambya Scar
Magaambya Scar.description: Taviah has an old injury that sometimes causes her pain. A physical attack on Taviah that scores a critical hit exacerbates the injury in her wounded leg; in addition to the other effects of the critical hit, Taviah is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
Bonds of Iron.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Iron Taviah can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring from nothingness around a target at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, Taviah gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Taviah doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature Escapes (DC 24), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it; the cage has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Iron Taviah can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed, or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Ritual Specialist.name: Ritual Specialist
Ritual Specialist.description: Iron Taviah has a +2 circumstance bonus to the primary checks to perform a ritual. In addition, she can reduce the number of secondary casters for a ritual by 1. When she does, she must fulfill any requirements for the secondary caster, and she attempts the secondary check normally performed by that secondary caster. She can't replace a secondary caster who is the target of the spell (as in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual).

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Scattered Coven.name: Scattered Coven
Scattered Coven.description: When the characters meet Iron Taviah, the Graveclaw is at the height of its power. As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Taviah the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-level occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse Of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}.

Overwhelming Ectoplasm.name: Overwhelming Ectoplasm
Overwhelming Ectoplasm.description: An ectoplasmic amalgam's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune. A creature damaged by an ectoplasmic amalgam's Strikes is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save, as the thoughts and emotions of the amalgam's constituent souls invade their mind.

Pummeling Barrage.name: Pummeling Barrage
Pummeling Barrage.description: The ectoplasmic amalgam attempts a melee Strike against each enemy within the amalgam's melee reach. Each attack counts toward the amalgam's multiple attack penalty but don't increase the amalgam's penalty until it has made all its attacks.

Spew Ectoplasm.name: Spew Ectoplasm
Spew Ectoplasm.description: The ectoplasmic amalgam releases a burst of ectoplasm that deals @Damage[16d6[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic]). On a failed save, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2} on a critical failure). Spew Ectoplasm functions as a force effect for the purposes of affecting incorporeal creatures. The ectoplasmic amalgam can't use Spew Ectoplasm again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spew Ectoplasm]]{1d4轮}.

Chug.name: Chug
Chug.description:
Requirements The brewer is holding a flagon of ale

Effect The brewer Interacts to quickly quaff the flagon's contents. For 1 minute, the brewer gains a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks, damage rolls, and saving throws against fear, but becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zBbmuudbWY8FaOwZ]{Effect: Chug}

Hasty Impediment.name: Hasty Impediment
Hasty Impediment.description:
Requirements The brewer is adjacent to a barrel, crate, chair, table, or similar wooden object

Effect The brewer heaves the object up to 15 feet and it breaks, sending splinters in a @Template[burst|distance:5]. Each creature in the area of splinters takes @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic]), and the area becomes difficult terrain.

Shadow Leydroth.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic
Shadow Leydroth.name: Shadow Leydroth
Shadow Leydroth.publicNotes:
In ancient times, a cabal of primalists imbued an amalgam of beasts with both supernatural might and a hatred of magic itself, hoping to achieve a potent weapon for use against arcane spellcasters. Effective beyond expectation, the first leydroths broke free and turned on their creators. Worse, the leydroths bred true, and these reclusive predators have long outlived their original creators.

Leydroths look like distorted, apelike felines with many-branching horns growing from the backs of their heads. Their thickly muscled limbs end in glowing claws.

Magic Sense.name: Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: The leydroth detects the source and school of each source of magic within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.

Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
Slink in Shadows.description: The Shadow Leydroth can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Menace to Magic.name: Menace to Magic
Menace to Magic.description:
触发 A creature within 60 feet Casts a Spell

效果 The leydroth attempts an @Check[intimidation] check to counteract the triggering spell.

Dispelling Roar.name: Dispelling Roar
Dispelling Roar.description:
The leydroth unleashes a bestial roar that reverberates within a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. It rolls an Intimidation check and compares the result to the Will DC of each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}.

It also uses this result to attempt to counteract each spell or magical effect in the area, plus one item or effect on each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}.

The leydroth can't use Dispelling Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dispelling Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dispelling Strike.name: Dispelling Strike
Dispelling Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The leydroth hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a Strike

Effect The leydroth casts its innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, targeting one effect on the creature struck.

Spell Feedback.name: Spell Feedback
